loans.name: Positivas Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en el decimo segundo ciclo.
 Entre las integrantes se encuentra la Sra. Jacinta P. 42 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos se dedica en la venta de grasa en las panaderías de la zona.
Ella  se encarga de comprar y elaborar las grasas en su casa de acuerdo a la cantidad que solicita cada panadería. 
Es una señora muy sacrificada ya la actividad de compra y elaboración lo realiza ella sola, por ejemplo ir a comprar del supermercado que se encuentra a unos kilómetros de su casa adelante.   
 Además ella cuenta con una despensita donde invierte sus ganancias.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de gran cantidad de materia prima para elaborar la grasa.
texts.en:
The Positivas Group is in its 12th loan cycle. Among the members is Jacinta, who is 42 years old and has 4 children. She sells cooking fat to the bakeries of her region. Jacinta is a very sacrificing woman who does all her own buying and selling activity. She buys her supplies from a supermarket some kilometers from her house. Jacinta can count on a small larder where she invests her earnings. Jacinta is requesting a loan to buy a large quantity of primary ingredients to make cooking fat.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING PRIME MATERIALS TO MAKE COOKING FAT FOR LOCAL BAKERIES

loans.name: Abigael

texts.en:
Abigael M. M. is 27 years old, married and has one child aged 20 months. Her business is located in Makadara, in a residential area opposite a busy road near the town council office, and is well-known by the name Unique Hair Salon. She serves local women by doing their hair. She also sells braids, hair weaves and hair relaxers to the local women. 

Most of her customers are repeat customers, although she also has some walk-in customers. She has been in this business for the last four years and she says the business is profitable. She says that the business is very good and the only major challenge she has is business space. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to ensure that her business is doing well. 

She is taking a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to boost her stock of braids, chemicals and weaves to meet the needs of her customers. In the future, she sees herself building her own house, educating her child and having a very happy family. She describes herself as hardworking, ambitious and determined.

loans.use: Hair additions (braids), relaxers and hair treatments

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma D. is from the village of Brgy. Abinganan, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 40 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Alma owns and operates a  general store, selling both food and daily use products to the local community. Alma has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Alma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Alma is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Alma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Oeth

texts.en: Mrs. Oeth C., who was born in 1976, lives in Poun village, in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a one point five-hectare plot of land. She cultivates rice that she sells in order to support her family. She is also a basket maker. Her problem is that her field has infertile soil and it has a lot of insects. So to improve production, Mrs. Oeth C. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and with rest of the loan she wants to rent a plowing machine to plow her field. Her husband, Mr. Nat Ses, is a furniture maker. Through those activities, they support four children: two of whom are attending school, while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Hermelinda tiene 51 años, vive con su esposo y sus 6 hijos en su casa  propia. Toda su vida se ha dedicado en las tareas del campo, pero hasta algunos años optó por intensificar la actividad ganadera, es así que tiene ahora vacas en su establo, que cuida con mucho empeño, convirtiéndose en una actividad familiar. Sin embargo no deja de cultivar papa, olluco, oca, trigo y pastizales, éste último le sirve de forraje para sus animales. Esta muy habituada a las tareas del campo  desde su niñez y disfruta realizar estas tareas porque le permite  tener el alimento disponible para su familia. Para el futuro desea mejorar la infraestructura de su establo, así como su producción agrícola. Es su séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is 51 years old. She lives with her husband and their six children in their own house. All her life she has worked the land, but some years ago she chose to intensify her ranching activity, and that is how she now has cows in her stable, which she cares for with much effort, turning it into a family activity. However, she has not stopped growing potatoes, olluco, oca [two different types of tubers], wheat and pastures; these last fields serve as forage for her animals. She is very accustomed to working the land from her childhood, and she enjoys carrying out these tasks because it allows her to have food available for her family. For the future, she wants to improve the infrastructure of her stable, as well as her agricultural production. This is Hermelinda's seventh loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support because she has always shown responsibility with her payments. She is also grateful to be part of her communal bank because all its members are responsible people and are very united. She thanks the people who will be managers of the loan she is requesting, and it will be very useful to her in her business' progress. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy sacks of manure and fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. Her husband contributes to the family’s basic needs with his earnings as a driver. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has two businesses that she has been operating for the past five years. The first is a retail shop from which she  sells candy, soaps and tea leaves. With her other business she sells charcoal. Previously she cooked flat bread (chapati) and fried dough (maandazi) for sale. In addition she sells fresh water as another source of income. Dzame’s major challenge is seasonality. Her most difficult time of the year is the rainy season when the charcoal supply is low but the demand remains high. Thus she is unable to satisfy her customers' needs.  

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase thirty bags of charcoal to resell through her business. In the future, Dzame hopes to expand her business to include mobile phone charging services.

loans.use: To purchase thirty bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Paola Patricia

texts.es:
Paola Patrica es una mujer joven que genera sus propios ingresos para apoyar el crecimiento de su familia al lado de su cónyuge y sus dos hijos, en las edades de 3 y 7 años, con un negocio de comercializar pantalones, camisas bermudas, calzado, suéteres y accesorios para damas.
Su negocio lo inició hace ya dos años, como una fuente de ingreso adicional para apoyar la gestión de su hogar y lograr menos dependencia económica; inicialmente vendió a amigos y familiares, pero gradualmente adicionó empleados de grandes empresas, eso si atendiendo las recomendaciones de sus familiares y de clientes mediante el sistema de referidos. 
Paola emprendió su vinculación a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo hace más de 6 años y ha logrado con esta organización tener su vivienda en el Megaproyecto Villas de San Pablo, lo cual ha cambiado su expectativa y nivel de vida, y con los créditos que la Fundación le ha financiado, ha logrado aumentar su capital de trabajo y diversificarlo con nuevas mercancías. Su credikiva es el quinto crédito y con él comprará mercancias como calzado y ropa femenina deportiva y elegante para vestir a sus clientes en las fiestas y vacaciones de fin de año. 
Su sueño ahora es ver crecer a sus hijos saludablemente y que en un futuro tengan éxitos, su mayor desafío es la recuperación de su cartera cuando adiciona clientes nuevos, pero últimamente ha logrado mejorar la selección de sus clientes y el comportamiento de su cartera también es mejor, ella espera seguir así,  para que  en un futuro no lejano, logre tener un gran almacén y brindar a sus hijos una educación de calidad y se abran para ellos muchas oportunidades.
texts.en:
Paola Patricia is a young woman who generates her own earnings in order to support her family’s growth.  She lives with her husband, and they have two children, ages 3 and 7.  Her business is selling pants, shirts, shorts, footwear, sweaters, and women’s accessories.

Two years ago she started her business as a source of additional income to support her household and to become less dependent financially.  Initially she sold to friends and relatives.  She gradually added employees from large companies by following the recommendations from her relatives and customers.

Paola started her association with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo over six years ago.  Through this organization she has managed to have her home in Megaproyecto Villas de San Pablo, which has changed her prospects and her standard of living.  With the loans from the Fundación she has managed to increase her working capital and diversify with new merchandise.

This is her fifth Kiva loan.  She will use it to buy merchandise like footwear, women’s sportswear, and elegant clothes for the end of the year parties and vacations.

Her dream now is to see her children grow in good health, and that they have a successful future.  Her biggest challenge is recovering her expenditures when she takes on new customers.  However, she has finally managed to improve the selection of her customers, and her income has also improved.  

She plans to continue this way so that in the near future she will have a large store.  Her plan is also to give her children a quality education so that they have many opportunities.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like footwear, women’s sportswear, and elegant clothes for the end of the year parties and vacations

loans.name: Deginalda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORIWASI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra.Deginalda; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de artesanía, ella cose  mantas, chompas y chalinas de diferentes colores y luego los envía al extranjero, la socia quiere tener un atienda para vender la artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como lanas y mantas.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mrs Deginalda belongs to the “QORIWASI” community bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco in the province and department of the same name.

She is a 39 year-old single mother with 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her craft business.  She sews blankets, sweaters and scarves in different colors which she then sends abroad.  She would like to have a store where she can sell her handicrafts and is requesting a loan so that she can buy materials such as wool and blankets.

She thanks everyone who will help make her dream possible by funding her loan and pledges to make her payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase material such as wool and blankets

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Agé de 38 ans, Monsieur Mamadou C. est marié et père de 2 enfants, il réside avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle avec ses parents et ses frères à Wayerma, un des quartiers péripheriques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Mamadou C. a grandi dans le domaine de la Quincaillerie puisque c’est le seul métier  de la famille depuis le temps de son père. Donc il connaît la quincaillerie en détail mais les moyens lui font défaut pour pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter. Il décida alors de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son deuxième prêt, le précédent ayant été remboursé par anticipation. Alors ce présent prêt lui permettra d’acheter 15 boîtes de peinture de 4kg, 14 cartons d’ampoule économique et quelque unités de colle, de baguettes, de fil, d’eau de javel, de grésil, de disjoncteur, etc. Ses achats sont faits au Ghana et en Côte d’Ivoire avant de les revendre en détail dans sa quincaillerie à une clientèle composée généralement de constructeurs de maison (architectes, entrepreneurs, maçons, etc.).
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 270 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mamadou C., 38, is married with two children, he lives with his wife and children in a large traditional family with his parents and brothers in Wayerma, an outlying district of the city of Sikasso (third regional administration of the Republic of Mali).
Mamadou C. grew up in the business of hardware, since his father started this family business. So he has a very good knowledge of the business, but he does not have the means to respond to the growing demand of his customers. He decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and from them he is receving his second loan; the previous one has been fully repaid. This loan will allow him to buy 15 paint cans of 4kg each, 14 cartons of energy-saving bulbs and some units of glue sticks, yarn, bleach, sleet, circuit breaker, etc.. His purchases are made in Ghana and Ivory Coast and he resells the products in detail in his hardware store to customers, generally home builders such as architects, contractors, masons, etc..
He expects to make through this loan a monthly profit of 270 000 FCFA which will be used primarily to improve his business, to contribute to family expenses and to pay interests on the loan.

loans.use: To purchase household goods

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela C. is from the town of Surallah. She is 54 years old. Manuela is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Manuela owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Manuela also raises pigs for fattening. She sells pork meat to their community. Manuela dreams to have her own car someday. She says nothing is impossible if you work hard for it.

Manuela joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Manuela has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Manuela is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pig feeds.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and pig feeds.

loans.name: Teresia Wanjiru

texts.en:
Teresia has practiced dairy farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years. She is 58 years old. Her husband passed on and she is taking care of her three children by herself. 

Teresia was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her fourth loan. She plans to use this loan to buy a dairy cow. She paid all her previous loans well and on time. In the future, Teresia wants to start farming, which will increase her income.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham B. is from the village of Poblacion 1 in Oroquieta City. He is 35 years old. Abraham is married and has a baby. To make a living, Abraham runs a barber shop in his local community. Abraham has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Abraham joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Abraham has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from GDMPC. Abraham is requesting a new loan of 19500 PHP which will be used to purchase supplies that he needs to expand the services that he provides. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Abraham from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for his barber shop

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel, de 29 años, está casada con Percy, de 30 años de edad. Ambos tiene 2 hijos: Ronaldo, de 8 y Jair, de 2 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en una casa alquilada, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. Está exitosa mujer se dedica a la siembra de papa, arveja y habas, hace ya 19 años. Lo que más le gusta a ella es poder, salir al campo desde las primeras horas del día a cuidar de sus cultivos, los cuales ahora está creciendo sin mayores inconvenientes; pues augura que está próxima cosecha obtendrá buenas ganancias en sus ventas en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, donde lleva a vender su producción. Ahora ella está trabajando duro para poder cosechar su cultivo de papa, y después orientar sus ganancias hacia los estudios de sus hijos. Es el sexto crédito con MFP, y espera salir adelante en compañía de los integrantes de su banco comunal, que son personas trabajadoras. De obtener el crédito solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de 2 sacos de semilla de arveja, para su próxima siembra.
texts.en: Raquel, age 29, is married to Percy, who is 30 years old. Together they have 2 children: Ronaldo, age 8, and Jair, age 2. As a family, they live in a rented house, located in the community of Cumutay. Raquel is a successful woman who has worked growing potatoes, peas and beans for the past 19 years. What she likes most is going out into the fields early in the morning to care for her crops, which are now growing without significant problems. This means that after the coming harvest, she will likely obtain good profits from her sales at the wholesale market in Tarma, where she takes her produce to sell. She is now working hard so that she can harvest her potato crops, and she will later use her earnings for her children's education. This is her sixth loan with MFP, and she hopes to get ahead in the company of the members of her communal bank, who are hard-working people. When she obtains the loan she is requesting, she will invest in buying 2 sacks of pea seeds for the upcoming planting season.

loans.use: Buying 2 sacks of pea seeds

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
Soun S., age 41, is married and has three children living at home with her in Takeo Province. She runs a grocery store, typically making US $8.00 each day. Her husband, Say Kin, sells pigs and chickens and typically makes about US $12.00 each day. 

Soun S. would like a loan of US$1200 to expand her grocery store. She will also give some money to her husband so he can improve his business.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store.

loans.name: Bahaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old and lives with two other family members.

In 2009, Bahaa decided to open his own business. He opened a music record store in his local area where competition is minimal. He is well known and has a good reputation.

He is requesting a $1,200 loan to decorate his shop. He is planning to grow bigger in the future and increase his profits.

loans.use: To decorate his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. Mao H. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Sophea Chea, have four children: one son and three daughters. One has full-time employment in Phnom Penh, two are in school and the other one is still young.

Mao sells fruits. She also has a new farming business. Her husband has been a chef for seven years. Mao asked for a Kiva loan once before. She is now asking for another loan of $1,000 to purchase seed fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.use: To use for farming

loans.name: Leonila Gerardina

texts.es:
La Señora. Leonila U. es socia del banco comunal Damas Responsables, vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es hermosa por su centro histórico, por sus 4 ríos que la bañan, su naturaleza, su gastronomía, su gente y sus tradiciones.

La Señora Leonila tiene 56 años, es casada y tiene una hija que ya  es casada. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en la casa de su hija con quien comparte los gastos, viven arrendando.

Nuestra amiga se dedica a tejer sombreros de paja toquilla, esta actividad la desempeña hace 2 años, este oficio lo aprendió desde muy niña ya que sus padres trabajaban en esta actividad.

Es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada  por su cuñada, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de paja toquilla para la elaboración de sus sombreros. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Leonila U. is a member of the Communal Bank “Damas Responsables” (Responsible Women). She lives in central Cuenca, a beautiful city that is known for its historical center, the four rivers that surround it, its natural surroundings, its cuisine, its people and their traditions.

Sra. Leonila is 56 years old, married, and has a daughter who is already married. She does not own a home, so she lives with her daughter and helps with the expenses. They live in a rental property.

Leonila sells Panama hats and has been in this business for two years. She learned this trade as a young girl since her parents worked in the same type of business.

This is the first loan she is receiving from the Communal Bank after being invited to join by her sister-in-law. The money from the loan will be invested in the purchase of palm fibers used for making Panama hats. Her dream is have a house of her own.

loans.use: To purchase palm fibers used for making hats.

loans.name: Elmira's Group

texts.en:
Elmira A., 21, is the leader of this group and resides in the town of Nookat. She is not married, but lives with her father and two of her brothers, the oldest of whom teaches and the youngest serves in the army. A long time ago the family used to breed cattle, but soon her father earned enough to purchase a car and start driving a cab. It’s the main source of income for the entire family. 

Elmira herself works as an interpreter of the Chinese language and would like to ask for a loan to pay for her studies. She would like to successfully graduate and visit China in the future. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to pay for her study of the Chinese language

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Growth is very important in business as in life in general. Lourdes C., a CCT* community partner, sees its value in her life. At 57, she has some college learning to look back to, but what helps her a lot with her business now is her involvement in the entrepreneurial trainings and Bible studies in CCT. 

Lourdes is married to Bonifacio, and together they have three children. Their family resides in Dasmarinas, Cavite.

Lourdes is part of the food industry on the local level. She sells smoked fish and dried fish along with cold cuts and frozen food. Because her sales depend on the demand of her regular customers in the community, her income varies every month, but it averages roughly PHP 11,300.

With no employees to help her, Lourdes has been working perseveringly for ten years now.

A loan worth PHP 20,000 is deemed necessary for Lourdes to help her grow her business. She then applies for such, intending to use the money to purchase more quantities of in-demand food such as frozen food and smoked fish. She wants to do this so that she will not run out of stocks in case her customers order more than what they usually buy.

It is difficult for Lourdes to face the months of vacation, because then her sales drop low. But she strives to come up with strategies to make her business continue gaining profits even during vacation. She aspires for continuous improvement in her business and increasing growth in profits because her family depends on it for their daily needs. 

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more quantities of dried fish and frozen food

loans.name: Siguidolo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Siguidolo, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 41 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Nalla, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’habillements, de condiments et de tubercules.                                                                                                                                 
Les femmes du groupe Siguidolo sont à leur premier prêt solidaire.  MAH C. compte acheter des habillements avec les grossistes de Fana pour les revendre sur place au village et dans les environnants au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  15000 F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses liés à ses enfants et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the Siguidolo group are all married women who average 41 years of age and six children each. They all live in extended traditional families in the village of Nalla, subprefecture of Fana, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

They know one another as neighbors, and through ties of kinship and friendship. They sell clothing, condiments, and tubers. This is their first group loan. 
MAH C. plans to buy clothing from Fana wholesalers for resale on site at the village and in surrounding areas, for cash or credit, to a customer base composed of both men and women.

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 15,000 FCFA, which she will use to make loan repayments and to cover expenses incurred for the children. Any remainder will be reinvested in her business activity.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 50 years old and married with two children. For the past 13 years, she has run a firewood business in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Fe is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP from NWTF to purchase more firewood to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell

loans.name: Sergio J Dolores

texts.es:
El señor Sergio tiene más de 11 años dedicándose a la albañilería, trabajo con el cual mantiene a su  esposa y a sus dos hijos, situación que no había sido un problema hasta que el señor Sergio se quedo sin herramienta de trabajo, por lo cual está solicitando un préstamo con nosotros para comprar dicha herramienta debido a que no cuenta con el capital para comprarlas  y no desea que por no poder adquirir nuevas herramientas de trabajo la estabilidad económica de la familia se venga abajo. Así que el señor Sergio con la nueva herramienta que desea adquirir piensa hacer más trabajos de albañilería al mes para generar más ingresos para la familia así como también para poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Debido a esto él se compromete a pagar este crédito con sus ingresos como albañil en el tiempo acordado.
texts.en:
Sergio has been working as a bricklayer for over 11 years; he supports his wife and two children with this work.  This situation hadn’t been a problem until he found himself without any work tools.  

This is why he’s asking for a loan to buy tools because he does not have the capital needed to buy them and he doesn’t want his family’s economic stability to crumble for lack of tools with which to work.  Sergio plans to use the tools he intends to get to do more bricklaying work per month to generate more family income as well as to provide a better quality of life for his family.  

Because of this he commits to repay the loan with his income as a bricklayer in the agreed upon time frame.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 61 years old and lives in Panalsalan, Plaridel.  She is married with 7 children.

Gloria works in the fish industry and both catches and sells fish for a living.  She has been doing this for 20 years.  She has requested a loan to purchase equipment for her fish cages.

Gloria has been a member of PMPC for 10 years.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her fish cages

loans.name: Cecilia Rosalia

texts.es:
Cecilia Rosalia tiene 26 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los dos hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz..

Cecilia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es seguir adelante con el trabajo y tener ingresos para dar el estudio a los hijos.

En los tiempo libres se dedica a pasar con los hijos y limpiar la casa.
texts.en:
Cecilia Rosalia is 26 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos.

The community bank VRC San Francisco de Sibimbe is located in the Sibimbe precinct in the Ventanas canton.  It has 20 members who work in short cycle agriculture planting corn and rice.

Cecilia works in agriculture and plants corn and rice.  She makes purchases in Ventanas every month and sells them in the market in that same town.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides.  The support of the loan will help her family financially meet this needs.  Her dream is to continue with her work and have the income to give her children an education.

In her free time, she spends time with her children and cleans the house.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Monica Vanesa

texts.es: La señora Mónica es cliente antiguo de la institución  ella vive en la zona de Bolonia en la casa de sus papas, ella tiene un pequeño hijito al cual esta criando sola ya que por el momento se encuentra separada de sus esposo, la Sra. Mónica tiene el sueño de volver a su pequeña tienda en un almacén ya que por la zona no existen muchas tiendas, su Mama es la que más le apoya ella tiene su pensión en Kupini y quiere ver  a su hija con su negocio ya establecido es por eso que pide el préstamo para la compra de mercadería para surtir su tienda con variedad de productos, como dulces, abarrotes, refrescos, y galletas, es una persona muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mónica is a longtime client of the institution.  She lives in her parents’ house in the Bolonia zone.  She has a young son.  She is raising him alone because at the moment she is separated from her husband.

Mónic dreams of returning to her small store.  There are not many stores in the area.  Her mother is the one who supports her the most.  She has a boarding house in Kupini.  She wants to see her daughter with an established business.

That is why she is asking for a loan to buy merchandise to stock her store with a variety of products.  She will buy things like sweets, groceries, soft drinks, and cookies.  

She is a person who is very grateful for the support that has been given to her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in order to stock her store with basic needs products.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 36 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is married and has a bachelor’s degree, and her husband is an accountant. They have three children ages four to sixteen, all of whom are attending school.

For five years now Regina has been running a grocery shop where she sells many items like rice and soap, among other things. She has many customers but her shop is very low in inventory.

Regina is requesting a loan to purchase more goods so as to increase her inventory. She plans to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more goods so as to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 56 years old and lives in Mobod, Oroquieta City. She is married with one child. 

To earn a living, Josephine has a business selling different kinds of viands. She earns about PHP 1,500 each month doing this type of work. Josephine has a requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase meats, vegetables and spices.

Josephine has been a member of PMPC 11 years.  In the future, Josephine would like to have a big restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase meats, vegetables and spices.

loans.name: Anzhik

texts.en:
Anjik was born in 1950 in Berdavan Village, in the area of Ijevan, Armenia. She now lives in Ijevan city with her two sons, daughter-in-law, and grandchild. 

Anjik's daughter is married and lives separately. Anjik's husband works in the Russian Federation and shares his family's expenses.

Anjik is an accountant, and after graduating from the University, she worked in different companies. Anzhik says that salaries of accountants is not high in her region, so she decided to run her own business. 

Since 2006, Anjik has engaged in the clothes trading business in Ijevan’s clothes market. She rents a trading stall in a market and sells women's clothes and shoes that she buys from Yerevan and from neighboring countries. 

Anjik’s son and daughter-in-law help with her trading business so she has enough time to run acounting and bookkeeping for small companies.

Anjik asks from KIVA lenders 750,000 Armenia Drams (AMD) loan to buy an assortment of new clothes for her business.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of new clothes for her business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is divorced and has 6 children. She is a peddler in cloths at Ayensudu near Elmina, which she has done for 15 years. Agnes uses her income to feed, clothe and educate her children. She wants to increase her sales and so needs a loan to purchase more cloths to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to save towards the university education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more cloths to sell.

loans.name: Ramaz

texts.en:
Ramaz is from the village of Chkhenishi. He is 39 years old and married. Ramaz lives with his family; his wife Ketevan, 20-year-old son and 17-year-old daughter. His son is a student in high school and his daughter goes to school. 

Ramaz and Ketevan lead the family's agricultural business and have 6 milk cows. Ketevan produces and sells on average 80 kg of traditional West Georgian cheese per month. The family also grows maize and soybeans on the family-owned 2.5 hectare land. Part of the harvested corn is used for feeding the cows and the other part is sold locally. Total average income of the family is 750 Laris per month. 

Ramaz requested credit to develop a fish farm. He will purchase local species of fish and grow them near a dam. Starting from the spring season, the fish will start to spawn and start intensively selling. Part of the credit will be also used to purchase feed for the fish. 

Ramaz expects that development of the fish farm will raise the income of the family. Part of the increase in income will be reinvested in the same business and the other part will be used for financing his children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase fish and feed for a fish farm.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin, de 52 años, es un hombre bueno y trabajador, convive con su pareja y es padre de dos hijos de 10 y 4 años, quienes dependen de él para su educación. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, en donde comparte junto a su pareja la alegría de criar a sus hijos, quienes son el motivo para salir adelante. Su trabajo consiste en el transporte de pasajeros, por el cual posee un mototaxi que desde muy trempano monta en busca de pasajeros. Es así que recorre las diversas calles de su ciudad, actividad que ha ejecutado durante 10 años y gracias a ello ha logrado darles comodidad a su familia. Manifiesta además que en este trabajo puede disponer de su tiempo para saber que lugar prioriza más movilidad, por ejemplo a la 1pm de la tarde se dirige a los colegios, pues es el tiempo en que sale el alumnado, y durante las 6 pm en los centros laborales o municipios. Con éste trabajo le esta yendo bien, ya que como su mototaxi es propia no tiene que pagar a alguien por el alquiler de una, y eso le genera mas ganancias. Su plan a futuro es comprar dos unidades más, para así ampliar su flota y poder alquilarlas. Este será el crédito número doce con MFP, y está contento con el grupo al que pertenece ya que son muy responsables y siempre cumplen a tiempo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará algunas piezas y enviará su mototaxi al taller mecánico para que le hagan algunas reparaciones, además invertirá para una pequeña tienda que desea instalar en su casa.
texts.en:
Edwin is 52 years old and he is a good and hardworking man. He lives with his partner and he has two children aged 10 and 4 who depend on him for their education. They live together in their own house where he and his partner share the joy of raising their children, who are his motivation for getting ahead. 

His job consists of providing transport and he owns the mototaxi which he sets out on very early in the morning, in search of passengers. He subsequently travels around the different streets of his city, something which he has done for 10 years and thanks to this, he has managed to provide comfort for his family. He also states that in this type of work he can decide what areas to prioritize, for example at 1pm he goes to the schools since the students get out at this time and at 6pm he goes to workplaces or town centers. This job is going well for him as due to the fact that his mototaxi is his own, he doesn't have to pay anyone for rental and this generates more profits. 

His plan for the future is to buy two more vehicles in order to expand and rent them out. This will be the twelfth loan with MFP and he is happy with the group to which he belongs as they are always on time and very responsible. With the requested sum, he will buy some parts and send his mototaxi to the garage for some repair work. He will also invest in a small shop that he would like to open in his house.

loans.use: to buy parts for his mototaxi and take it to the repair shop as well as buying goods for his shop.

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Rin, 42-years-old, is an animal seller. She feed pigs to sell and earns $5 per day. Her husband is a general doctor and earns $10 per day. They have three children, two are studying and the third child is only 1-year-old. Every month, she has to spend $38 on food, $10 on electricity, $15 on school fees, and $25 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy more pigs to feed and sell. She wants to buy more pigs to sell so she can make a good profit and have enough money for her children. She will support them to study in the university.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to feed and sell.

loans.name: Teresa Petrona

texts.es: La señora Teresa Se dedica a la venta D. verdura es cliente antigua D. la institución ella vive en la zona D. Coqueni en su casita propia sus hijos ya son mayores pero ella esta ampliando la casita para dejarles a ellos algo para el futuro D. sus nietos, por tal motivo solicito el crédito para la compra D. material D. construcción para la construcción y ampliación D. su casita, la Sra. Teresa es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia vive en compañía D. su esposo que trabaja como chofer asalariado en un micro, ambos luchan por salir adelante y se sienten agradecidos con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Señora Teresa sells vegetables and is a long-term member of the microfinance institution. She lives in the Coqueni area in her own small house. Her children are all grown-up but she is enlarging her small house so as to leave her grandchildren something for the future. For this reason she is asking for a loan to buy building materials to enlarge her house. Sra. Teresa is devoted to her family and lives with her husband who works as a wage-earning bus driver. They both work hard to get ahead and are grateful to the institution for its support.

loans.use: to buy building materials with which to enlarge her house.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Doña Rosa, comerciante ambulante, por  años sigue con sus ventas, creciendo, ahora esta, en mejores condiciones, ya que hizo bajarete, tapando con plastico negro, cubriendose de la lluvia, sol y polvo. 
Hoy en dia solo vive con su esposo, quien trabaja como cadete de taxi. ya que sus hijos se casaron, siempre apoyandolos en cualqueir necesidad.
Sus ventas han crecido, al incrementar su variedad de productos, con el credito anterior logro comprar carrito de Hog Dog, lo que sus ventas aumentaron.  Hoy con este nuevo financiamiento introducira nueva mercaderia, ya que se acerca la epoca navideña, comprara: juguetes variados, cajas de manzana, cajas de uvas. Que como objetivo tiene mantener el margen de venta, mantener a sus clientes contentos al ofrecer variedad.
texts.en:
Rosa has been a street vendor for years and her sales have grown.  Now she has things set up well since she made a stall, covering it with black plastic for protection against rain, sun  and dust.

These days she lives with her husband who is a taxi driver.  Her children are married and they always help them with whatever is needed.

Her sales have grown with her increase in the variety of products.  With the last loan she was able to buy a hot dog cart and her sales went higher.  She will use this next loan to add new merchandise, especially since the Christmas season is getting near.  She will buy assorted toys, 
and boxes of apples and grapes.   Her goal is to keep her sales margin, and her customers happy with the variety that she offers.

loans.use: to buy assorted toys, and boxes of apples and grapes, since this is a good sales season

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maribel is 40 years old.

Maribel has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Maribel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Maribel has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul has operated his bakery business in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years. He is 25 years old, married to Mary and they have one school-going  child.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing clients and this will be his first loan. He will use it to buy food stuff like wheat flour, catering margarine, and baking tins. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock for use in his bakery and thereby boost his business and get more income.

In the future, Paul hopes to expand his bakery and establish a larger bakery and become one of the best businessmen in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To  buy  food stuff like wheat flour, catering margarine, baking tins .

loans.name: La Bienvenida Group

texts.es:
Beatriz cuenta 20 años de edad, casada tiene 2 hijos el mayor se llama Alex tiene 3 años de edad, y María de Jesús solo tiene 1 año de edad, su esposo se llama natividad es empleado de la empresa “coca cola”.

Ella se dedica al comercio vende colchas, almohadas, sabanas, aparte tiene un puesto de refrescos, ya tiene 2 años con el puesto de refrescos y con la venta de sabanas ella ha sabido sacar adelante el negocio ya que con el puesto de refrescos le ayuda su esposo y así los dos invierten para ayudar con los gastos de la casa, ella ahora invertirá su préstamo en la compra de colchas y sabanas espera que le vaya muy bien. 

Doña Beatriz pertenece al grupo la bienvenida le pusieron así ya que es su primer crédito, el grupo está integrado por 4 personas que a continuación serán mencionadas: María magdalena, Martin, Maurilia y Beatriz todos realizan una actividad comercial como venta de comida, refrescos, juegos, etc.
texts.en:
Beatriz is 20 years old.  She’s married and has two children.  The oldest is named Alex and is three years old.  María de Jesús is only a year old.  Her husband is named Natividad and works for the Coca Cola company.

She sells bedspreads, pillows, and sheets.  She has also had a drink stand for two years.  Between this and her bedding business, she has learned how to move her businesses ahead.  Her husband helps her with her drinks business and in this way they each contribute toward the household expenses.  She will use the money from this loan to invest in bedcovers and sheets.  She expects things to go very well.

Beatriz is a member of the “La Bienvenida” group.  They called it this because this will be their first loan.  The group is made up of four persons who are: María Magdalena, Martin, Maurilia, and Beatriz.  Each runs her own business, such as food sales, drink sales, games, etc.

loans.use: to buy bedcovers.

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Emeliana is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 10 children. 
Emeliana has a shop that sells food seasonings & coconut wine in repacked. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy food seasonings & gallon of coconut wine.
Emeliana has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Emeliana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy food seasonings & gallon of  coconut wine

loans.name: Lomen

texts.en:
Lomen is 60 years old and lives in Catulayan, San Juan, Siquijor. She is widowed with six adult children.

To earn a living, Lomen sells clothes. She earns approximately PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. Lomen has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for one month.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 26 years old. She distributes polythene bags in Voi town. She is a married mother of two children. She has been doing this business for the last one year and she is doing great.

This is Esther’s first business loan from KADET LTD. She plans to purchase more polythene bags to resell to her customers. 

She will use the proceeds to buy a piece of land to construct a permanent house on. She hopes to excel in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more polythene bags.

loans.name: Grupo Xojola Escuela Group

texts.es:
Una mujer perseverante, luchadora y con grandes aspiraciones en la vida es Catarina una señora  30 años de edad con una bonita familia de dos hijos de las edades entre ocho y doce años ellos viven en una comunidad de la aldea Xojolá.
Catarina (la primera del lazo izquierdo en la fotografía)  se dedica a la producción de café, ella lleva 6 años de realizar esta actividad, Catarina eligió esta actividad porque le genera un buen ingreso que le permite darle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.  En estos últimos días ella se ha visto a la necesidad de adquirir un crédito por esa razón es líder del grupo Xojola Escuela, ella solicita un crédito que lo utilizara para el mantenimiento de café. Catarina tiene las esperanzas puestas en este crédito para brindarle a su cultivo su mantenimiento y obtener una buena cosecha.

loans.use: Mantenimiento de café.

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Mrs Magdalene O. is a young woman of 42 years old. She is a dynamic client of LAPO who specializes in the sale of provisions for people in her community. She is bent on improving her business with the above amount.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Mohammad Aqa

texts.en:
Mohammad Aqa S/O Mohammad Anwar is born in 1977 and now lives is District 7 of Kabul City and owns a tailoring shop. He is married and has 4 family members. Mohammad Aqa is educated up to high school because when he newly started the high school the war broke out causing him to stop his studies. After the Taliban Government fell, he decided to start a business and support family financially, so he started a tailoring business.

At the start of his business he really faced problem because his capital was less which resulted in making few clothes in a week. Than he heard about the loan process from one of his friends and decided to take loan. At his first loan cycle he bought a new tailoring machine and in second loan cycle he bought more fabrics and tailoring desk, allowing him to work quick and make more clothes in a week. Now Mohammad Aqa has finished his 4th loan cycle and is trying to get an individual loan for expand his business.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, machine, etc.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta buys alpaca and vicuña wool and spins it herself then uses the yarn to weave shawls which she sells on order. She contracts with someone else to make braid and trim for her. Her children are grown and work to support themselves. Modesta lives and works in the neighborhood of Callapa in La Paz. She has been an IMPRO client since 2005 with a first-class borrowing record, meaning she has a good repayment history. She will use the funds to buy alpaca and vicuña wool. She has work experience and a good record as a borrower and her cash flow will suffice to cover both loan payments and her personal expenses.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Modesta compra lana de vicuña y alpaca. La lana es hilada por ella misma para poder tejer las mantas y para trenzado y flecadura contrata a una persona; sus hijos ya son independientes y trabajan por cuenta propia. Vive en la zona de Callapa de la ciudad de La Paz donde tiene su taller y las mantas que elabora son a pedido. Es cliente de Impro desde diciembre de 2005 Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de materia prima (lana de vicuña y lana de alpaca) Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio. El análisis de su flujo de caja muestra ingresos suficientes para cubrir el préstamo y sus obligaciones personales.

loans.use: To buy alpaca wool.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Business Description

Olga has 10 years of experience in her business. She previously sold poultry, but due to the difficulty of selling chickens, she decided to use the capital she had to set up a shop in her home. She sells all types of items needed for school, as well as sweet drinks and cola. She has her business close to a school where she has access to more customers. She works from 6.30 in the morning until 8pm at night every day, and counts on the help of her daughter with the business.

Use of Loan

Olga hopes to use the loan to buy more snack products like juices, yogurts, crackers, etc. since the location of her business in front of a school means there is a lot of demand for these products.

Personal Information

Olga is 47 years old and is married with 3 children who are all studying. Her husband is a a merchant marine and often away on the boat. He helps with the costs of the school and their home and children. Their house is a one story cement house but is still under construction. Olga aspires to grow with the help of this loan, improving her way of life and allowing a better future for her children.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Olga tiene 10 años de experiencia en el comercio, ella anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de pollo, pero como se puso difícil la venta decidió con el capital que tenía poner un bazar en su domicilio. Ella vende todo tipo de útiles escolares, pañales y colas. Ella tiene su negocio cerca de una escuela lo que le permite captar más clientes. Atiende desde las 6:30am hasta las 20:00pm todos los días. Ella cuenta con la ayuda de su hija para atender el negocio.

Uso del Préstamo

La Sra. Olga desea con el crédito compra productos de confiterías, como cachitos, jugos, chupetes, yogurt, etc. ya que su negocio esta frente de una escuela y tienen la demanda de estos productos en su negocio.

Información Personal

Doña Olga tiene 47 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad que esta estudiando. Su esposo es marino mercante y el pasa embarcado. Su esposo le ayuda con los gastos de la escuela y del hogar de sus hijos. Su casa es de 1 piso de cemento pero aun esta en construcción. Ella aspira crecer con nosotros y a su vez ir mejorando su vivienda y poder brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Improve product inventory

loans.name: Adila

texts.en: Adila is 21 years old, single, and lives in the town of Khachmaz in Azerbaijan. She has been in the jam-making business for a year. She now needs a loan of $950 to buy more fruit so that she can make more jam and earn a higher income.

loans.use: To buy fruits to turn into jam

loans.name: La

texts.en:
Mr. L. La (aged 47) and his wife, Keat Pov (aged 39) got married in 1986. They have three daughters and two sons, two of whom still study in school and two who work in a garment factory. They are requesting their first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $1,000. They will use this loan to purchase three cows, a boat and a fishing net.

Currently, they grow food such as rice and raise chickens and a few pigs. La also does construction work when he can find employment. As is typical here in Cambodia, we met beneath their stilt house in the area that serves as an indoor/outdoor live/work space. La explained that he actually built his family’s home in 1994 using salvaged lumber. The many tunnels and voids gnawed by termites testified to both the decrepitude of the prior dwelling that was the source of the lumber and the imminent need for replacement of this one. When they save enough money, Pov and La said they hope to replace their very modest house with a new one.

La learned to raise cows many years ago before the Pol Pot regime here in Cambodia. Because it is relatively expensive, beef has fallen down the list of sources of protein. Nonetheless, as the economy joins in the growth of the other countries in this region, beef is regaining popularity. Pov and Las's use mosquito netting to protect the animals from murderous bites and have already walled off a space beneath their house to use as a stall.

Pov and La explained that there is a breeder near their village who sells a bovine “starter pack” of sorts – one adult male and one adult female for US $400 each plus one calf free of charge. La and Pov say that it takes one year to raise a cow to maturity. In that time, it will eat approximately $200 worth of food – mostly grass and rice straw. These both need to be purchased due to high population density and to flooding during monsoon season (both factors limiting grazing space). When the cow is mature, they sell it either for slaughter or for further husbandry.

By far the most popular source of protein here is fish. This country is graced with an abundance of freshwater lakes from which Cambodians harvest two-thirds of the protein they consume. La has fished for many years but has never owned his own boat. A used boat and a net will cost them about $200.

loans.use: Purchasing three cows and a boat & fishing net.

loans.name: San Jacinto 1 Group

texts.es: CLARA LUZ TIENE 55 AÑOS, TUVO 9 HIJOS, SU ESPOSO VENDE HIERBAS MEDICINALES QUE SON DE  CONSUMO  DE LOS INTEGRANTES DE SU COMUNIDAD ELLA TIENE INSTALADO EN SU CASA UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES. LAS DEMAS INTEGRANTES TAMBIEN CUENTAN CON UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES A  DIFERENCIA DE  AMALIA QUE VENDE CREMAS, PERFUMES Y COSMETICOS ENTRE LAS INTEGRANTES DE SU COMUNIDAD

loans.use: INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE DISTINTOS PRODUCTOS BASICOS PARA SURTIR LA TIENDA DE ABARROTES.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto Riva is a young 28-year-old man who lives with his wife Nélida Ovando and their child.  Since a young age, Roberto has worked arduously to improve his condition in life.  He began as a traveling salesman, and it was during this time he met his wife.  They worked hard and soon saved enough capital to create their own small business.  Now, with a wife and a child to support, Roberto must work even harder to provide for his family.

Roberto’s business has continued to grow and now gives work to other people in the neighborhood.  He sells various things at their store including clothing and household goods. Roberto is asking for a loan in order to buy more jeans and shirts, bedding, cooking pans, grills, and thermoses.  The Riva’s plan is to continue expanding their business and provide a better life for their son. They hope that their son will someday become a great man and be successful in whatever profession he chooses.

loans.use: To buy jeans, shirts, thermoses, cooking pans, barbeque grills, and bed sheets.

loans.name: Narman

texts.en: Narman L. is a 46-year-old farmer who has raised calves for breeding since 1998. He lives in a small village of Saatli region. He is married and has five children. Narman and his wife are unemployed, and selling calves for meat production is their only source of income. He would like to broaden his business by purchasing three additional calves for an estimated cost of $300 USD each, and by purchasing fodder with the remaining $100 USD. For this purpose, he applied for $1000 USD.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Tep

texts.en:
Mrs. Tep C., 44, is a widow who works selling a variety of vegetables in a busy market and earns around $1 a day of profit. Her son Mr. Sim Soka, 25, is a taxi driver. He earns $10 a day.

Her son wants a loan from Kiva to use with his saving to purchase a new car to replace his old, unreliable car that uses a lot of gas. This will allow him to save in the future and help the family to establish a standard of living. Mrs. Tep C. is pictured with her son.)

loans.use: To purchase a new car.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra, 37 years old and a proud mother of two daughters (10 and 16 years old), owns and operates a small clothing business in her hometown of Batey of Palavé community in San Cristobal.
The entrepreneur humbly explains that while she is currently operating her business from home, she plans to put money asiD. in order to rent or buy a small local store in a few years.  With her loan, Sandra hopes to increase revenue by buying more clothing in bulk to add to her stock.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing in bulk for a small store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of natural medicines to satisfy her customers needs.

loans.name: Dede

texts.fr:
Twenty-five years old, Ms. Dédé T. was born in Lomé, the capital of Togo, and is single. She lives with her younger sister who is going to school. She is an energetic woman who really struggles and who established in 2003 a hair salon called “Coiffure Monte Carlo” in the Adidogomé neighborhood. She manages her salon very professionally with hospitality and high-quality services. This first loan she is seeking will allow her to buy 12 cartons of hair extensions and two bags of hair weaves.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 25 ans, Mademoiselle T. Dédé est née à Lomé, la capitale du Togo et est célibataire. Elle vit avec sa petite sœur qui va à l’école. Elle est une femme dynamique qui se bat beaucoup et a crée en 2003, un atelier de coiffure dénommé « COIFFURE MONTE CARLO » dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Elle gère son atelier avec beaucoup de professionnalisme par son accueil et ses services de qualité. Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 12 cartons de mèche et 2 sachets de tissage.

loans.use: Purchase 12 cartons of hair extensions and two bags of hair weaves

loans.name: Kim Quyên's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ngo Kim Quyen (ID Number 03070052), born in 1973, would like to borrow 1,972,000VND to invest in woodcarving and crafting at home. She lives in Ngoc Loi, Duc Tu, Dong Anh, Ha Noi, Vietnam. Her husband is a carpenter while she is a seamstress earning stable daily income. She has 2 school-going children. Her family's average monthly income is 4,000,000VND (about 250USD). As she is responsible and friendly, she is voted as the group leader even though it is only the first time she joined a group to apply for loans. Her group also consists of:

Mrs. Nguyen Thi Thuan (ID Number 03070053), born in 1978, would like to borrow 1,972,000VND to invest in breeding pigs.

Mrs. P. Thi Hanh (ID Number 03070054), born in 1987, would like to borrow 1,972,000VND to invest in her scrap business.

Mrs. Nguyen Thi Tham (ID Number 03070055), born in 1983, would like to borrow 1,972,000VND to invest in woodcarving.

Mrs. Nguyen Thi Tuyet Nhung (ID Number 03070056), born in 1974, would like to borrow 1,972,000VND to invest in breeding chickens.

Mrs. Nguyen Thi Lua (ID Number 03070057), born in 1986, would like to borrow 1,972,000VND to purchase more begetables to sell.

The total amount requested is 725USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Ngô Kim Quyên, sinh năm 1973(Ms 03070052), mức vay: 1.972.000 vnd để đầu tư làm đồ gỗ tại nhà.Gia đình chị hiện đang sống tại Ngọc lôi, Dục tú, Đông Anh, Hà Nội, Việt Nam.Chồng chị là thợ mộc, bản thân chị là thợ may có thu nhập theo ngày, hai con chị còn nhỏ đang độ tuổi đi học.thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 4.000.000 vnđ/tháng. Chị là người có uy tín, cởi mở, thân thiện nên lần đầu tham gia nhóm vay vốn chị đã được các chị em trong nhóm bầu làm nhóm trưởng.Trong nhóm chị còn có: N. Thị Thuần (Ms 03070053), sinh năm 1978, mức vay:1.972.000 vnđ để Chăn nuôi lợn. P. Thị Hạnh (Ms 03070054), sinh năm 1987, mức vay: 1/972.000 vnđ để đi chợ sắt vụn. N. Thị Thắm (Ms 03070055), sinh năm 1983, mức vay: 1.972.000 vnđ để đầu tư mở xưởng gỗ. N. Thị tuyết Nhung (Ms 03070056), sinh năm 1974, mức vay: 1.972.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà. N. Thị Lụa (Ms 03070057), sinh năm 1986, mức vay: 1.972.000 vnđ để đi chợ rau.

loans.use: invest in woodcarving

loans.name: Ema E.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Ema M.. She is married and has four children aged between two and twelve. In 2000, Ema established her boutique business. Working seven days a week, and nine to twelve hours a day, she earns about 20 USD every month from this business. Ema requires a loan in order to buy more clothes in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; because of this, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan, a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi: Mrs. Ngo Thi T. is 45 years old. Every day her husband does business and she stays at home to raise pigs and look after their children. In 2006, Mrs. T. joined TYM to borrow a loan to invest in her husband's elastic band trading. With the first loan worth VND 3 million, her husband's business became more profitable. At present, with an income of VND 4 million/month, her family's economy is getting more and more stable. For the next loan cycle, she wants to borrow VND 9 million to invest in both pig raising and elastic band trading.

loans.use: invest in both pig raising and elastic band trading.

loans.name: Maricruz

texts.es: Maricruz tiene 19 años, es soltera y vive en la casa Q. sus padres le dejaron.  Se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de fruta en el mercado llamado, Las Mercedes, desde hace ya dos años. Usualmente trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 o 5 de la tarde durante toda la semana, dado Q. Maricruz aun no tiene familia, se dedica íntegramente a su trabajo, el cual le agrada mucho, pero como toda joven desea crecer y superarse, poniendo otro negocio mucho más rentable y estable, ya Q. si bien la venta de frutas es rentable, es difícil para ella tener Q. trasladar la fruta, ya Q. es muy frágil, hay Q. hacerlo con cuidado y muchas veces los golpes al realizar el traslado malogran el producto, haciendo Q. pierda parte de su capital.  Maricruz trabaja mucho para forjarse un futuro mejor, ella quiere ser una joven emprendedora y con un futuro de éxito.  Con el dinero del préstamo invertirá en la comprar de más frutas para mejorar su venta y con las ganancias poner otro negocio adicional Q. la ayude en su economía.
texts.en:
Maricruz is 19 years old, single and lives in the house that her parents left her. She has worked as a mobile fruit seller in the Las Mercedes market for two years. She usually works from 8 o'clock in the morning until 4 o 5 o'clock in the afternoon during the week. Since Maricruz doesn't have a family she dedicates wholly to her work, which she enjoys. However she, like all young people, wants to grow and better herself by setting up another business that is more profitable and stable, since although selling fruit is profitable, it is difficult for her to transfer the fruit since it is very fragile and has to be handled carefully and many times the bumps the fruit receives while being moved damages it and causes her to lose part of her capital. Maricruz works hard to build a better future for herself; she wants to be a young entrepreneur with a successful future. With the loan she will invest in the purchase of more fruit to improve her business and with earnings put up another business to help her with her finances.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of fruit she sells as well as setting up another business

loans.name: Nen

texts.en:
Mrs. Nen N., 57, and her husband, Mr. Yen Sao, 61, who live on an Island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1979 and have six children: two sons and four daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home. One daughter is a weaver and the other two children study in the local school.

Mrs. Nen has been a silk weaver for twenty five years, a skill she learned from her parents when she was fifteen years old. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a motor-taxi driver for twenty years. 

Nen is requesting a loan to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Saroen

texts.en: Mrs. Saroen R. is 24 years old and she lives in Kok Trorp village in Kandal Province. She is employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Kem Sokkorn, is a construction worker who makes a small income to support the household. Even though they have different businesses, they earn little income and they cannot provide a better life for their family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Saroen R. decided to ask for a loan to buy timbers to build a new house for her family. She has a child who is too young to work or study because that child is two years old. Her husband is present on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy timbers to build a new house for her family.

loans.name: Sadriddinkhoja

texts.en:
Sadriddinkhoja K. is a young and energetic entrepreneur who started his own business when he was 17 in order to support his parents. His business is selling glasses and bijouterie in his store, located at the center of the city. This business allows him to support his large family which consists of his wife, parents, two sisters and little brother. 

Today Sadriddinkhoja needs to increase the range of the goods he sells and so is requesting a loan of $1200 for the term of 12 months. This loan will allow him to expand his business, to earn more, and in the future to realize all of his projects.  Be an important part of the growth of Sadriddinkhoja’s business!  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes:  a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R. further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase glasses and bijouterie to expand the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Nkokonjeru-Nalwero Fatuma Group

texts.en:
Fatuma N. (left) is 37 years old. She is a single mother of 2 school-going children. Fatuma is a hard-working and charming business lady. She has 3 years' experience in the retail business. Her shop in Nkokonjeru is stocked with fast-moving consumer goods. Fatuma needs loan funds to replenish her stock of sugar, rice, and flour.

Her dream is to run a general merchandise wholesale shop. The income she earns from her business enables her to care for her children. She hopes that with the expansion of her business, she will be in a position to save money and build a home for her family.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, rice, and flour

loans.name: Aumbe

texts.en:
Aumbe has been selling shoes in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 10 years. She belongs to the Farajika loan group. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. She works at her business every day. She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more shoes for her business. She is hopping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business. 

Aumbe is 35 years old and is married with five children aged 13, 12, 10, and 8 years and a 9-month old baby.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is twenty–seven years old. She is single and lives independently. Mary lives in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Bekwai, close to Obuasi (a gold mining town) in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Bekwai work in commercial activities.

She trades in fresh yam and garments of clothing to make an income to support herself. She procures the fresh yam all the way from Atebubu in the Brong Ahafo Region where the price is quite economical. Mary distributes the yam to retailers and food vendors in her community. She sells the rest from a table top stall in the market square. She has been in business for ten years. Mary wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure tubers of yam in bulk. She hopes to save more money before she enters into marriage.

loans.use: To purchase tubers of yam and garments of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rani Imtiaz Group

texts.en:
Rani baji, 33, is married and lives in Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the past 14 years. Rani baji belongs to a poor family. Her father had a wish to give his children a good education but, unfortunately, this didn’t happen. Rani baji made a promise to herself that she will complete her father’s wish by giving  her own children a good education. She has three children: two sons and one daughter. All of her children are attending school. Rani baji’s husband is I.. He has an animal skin selling business. He sells the skins to the factories to earn an income. He has been in this profession for the past four years. Rani baji operates a sewing clothes business. She does this work to pay for the education expenses of her children, because her husband’s income is very little and hardly meets the household expenses. She is applying for a loan to expand her husband’s animal skin selling business by buying more animal skins.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Hakim baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell. Nasreen baji and Zahida baji each want a loan to buy buffalos for their dairy businesses. Asma baji wants a loan to buy bricks to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy animal skins

loans.name: Nemat

texts.ru: Немат Атакулов мужчина 45 лет. Женат и имеет 3-х детей. Немат занимается откормом и продажей скота, а его жена занимается переработкой и продажей молока. Немат кредитуется уже 2 года. Когда он пришел в первый раз брать кредит, у него было очень малое количество скота. Сейчас у Немата большое количество мелко рогатого скота. Сейчас у его жены только одна дойная корова. Немат планирует купить для своей жены еще одну дойную корову с теленком, и он благодарен нашим кредиторам за помощь в осуществлении его планов.
texts.en:
Nemat A. is a 45 year old man. He is married and has 3 children. Nemat fattens and sell livestock; his wife processes and sells milk. Nemat has been a borrower for 2 years.
