When he came to get a loan for the first time he had a very small quantity of livestock. Today, Nemat has a large quantity of small livestock. Currently, his wife only has one dairy cow. Nemat plans to purchase another dairy cow with a calf for his wife and he will be grateful to our lenders for their help in fulfilling his plans.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey C. lives in Rolus village in Takeo province. She is a Pro Hok (fermented fish paste) seller in the local market. She is also a pig breeder. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets and pig food for her pig breeding business. She hopes to increase income and improve her family living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Kean Moeun, is a farmer who owns a plot of land and cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, he uses the rice to make wine. Mrs. Srey C. is 37 years old and the mother of four children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: Purchasing more piglets and pig food for her pig breeding business.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
“Through hard work, we can be successful and survive the hardship of life,” is a simple statement shared by Magdalena, a resident of Barangay Monguia, Dupax Del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Julio and with their sacrifices, they have been able to send their children to school. Two of them are now college graduates, while the other two are high school students.  

Her husband works as a farmer, while she is engaged in selling snacks, cooked food, and longganisa (processed meat). The loan she would like to request is around PHP 15,000.  This amount will be used to improve her business by acquiring more products that she can sell.  Magdalena chooses to be patient and humble for she believes it will somehow exalt her business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

location.town: Monguia, Dupax Del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Po

texts.en: Po S., 45, lives in Kompong Cham Province, where she has been farming for years in the village. Her husband earns a living as a carpenter. This couple has given birth to five children. Two of their children are employed: a daughter is a seamstress for a garment factory and a son works in construction. Po S. will use this loan to purchase a used motorbike in order to make her family’s transportation easier. She and her husband are pictured at their house.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorbike.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Hardworking and industrious, Norma P. is 66 years old, married with one child, and presently lives at Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Norma joined Paglaum in April 2008 to secure financial assistance for her sari-sari store to buy additional stock such as laundry items, seasonings, goodies, toiletries, drinks and other household items. She aims to have a successful business with a concrete store and have her child finish a college degree and have a good future.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Zulpiyahon

texts.ru: Мамасалиева Зулпияхон проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 53 года. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Зулпияхон по профессии 33 года проработала "учительницей". Муж занимается сельским хозяйством. Сама Зулпияхон имеет торговую точку, где торгует посудой. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Zulpiyahon M. lives in the Tursun-zoda district. She is 53 years old, married and has 3 children. Zulpiyahon had worked as a teacher for 33 years. Her husband is involved in agriculture. Zulpiyahon has a retail store where she sells dishware. She is requesting a loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose sells used shoes in the Oile Market of Kisumu.  She has lived in this city her whole life, and has been running her business for over seven years.  Rose says that her dream is to send her children to school so that they can “finish poverty in the home once and for all.”  She would like to build a house and get some land.  Some of the challenges that she faces are not having enough money to put back into the business and a low supply of shoes ever since the political unrest and resulting violence in 2007 and 2008.  Her stock was stolen or destroyed, and she has had trouble rebuilding ever since.  Her husband is currently out of work, and she provides the sole income for the family.  When asked what is the most important thing she can teach her children, Rose responded by saying, “They need to learn how to run a successful business.”

loans.use: A new stock of shoes to sell

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mr. Mon D. lives in Tuol Trea village in Takeo province. He is a cattle breeder and also a fisherman. His wife, Mrs. Ouk Sary, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. This couple has five children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school while the others are too young to work or stuD.. His wife and children are presented in the photo with him.

Mr. Mon D. is requesting a loan to buy a cow, fishnets, fertilizer, and to hire laborers to work on the rice field. With this loan he hopes to increase their income and improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a cow, fishnets, fertilizer, and to hire laborers to work on the rice field

loans.name: Damen

texts.en:
Damen was born around 1977 in Nablus, a city of Palestine. He is married and is the father of three children.

Damen is a photographer and has made it his primary business. Photography brings in the revenues that helps him earn his living.

However, Damen has need of more funding than he currently has for equipping his photo lab. His aim is to offer a better range of services to his customers and to make more income, thus enabling him to better provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy equipment for his photo lab

loans.name: Ana May

texts.en:
Ana May is 45 years old from the village of Roxas Naguilian, Isabela.  She is already a widow for 19 years and left with their only son who is now 21 years old. Her son did not finish his education due to early marriage.  She hopes that they’ll always be together for they are the only family left with her.

Ana May has been five years managing her retail business. She has a small variety store in their village and this serves as their sole source of income. The income she derives from her business is being used to support herself necessities and other needs of her grandchild. She hopes to maintain the business she has to able survives from life’s difficulties. Ana May  therefore wanted to request to avail a loan amounting to PHP5, 000 to be use as her additional working capital to grow her business. She is hoping that her proposal will be approved because it will quite be helpful to her family.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Gunzen

texts.en:
A. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and six children, age 7 to 18, in the Hovd province of western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, and all of her children attend a local secondary school.

A. operates a business where she sews traditional Mongolian clothes such as deels, or long coats. She began her business in 2000 and has since then become established in the local business community. A. sews a wide variety of deels which can be worn throughout the year. She hopes to become even more successful so that she can provide for her large family in the future.

A. is requesting a 150,000 tugrug loan so that she can purchase more fabric and items such as buttons and trim for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fabric and items such as buttons and trim

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel M., 21 years old is a young farmer from Kapatungan, Trento, Agusan del Sur.  Her main crop is rice. She hopes that farming will provide her entire family income with an adequate supply food, clothing and other basic needs.  She longs for a good life for her family. She also maintains a small business raising pigs.  Aside from having a piggery, she sells used clothing and other items to earn extra income. She sells ready-to-wear products to be able to raise money and save for the education of her two children. 

She is asking for a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm and buy farming necessities to grow her harvest and raise pigs.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is 29 years old and she is now a widow. She has five children. Jayson, 13 years old, is a second-year high school student. Jerry, 11 years old, is a grade four student. Jackson, 9 years old, is a grade three student. And their youngest, Kyla, seven years of age, is a grade one student. They reside in the village of Sta. Maria, Alicia, Isabela, a rural and plain area.
She has been engaged in the general store business for almost two years now. Her daily net income is PHP 200.00, and she's been working patiently to gain a productive income. She desires a loan of PHP 5,000.00 for additional capital for her store. She hopes that KIVA lenders will provide her the loan as soon as possible to be able to maintain the success of her business.

loans.use: Additional capital for her retail store

loans.name: Sokhoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhoeurn V. is a villager in Prey Run village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 0.70-hectare field to cultivate rice. She is also a pig breeder. Since her pig-breeding business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets and pig food. She would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer to support the field. Mrs. Sokhoeurn V. is a widow with two children who are both enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets, pig food and fertilizer

loans.name: Caritina

texts.es:
La señora Caritina  con 55 años de edad esta casada. Su cónyuge tiene 55 años de edad, es albañil constructor. La pareja tiene un hijo mayor de edad, los mismos  viven  en la ciudad de Pilar, en casa propia, en el barrio 12 Octubre de esta ciudad, la residencia cuenta con  todas las comodidades de primera necesidad para el hogar. Dentro del predio de la cas a en un salón funciona un taller carpintería donde se realiza trabajos de todo tipo, desde compostura hasta la fabricación de muebles de muy buena calidad según algunos cliente quienes son de de lugar aledaños como también del extranjero (Argentina). 
Se dedican a esta actividad hace más de 13 años, y cuentan con todos los materiales requeridos para el trabajo dentro de la casa como también para trabajos a domicilio fuera de la misma. Desde que empezó a operar con nuestra institución ha obtenido mejores rendimientos en su tarea ya que siempre les brindamos nuestro apoyo en todo emprendimiento que la señora tenía en mente, es por eso que ella se siente muy agradecida con la Fundación Paraguaya. El apoyo que ella tiene de su familia es fundamental para el desarrollo de su actividad. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar madera para realizar trabajos para una empresa que siempre le realiza pedidos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Caritina is 55 years old and married. Her spouse is also 55 years old and a construction worker. The couple has one child who is of age and they live in the city of Pilar, in their own home, in the neighborhood “October 12.” Their home has all of the basic necessities a home requires. They have a carpenter’s workshop on their property where they do all sorts of work from repairs to making furniture, which according to customers (who come from the area and abroad like Argentina), is of high quality. They have been doing this for more than thirteen years, and have all of the necessary materials for work inside the home and outside. Since they started working with our organization, they have obtained better yields for their work since we always offer our support in all enterprises the Mrs. has in mind. This is why she is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya. The support she receives from her family is also fundamental to the success of her business. She is asking for a loan to buy wood to do jobs for a company that always orders from them.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood to make furniture.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Nuestra socia MARITZA tiene 35 años, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos que todavía dependen de ella: Maika tiene 15 años,  Ana Lucia tiene 11 años, José Daniel tiene 11 años y Coraima tiene 9 años ellos todavía estudian en el colegio.          

La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el negocio de venta de pan. La socia tiene su propio puesto de trabajo en los alrededores de la plaza de armas de Urcos. Ella nos cuenta que desde muy niña ayudaba a su mamá a elaborar el pan y los vendían todos los días pero ahora ella es independiente. Ella alquila un horno con varias compañeras de negocio y ahí preparan sus propios panes. Ella y sus compañeras desde hace 2 años atrás se les ocurrió crear un panteón especial que lo llamaron “chuta navideña” que tiene las mismas características del pan chuta (Pan redondo blando con un olor peculiar y es un pan gigante) pero le agregaron pasas y frutas. La socia y sus compañeras de negocio solo preparan este pan “Chuta navideña” para las fiestas de navidad. Ya son varios años que tiene el negocio de venta de panes chuta y le ha ido muy bien, gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que a pesar de las adversidades de la vida va a sacar profesionales a sus hijos. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar mas insumos como harina, azúcar, manteca, frutas y pasas para preparar las “chutas navideñas” para navidad y año nuevo ya que por estas épocas es donde se vende más. 

La socia es natural de la ciudad de Urcos de la provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qori Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maritza is 35 years old, married, and has four children who are still dependent on her and are all attending school: Maika who is 15 years old, Ana Lucia who is 11 years old, Jose Daniel who is 11 years old and Coraima who is 9 years old. This partner alternates between household activities and a business of selling bread. She has her own place of work in the surrounding area of the main square of Urcos. She explained to us that since a young age she helped her mother in daily activity of making bread and selling it, although today she is working independently. She rents an oven along with other fellow business persons and this is where they make their bread. Two years ago, she and her colleagues decided to create a special type of bread that they named "chuta navideña" which has the same characteristics of the flat bread named 'chuta' (a large, soft, round bread with a specific smell) but with the addition of fruits. This member and her business colleagues only prepare this "Chuta navideña" for the christmas holidays. They have been selling this type of bread for several years, with success, thanks to the effort put into the work. She is a very hard worker and entrepreneur who, despite life setbacks, is hoping to push her children into being professionals. She is asking for this loan in order to purchase consumables such as flour, sugar, butter and fruits in order to prepare the "chutas navideñas” for christmas and New Year's which is the time period when these are sold the most. Martiza is a native of the city of Urcos in the province of Quispicanchis in the department of Cusco and is part of the communal bank named "Qori Orcco" in the Arariwa association. She is grateful for this opportunity and support and promises to fulfil the corresponding payment in time.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase consumable items such as flour, sugar, butter and fruits

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal “COMUZONE” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 45 años, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.
 
Maria es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia y trabaja en la municipalidad del Cusco en el proyecto “Retama” (Referencia tecnológica apropiados para el Medio Ambiente). La socia nos cuenta que en sus horas libres vende vinos que le manda su hija de la ciudad de Ica y por campaña escolar vende mochilas. Ya son nueve años que se dedica al negocio de venta de mochilas y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar mochilas y útiles escolares. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maria belongs to the Comuzone Communal Bank of the Arariwa Association. She is 45, married, and has four children. Maria is a hard-working entrepreneurial mother who gets her family ahead. She works in the Cusco municipality on the Retama Project (a project to get the general population to participate in correct waste management). She tells us that during her free time she sells wines that her daughter, who lives in the city of Ica, sends her. During the school year she sells backpacks. She has been selling backpacks for nine years. It has gone very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She needs the loan to buy more backpacks and school supplies. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy backpacks and school supplies

loans.name: Adalia

texts.en:
Adalia B. is from the village of Guno, Cabilto St., Gingoog City. She is 41 years old. Adalia is married and has 2 school-aged children. Adalia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Adalia has been involved in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Adalia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adalia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Adalia is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Adalia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Guno, Cabilto St., Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire is 29 years old and she is married. She lives in Nyarugenge district where has operated her business of selling clothes for about six years. The hours of her business are from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Claire is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing some other attractive clothing styles to sell as well as additional sizes and colors.

With this loan, Claire hopes to attract more customers to her shop and hopefully earn more profits in the process. This, in turn will allow her and her devoted husband to build a secure future for themselves as well as their future children.

loans.use: To buy other attractive clothing styles to sell as well as additional sizes and colors

loans.name: Che

texts.en:
B. is a widow who has five children. She lives in Ntabessi Nkwen Mezam Division NWR- Cameroon. B. and her entire family live in a house with three rooms. She often has to battle some life challenges, including inadequate funds to pay tuition for her children, ill health, and death of close family members. “Things have really been difficult, even when I try very hard…” she said. 

She has borrowed and repaid four loans since she joined GHAPE in 2003. With previous loans, she grew vegetables. She is planning to expand this business. She is planning to use part of her loan to repair her house. She states that the business of vegetables has been quite successful in the past and she attributes the success to her business location, reasonable prices, good marketing skills and experience, and demand for her produce.  She is optimistic that she will make profit and provide for her family.

About GHAPE:

The Grounded and Holistic Approach for People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses statement, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Farming vegetables, repairing her house,  and buying of land

loans.name: Brigilda's Group

texts.en: Brigilda V. is from the village of Burgos. She is 37 years old and is the group leader of an eleven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Brigilda V.. Brigilda is married and has two school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Brigilda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Brigilda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bou

texts.en: Bou S., 29, is widowed and resides with her two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for fishing and palm products. She is employed in a local garment factory for an income of about USD 2.5 per day. S. is requesting a loan of USD 200 to repair her house. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to pay for her children’s school. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Gade

texts.fr: Gade K. est une femme de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Depuis 5 ans elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KEUR NGALGOU et y a bénéficié successivement de 10 crédits qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés à temps. Elle développe un petit commerce de sucre et de riz et fait parallèlement de l'embouche ovine. Ses bénéfices lui servent à participer financièrement aux différentes charges familiales et à subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Gade K. is a 48-year old woman who is married and mother to six children. For the past five years she has been a member of the Banc Villageois in KEUR NGALGOU and has benefited from ten consecutive loans, all of which she has managed well and repaid on time. She is building up a small business selling sugar and rice and at the same time has a sheep fattening activity. Her profits allow her to contribute financially to the various family expenses and to provide for her personal needs.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finance her project and develop her small business

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en:
Marie Louise is 26 years old and married with one child who is 1 year old.  Marie Louise is well known in her business selling spare parts and this is her second successful year in the business.  Marie Louise works from 8 am to 6 pm every day.

Marie Louise needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company so that she can increase the size of her business by adding a larger quantity of different spare parts. With this loan, Marie Louise hopes that her profit will increase so that she can create some new sources of income as well as create more jobs for the people in her community.

loans.use: To stock a larger quantity of different spare parts

loans.name: Cumbre Del Sol Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio Loma de la cuidad de Caacupé, en este comité cada integrante cuenta con un actividad productiva y que le genere ingreso.
Las integrantes se sienten seguras trabajando en sus propios negocios, lo que comercialmente realizan les ayudan al sustento familiar, para el mejor de sus respectivos negocios ellas reciben la capacitación de las asesoras y de manera cada una realiza una buena planificación.
La señora Norma se dedica a la venta de dulces, y con este negocio ella obtiene buenos ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Ella para elaborar los dulces compra las pulpas de frutas y otros ingredientes que se agregan en el preparado.
Por la calidad de sus productos ya tiene clientes seguros  y vende todo lo que prepara.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva por la ayuda crediticia que les brinda.
texts.en:
The women who belong to the group live in the Loma neighborhood in the city of Caacupé. Each of the members of the group has a productive activity that she uses to generate her own income. The members feel confident running their own businesses, since their businesses help them to support their families. They have all received training from financial advisors in order to improve their respective businesses, and each of them has created a good business plan. Norma, for example, makes a living selling sweets, and this business has allowed her to earn a decent income to help her family. She makes the sweets by purchasing fruit pulp and other ingredients and mixing them together. Norma has many reliable customers because of the quality of her products, and she always sells all of the sweets that she prepares. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the credit help they have offered her.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing raw ingredients such as a large quantity of sugar and pulp from various fruits.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 35 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos en su poder, juntos viven en la comunidad de Sirenachayocc, ubicada en la hermosa selva cuzqueña, donde tienen su propia casa a base de adobe. Para Julia las enseñanzas y lecciones que le dejó su familia han sido de mucha importancia para ella, y por ello les debe mucho. Hoy tiene una tienda de abarrotes, realizando las ventas dentro de su domicilio, en donde la mayoría de sus vecinos acuden a su establecimiento. Sin embargo hubo tiempos de crisis para ella y su familia, cuando en un inicio no le resultó el puesto de comida que antes ofrecía. Con el tiempo y con el apoyo de su esposo se arriesgaron en instalar una tienda y no se equivocaron, ahora obtienen buenas ganancias. Mas adelante desean incursionar en la actividad agraria, cultivando cacao y café, con la finalidad de darle otros ingresos extras, para que así  contrarreste cualquier problema que se le presente en su camino. Generalmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos. Sus planes a futuro es ampliar su negocio en otras localidades ubicadas estratégicamente, con el propósito de captar nuevos clientes. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a pagar de manera puntual, además se siente contento con su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para abastecer su tienda, con la finalidad de poder incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Julia is 35 years old. She is married and is raising three children. They live together in the community of Sirenachayocc, located in the beautiful jungle of Cuzco, where they have their own house made of adobe. For Julia, the lessons and learning her family left her have been very important, and for this she owes them a lot. Today she has a grocery store, selling from her house. Most of her neighbors go to her establishment. Nonetheless her family went throuh some crises, when at first selling food that she offered before didn't work out. With time and with the support of her husband, they took the risk of setting up the store and it wasn't a mistake- now they make good earnings. In the future, they want to get into agriculture, growing coffee and cacao, in order to have extra income and set aside something for any problem that comes their way. She generally does the work herself, but on ocassions receives help from her children. Her plans for the future are to expand her business to other strategically located locales in order to attract new customers. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she is committed to making the payments on time. She also feels happy with her community group. With the loan she is asking for, she will invest in purchasing a greater quantity of merchandise to supply her store, in order to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to supply her store.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma F. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 58 years old. Wilma has been married to Ubaldo for forty years and now has three children. Her oldest child is aged 36. To make a living, Wilma plants, harvests, and sells rice. 

In 2009, Wilma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This loan will be Wilma's third loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra trabajando dentro del tercer ciclo del programa de comités de mujeres de la Fundación Paraguaya. 
Entre la mujeres de este comité se encuentra la señora Juana A., quien tiene 50  años de edad,  con 2 hijos, quienes se quedan  en la casa mientras ella sale a ofrecer Quiniela (juegos de azar) ya que se dedica a la venta ambulante de juegos de azar, esta actividad lo realiza por la mañana y tarde solo regresa a sus para  preparar  el almuerzo.
Es una señora muy sufrida que tiene un día a día muy pesado  por que al llegar a su trabajo debe de realizar las tareas de la casa y todo lo hace para salir adelante con sus hijos ya que es madre soltera.   
De esta manera ella sostiene los gastos de la casa y de  sus dos hijos que van en la escuela. 
Ella solicita el préstamo para compra de ropas para sus hijos y para otros gastos de la familia.
texts.en:
The committee above is working within its third cycle of Fundación Paraguaya’s women’s program. Among the women of this group is Juana, 50, with two children who stay at home while she sells lottery games. She work in the morning and returns later to prepare lunch for her children. Juana is an enduring woman with a very intense schedule. In addition to her work, she must complete housework and everything else does in order to get ahead with her children as a single mom. This is how she has been able to keep expenses related to her home and to her two children who are in school. She requests this loan to buy clothes for her children and for other family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Clothing and Family Expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 10 zinc sheets, 8 pipelines and 50 stones

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita R. is from the village of Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 45 years old and married with six school-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita sells vegetables and soft drinks in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Carmelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional vegetables and products to sell. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Carmelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie L. is from the town of Banga. She is 27 years old. Annie is married and has 2 young children aged 7 and 6 months. To make a living, Annie owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Annie has been engaged in her business for over 4 years. She says she works hard to be able to save for her children's future.

Annie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annie has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Annie is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies & equipment.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”;  Este banco está situado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco; situado a 45 minutos de la ciudad.

La socia Lidia, tiene 34 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, ella se dedica  a la artesanía, ella elabora diferentes trabajaos y luego los vende, La socia ayuda con este ingreso económico en casa y desea construir su casita, ahora la socia necesita capital de trabajo según manifiesta. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para elaborar la artesanía.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Lidia, 34, lives with her life partner and their three children. She is a craftsperson. She makes various crafts to sell. This income helps meet household expenses. She would like to build her house. According to her statement, she needs capital to buy supplies for her crafts. She is a member of the “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO” (Chinchero New Victory) communal bank located in Chinchero district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. It is 45 minutes from the city. She avails herself of this forum to express her gratitude for the loan and to commit to repay it in a timely fashion

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For crafts supplies.

loans.name: Josianne

texts.en:
Josianne is 29 years old and she is married with two children, ages 7 and 9. Both of her children are enrolled in school. Her husband works in a salon. 

Josianne sells fruit such as tree tomatoes, passion fruit and pineapples. She has had this business for three years. She says that her business is successful because it is very well-known and it is in a very strategic location.  

She will use the proceeds of this loan to buy more fruit to sell. With the profit from her loan, she hopes to open up a second location for her shop. In the future, Josianne hopes that she and her husband will be able to build a home for their family.

loans.use: Fruit to sell

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Francisco Pacheco de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Francisco Pacheco, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.

Aquí conversamos con la señora María, tiene 34 años de edad,  esta separada  y tiene tres hijos todos menores de edad que estudian en escuela y colegio lo que representa una dura carga que nuestra socia a podido sobrellevar gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación.
 
Es auxiliar de enfermería y tiene una pequeña farmacia. Trabaja todos los días, desde las 5am hasta las 22h00, mantiene abierta su farmacia en la cual trabaja desde las 5am hasta las 14h00 ya que en las tardes trabaja como enfermera en una clínica particular, una hermana se hace cargo de la farmacia en las horas que ella no está.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar mas medicinas y así surtir más su farmacia. Este es su quinto ciclo en el Banco y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe.
 
Su sueño es tener su propio local ya que donde tiene la farmacia es alquilado.
texts.en:
The communal bank, Francisco Pacheco, meets every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, in a densely populated urban area. 

Here, we spoke with María, 34, who is separated and has three young children, all of whom attend school. The cost of school represents a heavy economic burden which María has overcome thanks to her effort and dedication. 

María is a nursing assistant and has a small pharmacy. She works every day from 5AM until 10PM. She works in the pharmacy from 5AM until 2PM and then goes to her nursing job at a private clinic. María’s sister runs the pharmacy when she is not there. 

María is going to use this loan to buy more medicine so that she can restock her pharmacy. This is her fifth cycle in the bank and she likes the benefits that she receives. 

María’s dream is to have her own store since she currently rents the space for her pharmacy.

loans.use: To buy medicine for pharmacy

loans.name: Lorena Rosario

texts.es:
Lorena de 41 años, ella es comerciante de ropa y artículos varios, vive con sus cuatro hijos de 23, 19, 9, 4 años en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciales informales). 

Para poder mantener a su familia y ayudar a su esposo tuvo que comenzar a trabajar como con su cuñada pero como ella quería general sus propios ingresos decidio tener su propio local de ropa y artículos varios,  comenzó a vender la ropa en su local y a sus vecinos , Poco a poco a incrementado su negocio con las ventas de camisas, zapatos, pantalones etc. 

Para continuar con su negocio de venta de ropa ella quiere comprar con el préstamo blusas y pantalones. En el futuro quiere tener otro negocio en la bahía ya que es el lugar mas comercial de Guayaquil.
texts.en:
Lorena is 41 years old . She’s a storekeeper who sells clothing and other various products. She lives with her 4 children; they are 23, 19, 9 and 5. They live in Guayaquil, in the "Guasmo" ( an urban area where the majority of the residents are informal merchants).

In order to maintain her family and help her husband, Lorena had to start working with her sister-in-law. However, since she wanted her own income, she decided to have her own place to sell clothing and other merchandise. She started by selling clothing near her home and to her neighbors. Little by little, she increased her business by selling shirts, shoes, pants, etc. as well.

To continue with her clothing business, she wants to buy blouses and pants with the loan. In the future, she wants to have another store in “la bahia”, the most commercial area of Guayaquil.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants

loans.name: Nader

texts.ar: نادرعمره 28 سنة متزوج وليس له اولاد له خبرة واسعة بتلميع الكريستال لديه صعوبة مادية ومنافسة قوية في محيطه العملي يريد ان يطور نفسه ومصلحته لديه الالتزام التام بالتسديد وهو يطلب قرض من المجموعة بهدف توسيع عمله وتحسين وضع عائلته المادي يعمل ايضا في مجال البلاط  وله تسع سنوات في هذه المصلحة وله زبائن يتميز بعمله بالاتقان والالتزام وهو يهدف بالمستقبل ان يمتلك مصلحة خاصة به وهي مصلحة الكريستال والتلميع
texts.en: Nader is 28 years old.  He is married and has no children.  He has extensive experience in crystal polishing.  Nader faces financial challenges and strong competition within his field.  He hopes to be able to develop personally and enhance his business.  Nader is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to expand his business and improve his income and is fully committed to repaying this loan.  Nader also works in tiles. With nine years of experience in this field, he has managed to build a clientele.  He is very committed and aims to own his own crystal polishing business in the future.

loans.use: Tiles and crystal polishing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of meat

loans.name: Djiguiya (Hope) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djiguiya est constitué de quatre femmes du quartier Mousabougou de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien. Elles  vivent ensemble dans le même quartier, dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et coépouses. Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins  6 enfants.
Les membres du groupe Djiguiya font l’achat vente de légumes, d’habillements et de condiments alimentaires.
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y’a trois ans. 
Bintou C. qui est un des membres du groupe Djiguiya vend  exclusivement des bananes. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter au fur et à mesure des bananes. Elle se procure de ces marchandises  dans les marchés environnant Koutiala notamment Soukoumba et Molobala. Elle vend ces bananes en gros aux jeunes filles qui ensuite partent vendre en détail  dans la ville de Koutiala, l’autre partie est vendue au marché de Yangasso en gros, au comptant et en détail.  
Tandis que Les autres membres du groupe  comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105 000FCFA chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Bintou C.,  compte réaliser 120 000 FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Elles souhaitent renforcer leur partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin de  diversifier  leurs activités.
texts.en:
Djiguiya is a group composed of four women from the Mousabougou district in the city of Koutiala who know one another well.  They live together in the same district and in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and co-spouses.  Averaging 42 years of age, the women are married and the mothers of at least six children.  The group members buy and sell vegetables, clothing, and condiments. To increase the size of their businesses, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program three years ago.  

Bintou C., a member of the group, sells bananas exclusively. She plans on using her loan to buy bananas when needed.  She acquires her merchandise at markets surrounding Koutiala, especially Soukoumba and Molobala.  She sells these bananas wholesale to girls who then go sell them retail in the city of Koutiala.  The other portion is sold at the Yangasso market retail and wholesale for cash. 

While the other group members each plan on making an average profits of 105,000 francs CFA over the course of the cycle, Bintou C. plans on making 120,000 francs.  

In addition to repaying the loan, the group members are using a portion of the revenues to cope with everyday family expenses.  They would like to bolster their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to diversify their businesses.

loans.use: Buying bananas

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie A. is from the village of Balila, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 47 years old. Rosie is married and has 9 adult children. To make a living, Rosie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. Rosie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Rosie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like junk foods & beverages. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rosie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like junk foods & beverages.

loans.name: Maritza Del Pilar

texts.en:
Maritza Del Pilar is a 48 year old, single entrepreneur. When she was a little girl she learned how to make clothes. She has been designing and making clothes for more than 10 years now. She also sells sodas and juices at her store. Maritza has two children who are both married. Her daughter, who lives close by, helps making clothes and selling drinks at her store. 

Maritza lives in an area in the south of Guayaquil, called Isla Trinitaria. This area is known for its lawlessness and its scant basic services. Luckily Maritza's home is made of cement and has electricity and water. Due to unsafe conditions in the area, it is sometimes too dangerous in the street, forcing Maritza to close her store early. 

Maritza will use the loan to buy material needed to make and repair clothes and to buy drinks to sell in her store.
In the future Martiza hopes to open a small store and to fix the top floor of her house. She would also like to have a place to design high quality clothes.

loans.use: To buy materials to make clothes and to buy drinks to sell

loans.name: Yolanda Zobeida

texts.es:
Yolanda de 54 años, es una mujer emprendedora que tiene un negocio de venta de almuerzos. Antes de comenzar con el negocio ella vendia artículos pero decidió comenzar con el negocio de venta de almuerzos para tener mas ingresos. 

En la actualidad vende cada almuerzo a $ 1.50 el cual contiene sopa, segundo, jugo. Trabaja desde las 08h00am preparando la comida hasta aproximadamente las 14h00 que es la hora donde se le acaba la comida. Ella quiere continuar con su negocio porque le gusta mucho servir a la gente por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo mesas, arroz, carnes. En el futuro quiere tener un local grande para vender a un mayor volumen.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 54 years old and she is an enterprising woman who owns a restaurant serving lunch. Before she started her business she used to sell merchandise items but she decided on a restaurant to improve her earnings. 

She sells each lunch for $1.50, consisting of soup, an entree, and juice. She starts work at 8am to prepare the meals until about 2pm when the food sells out. She wants to keep up with her business because she greatly enjoys serving others. She wants to purchase tables, rice, and meats. In the future she wants to have a large restaurant in order to sell in greater quantities.

loans.use: To purchase tables, rice, and meats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase edible products to make food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Jovita Antolin's Group

texts.en:
Jovita A. is from the village of Siempre, Viva Norte. She is the leader of an eight-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Jovita A.'s Group.
Jovita is 51 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Jovita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jovita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2006, Jovita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Jovita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her eleventh from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is married with a grown son named Andriy. She is an entrepreneur from Uzhgorod. Nataliya sells men’s and women’s clothing merchandise in a local market in her home town. She owns one vending location and solid clientele. She has been in the trade for 12 years. Her net profit amounts to 5,000 Grivnyas a month.  

Nataliya is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to diversify her merchandise, to add to her stock and meet the growing demand for clothing in the market. Her outstanding credit history and willingness to strive for higher goals will help her repay the current loan and reach success in her business.

loans.use: to add more stock to her store

loans.name: Enhzaya

texts.en:
Enhzaya J. is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two sons, 7 and 11, in the Uvs province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent.  

Her husband works as a builder during summer and he works as a fireman and guard during other seasons. Her two sons both attend a secondary school. 

She manages a grocery store near to her home. She started her business in 2010 and is planning to continue her business in the future. However, Enhzaya herself decided to work in a private retailing company beginning in June, 2011. So her mother will take charge of her business operation from then on. 

Her business is quite profitable because of the good location, and customers are happy with the polite and honest service that she provides. She opens her store from March to November and shuts it down during winter times when the profit is much less compared with other seasons.

Enhzaya is a diligent and open-minded woman who says, "One can do anything if one lives healthy." She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase more products in order to increase the varieties of her goods for sale.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fish, meat, and palm oil at wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Ana Obdulia

texts.es:
Ana, reside en San Carlos, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la venta de tamales, pan y ropa, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de pan dulce, también tamales y ropa de vestir de forma ambulante.
Por el momento necesita invertir en el negocio, comprando harina, huevos, azúcar, también pollo y algunas prendas de vestir. Con esta inversión podrá aumentar la mercadería y ofrecer a los clientes una mayor producción en pan y tamales, así también nuevas prendas de vestir con diferentes estilos.
Su objetivo primordial es mejorar su vivienda, para que sus hijos estén más seguros y cómodos, también que estos estudien y puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Ana lives in San Carlos, located in the department of Morazán.  She dedicates herself to selling tamales, bread, and clothing.  She lives with her husband and two children.  She is a street vendor of items such as tamales, sweet bread and clothing.

At the moment, she needs to invest in her business by buying flour, eggs, sugar, chicken and also some clothing.  With this investment, she will be able to augment her merchandise and offer her customers more bread and tamales.  In addition, she wants to offer them a greater variety of clothing styles.

Her main objective is to make improvements to her home, so that her children can live more securely and comfortably.  Also, she wants them to get educations so they can succeed.

loans.use: buy flour, eggs, sugar, chicken and also some clothing.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 31 years old and single. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jessica has a wholesale and retail soft drinks business in the Philippines. Jessica has requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of soft drinks to sell.

Jessica has been in this business for 7 years.  In the future, Jessica would like to save enough money so she could purchase a delivery truck for her soft drinks business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is from the village of Villalin, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Delia is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Delia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Delia has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Delia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her farm. Delia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to finance land preparation and to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Delia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to finance land preparation and purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Lilia has a tailoring shop that provides repairs and sews clothes like school and office uniforms. She has had this business for four years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed like cloth, a pair of scissors and needles.
Lilia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like cloth, a pair of scissors and needles

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard has been a farmer in Kisii area, South Rift, Kenya for the last 10 years, employing two casual farmers and producing tea, maize, bananas and milk, which all go to the local market. He gets additional income from his carpentry works. He is married with three children between 10 and 3 years old.

Richard has requested a loan of 46,800 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says he hopes the income generated will enable him to expand his carpentry workshop and the number of his cows to three quality breeds in five years.

Richard says the high costs for fertilizers are the greatest impediment to farming in the area.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Luchando Por El Mañana Group

texts.es: Duo Luchando por el mañana. este duo esta entegrado por Ana Cristina: quien es la lider del duo ella se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos de toda clase,ella nos cuenta que nececita un credito ya que nececita comprar mas mercaderia como lo es cosmeticos ella se dedica a este negocio desde hace barios años ella piensa que con el credito que le otorguen podria comprar una cantidad mas grande y asi tener mas productos para ofrecer el sueño de ella es superarse y estar bien en un futuro, el otro socio esta solicitando este credito para la compra de repuestos para electrodomesticos y de la misma manera superarse.
texts.en:
The pair known as “Luchando por el Mañana” (Fighting for Tomorrow) is led by Ana Cristina, who sells all types of cosmetics. She says that she needs a loan to buy more merchandise, such as cosmetics. Ana has been in business for several years and believes this loan will help her buy a larger quantity of products so that she can have more to sell. Her dream is to be successful and to do well in the future.

The other member is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for household appliances, which will allow him to succeed in the same manner.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma operates a restaurant business, serving his neighbors and passers-by. He has been engaged in this business for the past five years. He faces a major challenge of competition in his business. He dreams of becoming financially independent in the future. 

Juma and his wife have seven children, two of whom are grown and five of whom attend school. The family lives in a rented house that has electricity but not piped water. Juma's greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan he has requested, he wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil. He decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, rice, beans and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Tan

texts.en:
Mrs. Tan, 62 years old, is living permanently in Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. She works hard to support her family. She is married and has three lovely children. One of them is married, and the other two are single. 

Presently, Tan is a cooked food seller, selling her food in front of her house. Tan would like to request a loan from Kiva in the amount of US$1,200 in the aim of repairing her old house. With any remaining money, she will purchase more ingredients for her business. 

In the future, Tan would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to repair her old house.

loans.name: Talahatou

texts.fr:
Talahatou est une femme âgée de 40 ans. Elle est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants.
 Talahatou travaille comme revendeuse de savons et pagnes depuis 2000. Elle vend à toutes personnes dans un quartier de la place après achat au Ghana et au Grand Marché de Lomé. 
Talahatou a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des savons et des pagnes.
texts.en: Talahatou is a 40-year old woman. She is single, without children. Since 2000, she has been selling soap and “pagnes,” traditional colorful fabrics. She sells to general public in a local district after stocking up in Ghana and at the  Big Market of Lomé. Talahatou has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy soap and “pagnes.”

loans.use: to buy traditional "pagnes" fabrics and soap

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is a married woman with three children aged 16, 12 and 10. They live in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur.

Anabelle is a farmer. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Anabelle does her best to be a good mother and wife. She wants to have a happy and healthy family.

Anabelle is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and gasoline for the tractor. She hopes for this loan to help increase her harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and gasoline for the tractor

loans.name: Hermila

texts.es:
Hermila nació en el departamento del Cusco y tiene 51 años D. edad, ella es casada y fruto D. esta unión tiene seis hijos. Actualmente, Hermila vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donD. desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta D. peluches, ella viaja dos veces a la semana a la ciudad D. Puno y al país D. Bolivia a comprar sus productos, ella venD. sus productos en la feria sabatina  “El Baratillo” en la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son dos años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Hermila requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo peluches. 

El Banco Comunal “Salud” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una D. las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Hermila was born in the department of Cuzco, and is 51 years old.  She is married, and has six children from the marriage.  Hermila currently lives in the city of Cuzco, where she has her business activities.  She sells items maD. of plush, traveling twice weekly to the city of Puno, and to Bolivia to buy her products.  She sells her products in the “El Baratillo” Saturday market, in the city of Cuzco.  She has been engaged in this business for two years, and things are going well for her.  Hermila now requires a loan to buy more merchandise, such as, for example, items maD. of plush.

The “Salud” Communal Bank meets monthly in the city of Cuzco (Peru).  Cuzco is known as a heavy business and tourist area, and because of the Inti Raymi traditional festival.  Also because one of the seven wonders of the world is found there:  Machu Picchu.

loans.use: buy more merchandise, such as, for example, items made of plush.

loans.name: Melita

texts.es: Melita, de 40 años, es una mujer emprendedora y responsable, es conviviente y madre de seis hijos de 19, 17, 15, 6, 3 años y el último de 8 meses de nacido, ellos aún dependen de ella y de su pareja para su educación y alimentación. Juntos habitan en su casa propia en donde hacen todo lo posible para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Su trabajo consiste en la venta de ropa usada, que es vendida en la carretera hasta el kilómetro 86, asimismo dicha mercadería a los pobladores que viven en la rivera, y del que le pagan con algún animal. Tiene  10 años en este trabajo, y manifiesta que le esta yendo bien, sin embargo tiene un recien nacido, no puede estar viajando, así que esta pensando en poner un nuevo negocio que sea en su casa y le permita seguir teniendo ingresos sin tener que tomarse muchos riesgos de estar yendo por lugares alejados. Por ello planea montar una tienda de abarrotes, por lo que espera le vaya bien, ya que todas tus expectativas están puestas en este nuevo negocio que esta queriendo emprender. Este será el crédito número 14 con MFP, es una muy buena socia en su grupo, y siempre se caracterizó por ser puntual y colaboradora con los demás, espera poder seguir trabajando juntos ya que gracias a los préstamos otorgados le han sido de mucha ayuda para su inversión y para aumentar su capital. Con el monto solicitado, comprará mercadería para su bodega, además implementará con algunos andamios y abarrotes para iniciar con su nuevo proyecto.
texts.en:
Melita, 40, is a hardworking and responsible woman.   She is in a common-law marriage and has six children: 19, 17, 15, 6, 3 and the youngest is 8 months.  All of them are dependent on her and her partner for their education and food.  They live in their own house where they do everything possible to offer them a better quality of life.  She sells used clothing on the highway at kilometer 86 as well as to the people who live by the water and who pay her with animals.  She has been doing this for 10 years and says that it’s going well.  However, she now has a newborn and she can’t travel, so she is thinking about starting a business that can be in her house and would allow her to get income without taking risks by traveling far.  
With this in mind she is planning on opening a general store that she hopes will do well.  Now all her hopes are set on this new business that she wants to start.  This will be her 14th loan with MFP.  She is a good group member and is known as being punctual and collaborative with the others.  She hope to continue working together now that, thanks to the loans, she has had a  lot of support in her investment and to be able to increase her working capital.  She will use the money requested to buy merchandise for her store, as well as for purchasing some shelving and groceries to start her new project.

loans.use: to buy products such as shelving for her displays

loans.name: Ou

texts.en: Mrs. Ou is a 62-year-old humble villager who currently lives with her two daughters in Kampong Chhnang province. She was married but she was divorced with her husband. Mrs. Ou earns a living by providing cleaning services to a local hospital. She can earn around $2 USD each day. One of her daughters is married and the other works as a garment factory worker. Her daughter's workplace is far away from the province, so every day she gets to work by hiring a motor taxi service. The transportation fees are related to her living condition. Mrs. Ou has applied for a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy a motorcycle for her daughter to use to travel to work. This loan will improve her standard of living. She is grateful to all lenders who kindly help her family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS DE RUMICHACA ALTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Virginia; ella tiene 48 años de edad y es casada y tiene 8 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de pollos, la socia también se dedica al negocio de tejidos, ella teje chompas y pantalones, ella teje a pedidos, el negocio de crianza de pollos lo vende en forma ambulatoria, por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de crianza de pollos y mejorar el negocio de tejidos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pollos y también para comprar lana al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Virginia is a member of the "Manos Juntas de Rumichaca Alta" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Virginia is 48 years old, married, and has eight children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business raising chickens.  She also has a knitting business, knitting sweaters and pants (trousers) to order.  She sells the chickens that she raises as an itinerant vendor and, through these small businesses, she supports her children.  Virginia would like to expand and improve her chicken-raising business and improve her knitting business.  She is requesting this loan to buy chickens and also to buy yarn wholesale.

Virginia is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy chickens and also to buy yarn wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase tools and mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
 
Joan has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan for 7,000 Philippines pesos to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Joan has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Joan hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Merlita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Merlita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Merlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and  beverages

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La señora Julia se dedica al comercio de calzados,  cuenta con puesto de venta y también lo realiza de forma ambulante en los días que no hay feria tanto en la ciudad de Cochabamba y la ciudad de Quillacollo, la señora se dedica a dicha actividad desde hace diez años dicha actividad la iniciaron conjuntamente su hermana y esta es su única fuente de ingresos,  solicita el crédito para capital de trabajo ya que comprara calzados por mayor,  ya que por las fiestas de fin de año las ventas se incrementan y necesita comprar mercadería con anticipación ya que los precios se incrementan para dichas fechas, es soltera y vive con su madre, ella sola con esta actividad mantiene a su madre, es una persona muy amable se siente feliz por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Julia is a footwear merchant; she has a sales stand and on non-market days she also sells as a street vendor in the city of Cochabamba and in the city of Quillacollo.  She’s been in this business for ten years having started it in partnership with her sister; this is her only source of income.  

She’s asking for a loan to use as working capital since she will buy footwear at wholesale because during the end-of-year festivities sales increase and she needs to buy merchandise ahead of time because prices rise in those days.

She’s single and lives with her mother and she supports her mother alone through this business.  She is a very kind person who feels happy about the support provided.

loans.use: to buy footwear at wholesale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 49 years old and is a married woman with four children. The oldest child is 18 years old. Cecilia’s husband works as a farmer.

Cecilia has been in the business of raising hogs for about 20 years. She earns 10,000 PHP per month with her business. She plans to use her loan to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies she needs. Cecilia hopes this loan will help her business and family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies she needs.

loans.name: Nak

texts.en: Nak, 59, resides in Kampong Chnang Province. Nak sells groceries. She is requesting a loan of US $1000 to repair her house. In the future, Nak would like to use additional income to purchase more groceries to stock her store. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is from the village of Panta-on, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. He is 48 years old. Nelson is married and has four children. 

To make a living, Nelson has a business planting and harvesting crops. Nelson has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from these activities. Nelson is requesting a loan of 3,250 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. 

In 2010, Nelson joined GDMPC to seek for financial assistance as an additional investment to his business. He plans to use the income generated to expand his business and house improvement.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Norma Leticia

texts.es:
Norma, de 24 años de edad, estudio técnico en enfermería, está soltera, actualmente se dedica a vender pupusas y vive con sus padres en casa propia.

Norma, desde hace un año se dedica a vender pupusas junto a su madre, porque cuando salio de estudiar no ha 
encontrado trabajo, por eso decidió iniciar con este negocio de lunes a sábado.

Norma, necesita el préstamo para comprar granos básicos porque tiene una pequeña tienda y ademas en la pupusería tiene bastantes clientes. 

El sueño de Norma, es conseguir trabajo de lo que estudio y mientras tanto tener el negocio junto a su madre.

loans.use: para comprar granos básicos porque tiene una pequeña tienda.

loans.name: Fuatai

texts.en: Fuatai S. is a 63 year old lady, and she joined SPBD in April 2006, with he first loan of $300.00. Fuatai is now on her 4th loan and she never had problems with her repayment. She’s a very creative and talented lady. That enjoys trying out new ideas of creating stuffs. Before joining SPBD, she already had her variety shop, where she spends all her time looking after. Apart from every other product that you can find in any other shop, you can be amazed with other interesting products that Fuatai makes that she also sells in her shop i.e. Samoan Oil that is made from the Moso’oi flower, which is quite famous with Samoans. She also makes S. Cocoa, that is used to make tea. With the Europeans, coffe is what they have for morning tea, but with the Samoan, their coffee is Samoan Cocoa, which we believe gives ua strength for the whole day.Well, you may think that it’s cheap because it’s a local product, but it’s not, for a bottle of Nescafe maybe costs you about $10.00, but for one pack of Samoan Cocoa costs $7.00, and believe it or not, this can only last for half a day. Fuatai also sells clothes that she sew, but mainly school uniform for the kids. Other stuffs she sells, are coconuts, bananas, taro, guavas that she collects from her husbands plantation, and fresh flowers that she picks from her garden. She also do bouquet of flowers for church decorations, weddings etc. With her forth loan now, she’s planning on extending her business selling live chickens and pigs.

loans.use: Restock her shop and home improvement

loans.name: Alim

texts.en: Alim P. owns a cellular phone and cellular phone accessories store in the small town of Khachmaz, located on the Northeastern coast of Azerbaijan. Alim would like to increase his inventory of cell phones and cell phone accessories in order to keep up with the demand of the growing cell phone market here in Azerbaijan.

loans.use: To increase inventory of cell phones and cell phone accessories

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria Guadalupe is divorced, and she has one son who is about to start college. She loves to sell and she is really good with words, which has helped her to move up ahead. To be able to provide for her son after she separated from her husband, she decided to start her own business by selling perfumes.

Maria wishes for her business to continue to grow so that she can help her son pay for his college education. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $475 USD to purchase more merchandise so that she can offer more variety to her clients and eventually increase sales. Be part of the success of this business and help this family have a better quality of life. They greatly appreciate your generosity and trust!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Guadalupe es divorciada y tiene un hijo que está a punto de iniciar sus estudios universitarios, a ella le agradan las ventas y tiene facilidad de palabra, lo que le ha ayudado a salir adelante. Para poder darle lo necesario a su hijo, desde hace ocho años que se separó de su esposo decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de perfumes, se le presentó la oportunidad de viajar a McAllen, Texas donde adquirió algunos productos que le habían solicitado y desde entonces se dedica a este negocio.

Para poder pagar la educación de su hijo, Maria desea que su negocio continúe creciendo, por lo que solicita un crédito por $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, de esta manera ofrecerá una mayor variedad a sus clientes e incrementará sus ventas, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un plazo de 4 a 8 meses. Tú puedes formar parte de este negocio y ayudar a mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen tu generosidad y confianza.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Eduardo Daniel

texts.es:
