Eduardo is a young businessman with big dreams. He is married with a tree year old daughter. Five years ago, while still studying, Eduardo started his own business renting out inflatable games for children’s parties so that he could pay for his studies and to save up to get married. He started with loaned games which meant that he had to share 50% of his earnings, but thanks to his savings he was soon able to get together enough money to buy his own.

In order for his business to continue to grow, Eduardo would like a loan of $475 which he will use to buy more games so that he can offer a greater variety to his clients and so they will always choose him. He promises to repay this loan over a period of 4 months. Be an important part of the development of this business and in the well-being of this family. They sincerely thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Eduardo es un joven emprendedor con grandes deseos de superación, está casado y tiene una pequeña hija de tres años de edad. Hace cinco años Eduardo inició su propio negocio con la renta de juegos inflables para fiestas infantiles, en aquel momento él era estudiante y empezó su negocio para cubrir los gastos de su escuela y para ahorrar para casarse. Comenzó con juegos que le prestaban y tenía que compartir el 50 % de las ganancias pero gracias a los ahorros que pudo acumular pronto logró conseguir sus propios juegos.

Para poder continuar creciendo con su negocio, Eduardo está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de más juegos inflables para poder ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes y continuar con su preferencia, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, así como en el bienestar de esta familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: To buy inflatable games/Compra de inflables

loans.name: Paula Margarita

texts.es:
Paula is 41 years old, has three children, and is a widow. She makes flour pastries filled with jam or caramel which are very common in her region, adn she sells them in the city market as a traveling vendor.She is part of the San Felipe 2 group together with Maria de Jesús Pérez Hernández (who has a grocery store). With the loan Paula will invest in the purchase of flour, sugar, eggs, etc. and Maria will buy a variety of products to stock the store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

PAULA tiene 41 años, tres hijos, viuda. Ella hace pastelitos de harina rellenos de mermelada o manjar muy comunes en la localidad y los vende en el mercado de la ciudad como persona ambulante. Forma parte del grupo llamado San Felipe 2 junto con doña Maria de Jesús Pérez Hernández (tienda de abarrotes). Con el préstamo Paula invertirá en la compra de harina, azúcar, huevo, etc., y Maria comprara una variedad de productos para surtir la tienda.

loans.use: Purchase baking supplies and grocery store inventory

loans.name: Alzira Salvador

texts.pt:
Location: Zone 7 Client: Alzira Salvador Sitoe Business Sector: Retail Loan Amount: 13.000,00 (US$520.00) Loan Use: Clothing Purchase and Retail

Alzira Salvador Sitoe was born on August 20th, 1974 in the city of Maputo. In 1992 she met her husband with whom she has had 6 children. She lived with her parents until the age of 18 and, due to financial hardship, she only attended school until the fifth grade. In 1993 she launched and witnessed her small business venture fail caused by complications she faced with her first pregnancy. She then decided to look for a financial institution willing to help. She first borrowed money from the Associação Gueguegue (Gueguegue Association) located in Boane, which offered credit to group applicants. It turned out not to be a good experience because the amount granted was smaller than the amount requested and she had to be responsible for the payments in case one of the other partners defaulted. She became aware of Hluvuku-Adsema existence through a friend and because she wanted to expand her business, she requested her first loan. The loan amount of 13.000,00MT will be used to increase stock inventory. Currently, she is running her business with help from her husband. Her children help around also anytime they are unable to be present. The profit generated is used to cover household expenses such as school costs and health care for her children. Her business has a positive impact in the community because it provides employment to herself and her husband and also it brings needed products closer to customers. In the future she intends to open up a new location under her name.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Alzira Salvador Sitoe,casada maritalmente ,tem 6 filhos ,tem 34 anos de idade ,nasceu a 20 de Agosto de 1974 na cidade de Maputo ,viveu e creceu com os seus pais ate 18 anos de idade ,estudou ate 5ªclasse devido a fragilidade da situçao financeira da família . Conheceu o seu marido em 1992 . Em 1993 comecou a exercer um pequeno negocio pessoal de venda de produtos da 1ªnecessidade e no mesmo ano teve a sua 1ª gravidez onde devido a complicações da mesma viu o seu negocio fracassar e decidiu recorrer a uma organização financeira. Teve o seu 1º contacto de empréstimo com Associação Gueguegue localizada dentro de Boane que oferecia créditos em grupos ,não tendo sido boa experiência porque para alem dos valores cedidos serem menores tinham de assumir a responsabilidade de pagar o empréstimo em caso de um dos elementos não efectuar o pagamento . Conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema através da amiga e dai aproximou-se e solicitou o seu 1º empréstimo para ampliação do seu negocio. Com este empréstimo de 13.000,00 mt pretende aumentar o stock de produtos do seu negocio . Actualmente esta explorando um estabelecimento junto com o marido .Eles dirigem pessoalmente e na sua ausencia os filhos é que tem tomado conta do mesmo ,com os rendimentos do seu negocio suporta os encargos familiares, desde despesas escolares e de saúde para os seus filhos. A sua actividade tem um impacto positivo na comunidade porque para alem de providenciar emprego a ela própria mais o marido colocam o produto mais perto do cliente . No futuro pretemde abrir um outro estabelecimento próprio em nome dela.

loans.use: To buy more stock for sale

loans.name: Rosio Isabel

texts.en:
Rocio Isabel Gerdini Ushinahua from Tarapoto in San Martin started her business in July of 2006. She sells prepackaged foods and toiletries to her neighbors from a small store she built into her home. She started the business with $350, a table, and a display case. She has slowly increased her inventory and number of products. Rocio’s store is located in an area where she has little competition and her neighbors don’t need to make the long trek to the market. Because of these features and her friendly service, she has many faithful clients.

Rocio Isabel is 45, married, has three young children, and is very motivated. She started the business so she could improve the family's economic situation and send her children to school. Learning to run her business came easily as she grew up managing a juice bar with her parents. She is a dedicated mother who loves her job because it enables her to spend more time with her children.

With a loan of $500 dollars, Rocio would like to restock and add new products that are frequently requested by clients. Rocio is a member of the Communiity Bank Mujeres Emprendedoras who support her business decisions. She is confident that she will have no problem repaying the loan and excited to have the opportunity to provide a better service to her community.

loans.use: To buy various products

loans.name: Nuryanah

texts.en: Nuryanah, 37, is the mother of 5 children. Her husband, S., is a landless farmer, earning about US$ 80 a month. She has a small shop where she sells vegetables, spices, etc., earning about US$ 10 a day with a small profit. She is asking for a loan of US$ 75 to buy more goods for her shop. She is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her little shop

loans.name: Busiya East G Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jamawa M.. She is currently in the business of wholesale rice selling and is requesting a loan to stock more rice to sell. Jamawa is 35 years old and is married. Her husband is a coffee trader. She has 2 children aged 8 and 15 and her children go to school. Each week, Jamawa makes approximately UGX 31000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and boost business. Jamawa has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 350000 in order to add to the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Jamawa is joined in her small group by Zulaika N., Zamu N. and Catherine B.. Zulaika N. has a business in goat rearing and wants to buy more goats. Zamu N. is currently operating a business selling bananas and wants a loan to add capital. Catherine B. operates a business of used clothing sales and wants to build a clothes shop.

loans.use: To add more capital to rice business and expand it

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan V., age 42, is a mother of six children and works as land broker, making around $3 a day. Her husband, Mr. Chun Ro, 60, owns a plot of farmland and grows rice. He earns approximately $2 a day. They have six children. One child is married and lives away from home and two others works as car mechanics with a salary $100 each a month. The rest are students.

She wants to use this loan to repair her house.

loans.use: She wants to use this loan to repair her house

loans.name: Noacha's Endelevu Group

texts.en:
Noacha is 39 years old and is single with 2 children, aged 16 and 15. Noacha is sells soap, which she started doing in 2006. She works every day from 7 am to 7 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more soap for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Moula, who has a business dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more soap for her business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina E. S. owns a small general store and some land where she raises different animals in the town of Mache, high in the mountains of the Libertad region of Peru. She has been running her store for 8 years and now has plenty of loyal customers. On her land, she raises livestock, including pigs, cows, and chickens.

Cristina is 46 years old, married, and has 3 children. She enjoys working and helping her family. In the past, she had low self-esteem and little decision-making power in her family.

A member of the Mujeres de Mache community bank, Cristina is requesting a loan of s/2000 ($725 USD) that she will repay over 4 months. She will use the loan to restock her store with all of her best-selling goods.

loans.use: To restock her store with all of her best-selling goods.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy S. is the mother of four children. She is forty five years old and married. Mercy is a resourceful mother and she works with the motivation of supporting her children’s education to provide them with better life opportunities in the future. At the moment, three of the children have completed senior high school, but the rest are still in school. She sells corn dough and ice water. Corn dough is a milled maize grain mixed with water and it used in local meals like banku and porridge. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of maize to increase her production of corn dough. She belongs to the community group called “Asempa kanea” Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral to access loans, and peer pressure to repay the loan. Mercy was photographed during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 32 year-old Anna N.. She is a widow and has two children aged 11 and 13. In 2001 Anna established her grocery business. Working seven days a week, and nine to twelve hours a day, she earns about US $130 every month from this business. Anna requires a loan in order to buy more stocks of beer and soft drinks. She thanks you for your support.

Her bar is a good place to chill with a beer if you manage to finish work early on a Friday afternoon. It’s the kind of place where you kick back on a plastic chair under a tree, with a local beer in hand, the aroma of roasting ‘mishikaki’ (kebabs made on an open fire) wafting around you, and talk to anyone and everyone who happens to wander by.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of beer and soft drinks.

loans.name: Srean

texts.en: Mrs. Srean T. lives in Preak Ta Ker Village in Kandal Province. She is a secondhand clothes seller. She is a 44-year-old widow with five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the others are attending high school. Mrs. Srean T. and her oldest daughter are breadwinners who can make a small income to support the family. In order to improve her living conditions, Mrs. Srean T. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build a new house for her household.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Sles

texts.en:
Mr. Sles S., 58, and his wife, Mrs. Rokiyas Sman, 58, live along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1972 and have nine children: four sons and five daughters. Four of their children are married and live outside the family home. Two children assist in their parents' business, and the other three children study at a local school.

Mr. Sles and his wife have been garlic and chicken wholesalers for many years. They buy chickens from a nearby province, then carry them in their truck for resale at the market. They buy garlic at the Vietnam border for resale in Kampong Cham and Kampong Thum provinces. Currently the couple lacks the money to buy more garlic and chickens to sell. Therefore, Sles is requesting a loan of $1000 to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase garlic and chickens for resale.

loans.name: Yamileth Del Socorro

texts.es: Esta clienta tiene mucha experiencia en lo que respecta al negocio de costura, tiene 5 años en este negocio, comenzó solo con  una maquina de coser y una ayudante, debido a que tiene un mercado grande que abastecer, su marido la apoyó  con la  compra  de una maquina.  En la actualidad tiene 3 maquinas y 2 trabajadoras,  las que elaboran vestidos de niña y trajes de dama. Con los créditos y con las capacitaciones de adim logra administrar bien su negocio, lo que la hace sentirse realizada como mujer y microempresaria Vive con su esposo y dos niños que asisten al colegio de primaria, tiene casa propia y su mayor ilusión es poder remodelar su casa de habitación y separar el taller.
texts.en:
This client has a lot of sewing experience. She has had her business for 5 years and she started with only one sewing machine and an assistant. As she had a large market to supply for, her husband supported her by buying a sewing machine. Now she has 3 machines and 2 staff who make girl's dresses and women's clothing. With the credit and training from ADIM she managed to administrate her business which makes her feel that she has proved herself as a woman and microentrepreneur. She lives with her husband and 2 kids who are in primary school. She has her own home and her dream is to remodel the house and separate the workshop.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital/Capital de Trabajo

loans.name: Nao

texts.en:
Mrs. Nao R., 44, lives with her husband, Mr. Vuthy Cheng, 45, in a small village near the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1987 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family house, and the other three children attend a local school. Nao's old mother lives with them as well.

Nao has been a silk weaver for over 10 years. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been raising pigs and producing rice wine for 15 years. Nao hopes that her business will be able to support her sons to study at as high a level as possible.

Nao is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business and to buy piglets for her husband to raise.

loans.use: To buy silk materials for weaving and to buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy D. is unmarried with no children. She completed her education through senior high school. Lucy sells bags of rice and jugs of cooking oil in Abura, which she began just this year. Lucy uses her income to pay her utility bills and other expenses. Lucy will use the loan to buy more bags of rice and jugs of cooking oil to sell.  Lucy plans to reinvest her profits into the business to improve her capital base.

loans.use: To buy more rice and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Waliholla

texts.en: Waliholla is 39 years old and married with 3 children. He works hard in agriculture, and lives in Shewa, Nangarhar province. He has been involved in the business of agriculture for more than 5 years, and now wants to take out a loan from AFSG. He would like the loan to help his business grow, and promises to be a good client for Kiva and AFSG. Waliholla is certain that he can repay the loan on time and he is very happy about receiving this loan. He would like to thank everybody who helps him, in the poor country of Afghanistan.

loans.use: To increase his agricultural business.

loans.name: Mami

texts.fr:
Né vers 1969 à Miéna dans la préfecture de koutiala, Mami  Mallé n’as pas eu la chance de progresser dans les études, alors il embrassa les activités génératrices de révenus. Mami vit avec ses quatre enfants et son épouse chez lui même dans le quartier hamdallaye de la préfecture de koutiala(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après s’être essayé à plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus, il décida de se spécialiser dans le commerce des vêtements depuis maintement 10 ans.  IL est trés sollicité lors  des foires hebdomadaires de koutiala ville et des villages environnants.  
Pour diversifier son activité, il décida de faire recours à l ‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il ya deux mois.  IL est à son 1er prêt  individuel..
 Mr Mami  compte acheter différents, modèles et marques de prêt à porter avec cet prêt.. IL s’approvisionne à Lomé ( capitale de la république du Togo ) et il  vend  dans sa boutique sise au grand marché de koutiala et dans les foires hebdomadaires à une clientèle de femmes et d’hommes  au comptant et crédit..
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 140.000FCFA qu’il envisage utiliser pour rembourser les intêrets du prêt et subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Born about 1969 in Miéna in Koutiala prefecture, Mr. Mami Mallé did not have the chance to advance in school, so he embraced working to earn an income. He lives with his four children and wife in his home in the Hamdallaye district in Koutiala prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having tried several kinds of income-generating work, he decided to specialize in the commerce of clothing ten years ago. He is in high demand when it is market day each week in Koutiala City and surrounding villages.

To diversify his business, he decided to turn towards the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso two months ago. He is on his first individual loan. With this loan, he plans to buy different styles and brand of ready-to-wear clothing. He gets his supplies in Lomé (capital of the Republic of Togo) and sells them, cash or credit accepted, in his shop, located at the grand marketplace of Koutiala, and in the weekly markets. His customers are composed of women and men.

He intends to realize a monthly profit of 140,000 francs CFA that he envisions using for repaying the loan interest and to providing for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en: Chhem K. is 26 years old and lives with her husband in the Kampong Chhnang province. She works in a grocery store, making around US$6 of profit per day, while her husband, wearing the blue shirt pictured here, earns about US$3.50 a day working as a mechanic, fixing TVs and radios. He also fixes the second-hand products and resells them to people in the area. This couple has one little child. Chhem would like to take out a loan to purchase old televisions, radios and tape recorders and other tools. The rest of the loan will be used to expand grocery products.

loans.use: To purchase old televisions, radios and mechanic tools.

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.es:
Emperatriz es socia del Bancomunal Santa Rosa de Villa.
Emperatriz es casada tiene 53 años, cuatro hijos mayores que están casados. 
Ella tiene un local que lo alquilaba para restaurante por mucho tiempo, y el inquilino se fue, ella vio la oportunidad para poner un restaurante pero administrado por ella y con la ayuda de su familia pudo lograrlo.
Hace cuatro años funciona su restaurante se llama “Como en el muelle” ella es la que cocina y tiene dos personas mas que le ayudan. Por las tardes ella se dedica a coser ropa.
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió ahorrar ha logrado comprarse varias cosas para su negocio como refrigeradora, una máquina de coser.   
Emperatriz necesita un crédito de 2000 soles, para comprar cerveza, aceite arroz. 
El sueño de Beatriz es seguir avanzando en el negocio, también le gustaría viajar.
texts.en:
Emperatriz is a member of the Santa Rosa de Villa Community Bank. She is married and 53 years old, with four older children who are married. She has a premses that was rented to her for a long time to use as a restaurant. The landlord left and she saw the opportunity to begin and manage her own restaurant and with the help of her family she was able to achieve that. Her restaurant, "Como en el muelle," has been in business for the past four years. She is the one who cooks and she has two more people who help her. In the afternoons she works sewing clothing. Since she has been a part of Finca, she learned to save and has bought herself many things for her business, like a refrigerator and a sewing machine. Emperatriz needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy beer, oil, and rice. Beatriz's dream is to continue advancing the business. She would also like to travel.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Emperatriz needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy beer, oil, and rice

loans.name: Davlat

texts.en:
H. Davlat is a native of Penjikent, Tajikistan, and has stayed in her native land to progress there. That is why three years ago she decided to move forward with raising livestock. She began with just one cow and now has many.

Every morning, Davlat goes out early so that her beloved cows may graze among the hills all day in hopes that they return happy and satisfied. Davlat is motivated to continue in this arduous work by the thought of her five children, who along with her husband, also help her with the cows.

In order to succeed in her business, Davlat and her family look to nourish the animals and keep them happy, in hopes of ultimately selling them at a just price. Thanks to her continued activity in her occupation, Davlat and her family are able to sustain themselves and this fills Davlat with great satisfaction. However, with the support of this loan, she would now like to purchase more species of livestock to increase her clientele. With your support, Davlat will be able to accomplish her business goals and thus, help fund the education of all five of her children.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing young cattle

loans.name: Munhzaya

texts.en:
Munhzaya T. lives with her husband and three children in the Narantuul district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her two older children are high school students, and the youngest daughter goes to a local kindergarten.

Munhzaya runs a small fast food cafeteria in the city. She started the cafeteria in early 2008. Her cafeteria is located in the busiest area of the local district, and is usually full with customers who work and live in the neighborhood. She has hired a cook and a waitress and the cafeteria serves 12 different types of local food. She is focusing on food quality and customer satisfaction in order to attract more local customers. One of her biggest dreams is to make the cafeteria business hugely successful and then to expand her cafeteria to a bigger restaurant.

Munhzaya requests a loan to purchase food ingredients like flour, vegetables, and meat.

loans.use: Purchase food ingredients for her cafeteria

loans.name: Mohammad Yaqob

texts.en:
Mohammad Yaqob is the son of O. J.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 55 and the father of 9 children. He has a workshop in which he works, and all the family members benefit from the income he generates.

He wanted to repair his house, but he couldn’t because the money he earns in his shop is not enough for both household expenses and house repairing, so he has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani for the term of 10 months to buy the required construction materials for his house. He is thankful to all Kiva lenders for their great support.

loans.use: Buying constructive materials

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Зикриёева Саодат- женшина 42 лет. Замужем имеет 3-х детей. Она занимается продажей детских одежд. Она торгует на рынке Панчшанбе города Худжанда. В пятницу она выходит на рынок «Джума-базар», а в воскресенье на рынок «Якшанбе-базар». Саодат закупает товар в городе Бишкек Республики Кыргизистан. Она ездит за товаром 1 раз в месяц. Ей помогает старшая дочка Нилуфар. Саодат хочет расширит свой товар и открыть ещё одну точку продажи.
texts.en:
Saodat Z. is a 42-year-old woman, who is married and has three children. She sells children's clothing at the Panchshanbe market in the town of Khujand. She goes to the Juma bazaar on Fridays, and on Sundays to the Yakshanbe bazaar. Saodat imports her goods from Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan, where she goes on a buying trip once a month. Her eldest daughter Nilufar helps her. Saodat wants to expand the selection of goods she carries and to open an additional sales outlet.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Children's clothing

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en: Ouk S., 63 years old, is a widowed mother  who has been blessed with three children who are single. One of her daughters is working as a military policewoman. Ouk S. hires a store in the local busy market where she sells breakfast foods to people who come to buy anything in the market. She generates her daily income of $4 each day to manage her family's living and especially to support her two children’s school fees and food needs. Ouk S. has been repairing her old house for a few months but it is still not completed due to the family’s financial problems. Therefore, she would like a loan of $1000 to finish repairing her house.

loans.use: To finish repairing her house

loans.name: Elvilda

texts.en: Elvilda S. is 31 years old, married with 2 children, and resides at Mialen,Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Her loan is intended to buy vitamins and feed for her piglets. She says that with the help of PMPC-Microfinance, her business has grown so that she has a better income now than before. The family hopes to have a comfortable life someday and be able to send their children to school and have their own decent life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for their piglets

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida J. is from the village of Dalapang, Ozamiz City. She is 36 years old, married, and has an infant child. Aida owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting corn for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Aida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Aida is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for corn production. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for corn production

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr:
Voulant  rehausser son stock de charbons de bois  parce que détruite en partie par la pluie, cette femme sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 20 sacs de charbons de bois. Elle fait aussi le commerce de céréales ainsi avec ce crédit elle pourra en profiter pour augmenter son stock de céréales  avec 5 sacs de maïs et 5 sacs d’haricots.
Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants.
texts.en:
Wishing to expand her stock of charcoal, because part of it was destroyed by the rain, this woman is asking WAGES for her first loan to buy 20 sacks of charcoal. She also sells cereals, so with this loan she can take advantage of the opportunity to expand her stock of cereals buy purchasing 5 sacks of maize and 5 sacks of dried beans.

She is married and the mother of 4 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of charcoal, maize, and dried beans for resale

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en: N. Irene is the leader of her lending group in Kampala. She is 28 years old and married with 4 children aged 10 – 2 years all in school. Irene has a maize selling business for 3 years in Kampala where she makes monthly profits of 100,000/= and it’s her high level of faithfulness that is enabling her to hold on to her customers for increased sales. She has a plan of increasing her stock by having more bags of maize and beans for resale so that she could earn more to be able to take care of her family well. She needs a loan to be able to increase her capital by increasing more stock of her produce.

loans.use: Buying more bags of maize for resale.

loans.name: Sidiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sidiya, constitué de  4 femmes mariées (deux polygames et deux monogames)   ayant  une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 2 enfants, vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Médine un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dont le but  est de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de  condiments,  de bois de chauffe et de boissons.  
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 15 colis de condiments , 15 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe et 20 casiers de boissons. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages environnants. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au grand marché, de façon ambulante dans les quartiers, dans la famille ou sur commande et au marché de Médine, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 19.000 FCFA dont une partie sera investie dans les activités et l’autre partie en épargne.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita manages a jewelry business four years. She is procuring silver jewelries from a jewelry shop in Cauayan and Bangkok gold from one of her friends. She is selling them directly to her friends and some customers in their village. Marita is requesting to avail a loan amounting to PHP5, 000 from the KIVA lenders to have additional working capital for the expansion of her business. She hopes that it will be granted to maintain her business which is very helpful in sending her children to school. 

Marita is appointed as treasurer in their village for already two years. She is married to Ruben and he is working as a tricycle operator. They have four children whom two are still studying.  She hopes that through her business and her husband’s transportation daily income, they could generate enough income to be used in sending their children in school. She hopes that KIVA lenders could help their business grow and be capable of helping their children in completing their education.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina S. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 47 years old. Merlina is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Merlina owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. She runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The primary driver of income for the business comes from selling the different products in the local community. Merlina has been engaged in her business for over three years. She earns approximately 2009 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Merlina joined HSPFI. She wanted to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and allow her to engage in business activities. Merlina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Merlina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Merlina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Sinat On Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of fourteen people and they all live in Angk Ta Ngel village in Takeo province. Mrs. Sinat O. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members.

Mrs. Sinat O. is a farmer who owns a piece of land O. which she cultivates rice. She also raises pigs. Since her pig business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets, pig food, and fertilizers to support her rice field.

Mrs. Sinat O. is 23 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Horn Tith, is a driver.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pig food plus fertilizers to support her rice field

loans.name: Wali Zada Sartapa Group

texts.en:
This is the WA. Zada Sartapa group. Its four members live in the 8th district of Kabul, Afghanistan. They all would like to take a loan for their business progress. They have totally requested a group loan of 56000 Afghani.

Ghulam Sakhi, the group leader, has a shop selling vegetables. With the loan he would progress his business and buy more vegetables to have more clients.

Mushtaq is a taxi driver. He daily works hard to support his family members with the income he receives. Now he has a problem with the old machine of his taxi, so he wants to take a loan to buy a new machine for his taxi to work in a better way.

Aziza is a tailor. She sews different kinds of clothes and with her income she supports her husband and children.

The last member of this group is Nasima who is a baker. She has a bakery in her house and all her neighbors are her clients who come to her bakery and ask her to bake bread. With the loan she wants to buy more materials and wood.

They are all thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Expanding their  businesses.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is 27 years old, married with five children, and she lives in Ruhengeli, a region situated in the northern province of Rwanda.  Here, she owns a business of selling bricks.

Riziki has been a successful businesswoman in the brick business for the past 12 years and she is still going strong! She employs 10 people from her community and they work from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. every day.  Riziki is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase supplies and additional bricks to sell. With this expansion, she hopes to satisfy the growing demand for bricks from her customers as well as attract new customers.

If her plans succeed, Riziki will be able to reinvest a portion of the revenues into the business and save some in order to ensure the financial stability of her business and to take care of her young family.

loans.use: To purchase more bricks and supplies to sell

loans.name: Jose Pablo

texts.es:
Jose Pablo R. A. tiene 42 años, es casado, y  tiene 2 hijos que son su primer prioridad. Ellos tienen 12 y 13 años respectivamente y los dos viven en la casa con su esposa. El se dedica al cultivo de cafe y en la temmporada de cosecha, se dedica a transportar cafe de los recibidores al beneficio. El crédito lo quiere para resemblar y asistir 2 hectareas de cafe. Este prestamo le ayudará en que puede tener una mayor y mejor produccion cuando lleguen las cosechas. Es la segunda vez don Jose se financia con FUDECOSUR. Obtuvo un prestamo de 250000 colones que lo cancelo bien. Este prestamo le ayudó algo muy positivo ya que antes de FUDECOSUR solo había prestamistas que cobraban intereses muy altos. El desea que pueda darle una preparacion adecuada al negocio y así solventar los gastos de familia como estudio y gastos de la casa. Su esposa trabaja en el Fila Naranja comite de credito. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Jose Pablo R. A. is 42 years old, is married, and has two children who are his main priority. Jose's children are 12 and 13 years old respectively, and they both live at home with Jose and his wife. Jose plants coffee and during harvesting season, he transports the beans from the receiving docks to the processing plant. Jose is requesting a loan to replant and fertilize two hectares of coffee. This loan will increase and better production when harvesting time comes. This is the second loan Jose requests from Kiva partner FUDECOSUR. He first obtained a loan of CRC 250,000 that he repaid in time. The first loan helped Jose a lot, since before FUDECOSUR, the only lenders in the area charged high interests. Jose wants his business to be well prepared so that he can earn enough to provide his family with enough for household expenditures and schooling for his children. Jose's wife works in the Fila Naranja credit committee.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replant and fertilize two hectares of coffee

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May G. is 37 and married with 5 children (ages 7 - 16 years).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  May has 5 years of experience in this business.  May needs a loan of WST $1450 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 200 tala or US $83 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, May joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are May's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for May G. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.66 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2.21 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated. For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Norma's Group

texts.en:
Norma D. is from the village of Camanga, Dumalinao, ZDS. She is 45 years-old. Norma is the group leader of a two member group loan offered by Kiva partner PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Norma is married and has five school-aged children. Norma owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Norma has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000.00 PHP a month.

In 2008, Norma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from PMPC. Norma is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Norma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is 32 years old; he is married with a child. His child is two years old. Christopher is a business man and he sells rechargeable phone cards at wholesale and retail prices to his customers. Christopher wishes to increase his sales. He hopes for a loan amount of NGN 60,000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 39 years old and is married with five children, her youngest being 13 years old. Her children attend school and this makes her happy.

Victoria is an honest and hardworking woman. She sells crates of drinks at wholesale and retail prices to her customers. She is very happy doing her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers.

Victoria hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.fr: Née en 1977 à Abomey dans le département du Zou, D. Alice est mariée à GIBRIL Aboubacar un conducteur. Alice a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, qui vivent ensemble avec son mari et elle. Il y a six ans environs que Alice s'est installée au quartier Hêvié dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi, avec sa famille. Le couple se partage ensemble les charges familiales. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Alice vend du riz, depuis huit ans. A côté de cette activité, Alice vend également des chaussures, par le système de distribution. C'est à Lomé au Togo, pays limitrophe du Bénin, mais aussi à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Alice achète ses produits. Alice a obtenu une fois déjà de prêt à ALIDé, et a bien effectué les remboursements. Alice sollicite un deuxième prêt, afin d'augmenter le stock de ses produits et de se faire plus de profits après la vente de ses produits.
texts.en:
Born in 1977 in the Zou department, Alice D. is married to Aboubacar GIBRIL, who is a driver. Alice has three children,, all attending school, who live together with her and her husband. The family settled some six years ago in the Hêvié borough of the Abomey Calavi commune. The couple jointly shares family expenses. To meet her needs and those of her children, Alice has sold rice for the past eight years. As a side business, she also sells shoes through the distribution system. She gets her products from Lomé in Togo, a country adjacent to Benin, but also from Dantokpa, Benin’s international market. Alice has already been granted one loan from ALIDé, which was repaid in full. She is now requesting a second loan to increase her supply of products and to bring in more profit once they are sold.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes and three bags of rice

loans.name: Hedar Homa Group

texts.en:
Najiba is the group leader of H. Homa group. She lives in district 15th of Kabul Afghanistan. She wants to take a loan for her husband’s business. He has a general store, and all the family members benefit from his income. He needs to rent another shop which is located next to his previous shop and buy more supplies for it, and besides, he wants to expand his business and to attract more clients, so he has requested an individual loan of 15000 Afghani.

He is happy that he has got the chance to progress as soon as possible.

loans.use: He wants to expand his business

loans.name: Bumi

texts.en:
30-year-old Bumi is married and has one child. She lives and runs her business in Lagos. She owns a beauty salon and sells hair extensions, hair cream and hair treatments to earn a better living. She started the business 3 years ago and she has been able to use her years of experience to attract and retain more customers. 

Bumi wants her business to grow into a first class beauty salon in the future. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more hair extensions and hair cream to sell. This, she said, will increase her productivity and profitability, which will enhance her business growth and improve the living standard of her family. She appreciates all lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and hair cream to sell.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida N. is a hairdresser and sells wigs, weave-ons, shampoo and other hair products at Takoradi. She is married and has a child. She has been through junior high school. Her husband is a teacher.  Vida uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of the home.  Vida will use the loan to buy more hair products like creams and wigs for sale and also for use at her saloon. With the new profits from her expanded business, Vida plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more hair products

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 28 años, vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos: Jeremy de 7 años y Jasury de 3 años. Todos ellos viven juntos en su casa propia. El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de productos de belleza, hace 2 años atrás necesitaba de un trabajo que le permitiera permanecer en su hogar el tiempo necesario para ocuparse de sus pequeños hijos y con esta labor lo consiguió. Desde entonces se levanta muy temprana en la mañana para empezar con los labores de la casa y luego se dedica el resto del día en la venta de mercadería. Siendo sus principales clientes, amigas y vecinas, quienes recurren a ella para hacerle algún pedido de las bonitas novedades que ofrece la marca de cosméticos. En un futuro quiere hacer crecer su negocio abasteciéndose de mayor cantidad de productos para así aumentar sus ventas. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos los pagos de las cuotas.
Con el crédito que solicita, comprará productos de belleza para así poder vender en las próximas festividades por el día del padre.
texts.en:
Nancy is 28 and lives with her partner and their two children, 7 year old Jeremy and 3 year old Jasury. They all live together in their own home. For the past two years she has worked selling cosmetics. She needed work that would allow her to be at home enough to take care of her young children, and she found it in cosmetic sales. Since then she gets up very early every morning to start household chores and spends the rest of the day selling merchandise. Her main customers are her friends and neighbors who come to her for the latest attractive offerings from the cosmetics line. In the future she would like to grow her business by stocking more products to help increase her sales. This is her first loan with MFP and she commits herself to being very punctual with her payments. With this loan she plans to purchase cosmetics to sell for the upcoming fathers' day festivities.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of cosmetic products

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora C. is from the village of Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old. Flora is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Flora owns & operates a business buying ready to wear items like pants, skirts, sandals and shorts and selling them in the local community. Flora has been engaged in her business for less than a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Flora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Flora is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Flora from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel tiene 42 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Tiene 20 años de experiencia sembrando diferentes productos de su zona, especialmente las hortalizas, como: zanahoria, coliflor, cebolla. En tanto su familia, también lo apoya en esta actividad, ya que juntos tienen el mismo propósito, que es generar las ganancias necesarias. Es por que cada miembro se turna para cuidar sus cultivos y asegurar que crezcan saludables, de eso depende para tener una buena cosecha. Afirma que le gusta mucho esta labor aunque un poco sacrificada y a veces  imprevisible por las condiciones climáticas, pero su recompensa lo recibe cuando ve las ganancias que obtiene de la venta de su producción. En el futuro desea  tener más extensiones de terreno. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para seguir sembrando.
texts.en:
Daniel is 42 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and 3 children. He has 20 years of experience growing various products of his area, especially vegetables , such as carrots,cauliflower, onions. His family supports this activity since together they have the same goal which is to make the necessary income. Each person takes turns taking care of the fields to make sure that they grow well, since a good harvest depends on this. He affirms that he likes this work even though he needs to make sacrifices and is at the mercy of the climate. He gets his reward when he receives the profits from the sales of his production. He wants to have more farm land in the future. This is the second loan with MFP and he is very happy knowing that he has financial support due to his always being a responsible payer. He is also very pleased being part of the community group because all the members are responsible persons and very supportive. With the proceeds from the loan he will buy sacks of fertilizer to be able to continue to plant.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is a single mother of four children aged 15, 13, 10 and 8 years. Ester lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda in the semi-permanent house shown in the picture. She is the head of her family and is responsible for the welfare and education of her children and her two brothers who live with her.

"It’s a big task," she says, but she hopes to succeed by seeing them through. 

Ester operates a clothing shop in which she sells clothes, bags, and mattresses. She has operated this business for the last four years. Previously, she sold cocoa, a major cash crop in her area. 

The purpose of the loan is to enable Ester to purchase clothes, bags and mattresses to sell in her shop. She says that, with more capital, she will be able to offer her products wholesale to retailers.

loans.use: To buy clothes, bags and mattresses

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel H. is from the town of Turod Norte, Cordon. She is 26 years-old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Maribel owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from operating a motorcycle transport business in the local community. Maribel has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Maribel joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Maribel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza G. is from the town of Banga. She is 33 years old and single with a 9-year-old child. Annaliza's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She also manages a sari-sari store where she sells various products. She hopes to grow her store.

Annaliza joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Annaliza from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”;  Este banco está situado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco; situado a 45 minutos de la ciudad.

La socia Ines, tiene 31 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, ella es artesana, la socia da clases de alfabetización ella pertenece a un programa de alfabetización en su pueblo para ayudar a las mamas y gente mayor a que puedan aprender a leer y escribir, ella también se dedica junto a otro grupo de artesanos al arte textil ella forma un grupo de 14 personas que tienen a su cargo realizar trabajos en telas de colores y con diseños propios del ande (los diseños que recrean la vivencia diario e estos bellísimos pueblos, ellas colocan montañas nevadas, riachuelos, lagunas, patos silvestres, arboles, casitas de arcilla y adobe, animalitos sueltos disfrutando de la armonía y la paz del lugar) así como es el pueblo de Chinchero. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de lanas para elaborar textiles.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This client belongs to the communal bank, Nueva Victoria – Chinchero. The bank is located in the district of Chinchero, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco, located 45 minutes from the city.

Ines is 31 years old, has a live-in partner, and has two children. She is an artisan and teaches literacy classes. She belongs to a literacy program in her town to help mothers and adults to learn to read and write, and she also works with another group of artisans on textile arts. She has a group of 14 people that work making colored fabrics with designs specific to the Andes as well as the town of Chinchero. The designs that they recreate are of daily life and the beautiful towns. They add snowy mountains, streams, lakes, wild ducks, trees, clay and adobe houses, and animals free and enjoying the peace of the area. Ines is requesting the loan to purchase wool to make her textiles.

She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments in the stipulated time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wool to make her textiles

loans.name: Apeli

texts.en:
Apeli is 45 years old and married with five children who are between 10 and 26 years old.  Apeli is well known for her business selling a variety of goods, mainly foodstuffs such as rice and flour, and some other goods as shown in the photo.  She has been in this business for about six years. The business hours are from 6 am until late in the evening.

Apeli needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, Apeli will increase the sale of foodstuffs and she will increase the size of her business place.  If successful, she will hopefully earn more profits which will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud Y Vida. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Angela es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal, ya son como 13 años que lleva y  espera seguir por muchos años más, siempre le ha gustado la forma de trabajar de la institución. Tiene 54 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha tenido dos hijos, los dos son mayores pero su hija menor vive con ella, su marido es chofer.

Tiene un pequeño comedor en un local que es de su suegra que le dio para que instale su negocio sin cobrarle arriendo. Trabaja todos los días desde las 5am hasta las 14h00, su hija le ayuda en su negocio, dice que ya son varios años y que le ha ido bien gracias a Dios.

Este crédito es para comprar productos que luego ella utiliza en la preparación de los alimentos, además quiere comprar dos licuadoras para vender batidos de frutas.
 
Sus sueños son tener su propio local y un restaurante más grande.
texts.en:
The “Salud y Vida” (Health & Life) communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto.  This city is known for its traditional culture and for being near the two best beaches in the province:  San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Angela is a founding member of the communal bank and has been in it for about 13 years and hopes to continue with it for many more years.  She has always enjoyed the way the institution operates.  She is 54 years old and in a common law relationship.  She has two children both of whom are adults but her younger daughter lives with her.  Her husband is a driver.

She has a small eatery in a locale that belongs to her mother-in-law that she uses rent-free.  She is open for business every day from 5am until 2pm.  Her daughter helps her.  She says that she’s been in this for several years now and thanks to God has done well.

This loan will be used to buy products she uses to prepare her meals. She also wants to buy two blenders to sell blended fruit beverages.

Her dreams are to have her own locale and a larger restaurant.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs and two blenders.

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en:
Dorah N. lives in the Kyebando neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (one relative).

Dorah has a business of selling second hand men's clothes. She has been in this business for 10 years and she works 6 days out of every week. Dorah sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Dorah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more clothes. She also generates additional income through poultry farming.

The main business challenge(s) for Dorah include transportation and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start rearing Frisian cows. Dorah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of men's shirts and t-shirts.

loans.name: Edward Nduati

texts.en:
Edward, 30 years old, has practised mixed farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the past eight years. He does crop farming and dairy farming at the same time.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy another cow for milk production.

In the future, Edward hopes to increase the number of cows he has so that he can produce milk on a larger scale and sell in bulk.

loans.use: To buy one dairy cow.

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Гиёев Сафарали проживает в районе Восеъ. Возраст, 47 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Более 8 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Он разводит скот в дальнейшем для перепродажи. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: G. Safarali lives in the Vose region. He's forty-seven years old, married and has four children. He has a high school level of education and has bred cattle near his home for eight years. After breeding, he sells the cattle for profit. He's asking for a loan to buy some more cattle.

loans.use: To acquire some cattle

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is a 26-year-old business lady. She operates a boutique, where she sells clothes and handbags. Her customers are mainly middle-income earners. 

She is married and a mother of one child who goes to school. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy handbags, dresses, trousers, sweaters, suits, baby clothes and shirts, among other clothing for sale. She hopes to acquire several plots of land and develop them for rental purposes in the future.

loans.use: To buy handbags, dresses, trousers, sweaters, suits, baby clothes and shirts, among other clothing

loans.name: Heidi

texts.en:
This is Heidi L., 42. She is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Leonardo L. and together they have four children, two of whom are already working. One child is still studying in college, while the youngest is just barely able to toddle around at home. By the grace of God, Heidi has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Heidi has her own frozen-food business. She sells spiced hams, sweetened pork and native sausages and other delicacies of a popular brand. She earns income by getting supplies in at a wholesale price and selling at a piece rate on credit. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Heidi dreams to be able to have her own business stall soon, just as she fervently wishes her children finish their education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Buy more quantities of products to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Nudis Consuelo

texts.es:
Nudis de 44 años, es una mujer muy hogareña que le ha gustado trabajar para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares. 

Después de observar que su familia era muy trabajadora supo que la independizarse era la alternativa para que su familia tenga una buena vida. Poco a poco compro papelería para una papelería y comenzó a trabajar desde las 07h00am hasta las 20h00pm. Vende a sus vecinos y conocidos la mercadería como papeles, cuadernos, plumas, accesorios etc. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene en el sector donde vive es la delincuencia por eso en la foto refleja la seguridad que ha puesto en el negocio.  

Quiere seguir con su negocio por eso quiere el préstamo para poder comprar papeles, bebidas, cuadernos, laminas. En el futuro quiere prosperar en su negocio y surtir mas la mercadería ya que ahora no está muy surtida.
texts.en:
Nudis is 44 years old.  She is a very home-loving woman who has enjoyed working to help her husband with their family expenses.

After watching her family who were very hard working, Nudis knew that she wanted to work for herself so that her family could have a good life.  She gradually bought stationery items to stock a stationery store and began working from 7.00am to 8.00pm.  She sells merchandise such as paper, exercise books, pens, accessories, etc. to her neighbors and acquaintances.  One of the problems she faces in her area is crime.  This is why the photo reflects the safety measures that she has installed in her business.

Nudis would like to continue in her business and for that reason she would like this loan so that she can buy paper, drinks, exercise books and wall charts.  In the future, she would like to prosper in her business and stock it with more merchandise as right now it isn't very well stocked.

loans.use: To buy paper, drinks and exercise books

loans.name: Engracio

texts.en:
Engracio L. Jr. is from the village of Mapuroc, San Mateo. He is 41 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Engracio owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Engracio has been engaged in his business for over 23 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Engracio joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 21,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be his first from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Myriam

texts.es:
Miryam forma parte del banco comunal “Banco Amigo” perteneciente a la comuna de Recoleta. Ella vende ropa, juguetes y peluches usados en un persa,  en una feria y también en su casa, desde hace 7 años. Hace un tiempo además está trabajando los días viernes y los fines de semana en un restaurante cerca de su casa, pero solo en los turnos de noche, por lo que  durante el día atiende su negocio.
Con este préstamo comprará ropa y juguetes usados y útiles escolares, para aprovechar la época de inicio de clases en marzo. 
Miryam tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales solo los 2 más pequeños, de 7 y 3 años, dependen de ella y de su marido económicamente.
Su sueño es tener un bazar establecido en su casa, ya que en la feria y en el persa tiene mucha competencia.
Para Miryam Fondo Esperanza ha significado un gran apoyo para su negocio, no solo por los préstamos, sino también por los talleres de educación emprendedora y desarrollo personal que les entrega su asesor, a ella y a sus compañeros durante las reuniones de grupo, ya que ahora se siente más segura y confiada al momento de vender y organizar su negocio.
Recoleta es una de las 34 comunas de Santiago (capital de Chile) y se encuentra ubicada en el sector centro-norte del Santiago, región metropolitana. Cuenta con un activo comercio, destacando el barrio comercial de Patronato que ha acogido principalmente a comerciantes árabes (en un principio) y coreanos (en la actualidad).
texts.en:
Miryam is part of the “Banco Amigo” communal bank in Recoleta.  She has sold used clothes, toys and stuffed toys at home, at a market and also at a “persa” (a type of street or flea market) for the last 7 years.  For a time now, she’s also been working in a restaurant near her house on Fridays and weekends but only during the night shift so during the day she tends to her own business.

She will use this loan to buy used clothes, toys and school supplies to take advantage of the start of the school term in March.

Miryam has four children of whom only the two youngest, 7 and 3 year olds, still depend economically on her and her husband.  

Her dream is to have a store set up at home because at both the market and the flea market she has a lot of competition.

For Miryam Fondo Esperanza has meant a big help for her business not only because of the loans but also because of the entrepreneurial and personal development workshops her advisor provided to her and her fellow members during their group meeting.  She now feels more secure and confident while selling and organizing her business.

Recoleta is one of the 34 communes in Santiago (capital of Chile) and is located in the center-north part of Santiago’s metropolitan area.  It has active commerce.  The Patronato neighborhood is especially notable in that it welcomed Arab merchants (in the beginning) and Koreans (now).

loans.use: For used clothing and school supplies.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 45 years old, married and supports her family by operating two business ventures: fish vending/dried fish vending and ready to wear clothes. She lives in Ilog, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,000. Josephine is borrowing PHP 10,000 to fund operations. This will be her eighth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 5,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Josephine aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To fund her dried fish business

loans.name: Retchel's Group

texts.en:
Retchel F. is from the village of Baringin Sur, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 27 years old and the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Retchel is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $71 a month for these activities.

In 2010, she joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Retchel is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda A. is from the village of Kinuman Norte Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Erlinda is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda raises crops, primarily planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Erlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seedlings and fertilizer.
