This will be the second loan taken out by Erlinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: 1  Mật Sơn 1 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Dụ N. Thị, age 75, is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 1 Mật Sơn 1 Đông Vệ (08.02.1 Đông Vệ).
 
Dụ lives in the town of Thanh Hoá. She is widowed and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Dụ owns and operates a food stall, selling peanuts in the local community. Dụ has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2010, Dụ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Dụ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,253,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  She is now requesting her second loan of 6,159,600 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and employed as working capital. Dụ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

Lê Thị Vân (age 32), Lê Thị Kỷ (age 70), and C. Thị Lan (age 45), are each requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support their individual furniture-making businesses.

Lê Thị Thái (age 61) is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her livestock-raising business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

---------
 
Dụ N. Thị (1) là 75 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Dụ là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 1 Mật Sơn 1 Đông Vệ (08.02.1 Đông Vệ).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán đậu phụng trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Dụ thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 7 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Dụ kiếm được khoảng 3,000,000 VND.  Vào 2010, Dụ đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Dụ đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,253,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,159,600 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Lê Thị Vân (4) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


2.  Lê Thị Kỷ (6) là 70 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


3.  C. Thị Lan (7) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


4.  Lê Thị Thái (8) là 61 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and to employ as working capital

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret N. M. has been in the dress-making business for three years and earns monthly income of 12,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). She is 36 and her husband is named Joshua. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and she has applied for her first loans from KADET LTD which she intends to use to buy more cloth for making dresses for sale. 

In the future, Margaret hopes to grow her business and diversify it to include a cereal shop.

loans.use: to buy cloth for dressmaking

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Adelaida una madre de familia de 38 años de edad, vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposo en una casa propia de material rústico en una comunidad llamada Saqa, la cual pertenece al distrito de Zaña  y se encuentra a una distancia de  poco más de una hora de la distrito de Chiclayo.  Zaña es un lugar que llama mucho la atención por su atractivo turístico y por ser una zona dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería.

Desde unos 10 años aproximadamente Adelaida se ha dedicado a la venta de abarrotes (productos que se utilizan diariamente como: leche, arroz, aciete, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos,etc.), su negocio lo ha colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad y seguridad.  Con las ganacias porlaventadesusproductos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar su nivel de vida.

Para poder  comprar mas mercadeía a solicitado uncrédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 2000 nuevos soles,con el único ideal de que su negocio cresca;  mejorando sus ingrasos podrá cubrir todas sus necesides,cumpliendotambien conlospagos mensuales de su crédito.

Adelaida es una madre responsable, dedicada y trbajadora que se preocupa por que sus hijos sean cada vez mejor y ayudarlos a que cumplan sus sueños mas adelante y en un futuro tener un negocio mas grande.
texts.en:
Adelaida is a 38-year-old mother who lives with her three children and husband in their own home, made piecemeal out of rudimentary materials, in a community called Saqa, in the district of Zaña and a little more than an hour's distance from the Chiclayo district. Zaña is quite an attention-getting place due to its high tourist appeal as well as its tradition of livestock farming and agriculture. 

Approximately ten years ago Adelaida began earning a living selling groceries (products for daily consumption such as milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna fish, eggs, etc.) She established her business in her own home for the sake of convenience and safety. With her profits from the sales she tries to cover all her costs and improve her standard of living. 

In order to purchase more merchandise she has requested a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternative, with the sole aim that her business grow. By increasing her income she will be able to cover all her needs, as well as make the monthly payments on her loan. 

Adelaida is a responsible mother, dedicated and hardworking, who wants to do right by her children all the time and help them fulfill their own dreams down the road. She also wishes to have a larger business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Digna works hard to support her family.

She has a balut-making business in the Philippines (balut is a boiled, fertilized duck egg with a nearly-developed embryo), and also earns additional income from buying and selling banig (handwoven mats).  Digna is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more eggs for her balut-making business.

Digna has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more eggs for her balut-making business.

loans.name: Luafulu

texts.en:
Luafulu is 43 years of age and married with eight children. Luafulu owns and operates a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community.  She has three years of experience in this business. Luafulu needs a loan of 2,000 WST to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or $104 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Luafulu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Luafulu's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly is married with three children. He is 36 years old and lives in Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

He sells ice cream, carried by his motorcycle. Mobile ice cream is an excellent choice as a business enterprise. Rolly can transport the product in the local areas like public malls, beaches, schools and streets. He earns for his living about $135 per month. He's been doing this kind of business for five years. 

He wanted to have an additional container of ice cream to carry on his motorcycle, but he had no capital to purchase it, so he went to GDMPC and requested a loan of 7,000 PHP. Rolly has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In  the future, he hopes that he can have additional mobile ice cream in the town.

loans.use: to purchase an additional ice cream container.

loans.name: Angel Marcial

texts.es:
Angel Marcial tiene 37 años, es soltero vive con los padres no tiene hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz.

Angel Marcial se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas que atacan a los cultivos. Su sueño es tener capital y seguir trabajando. 

Le gusta bailar.
texts.en:
37-year old Angel Marcial is single, lives with his parents, and doesn’t have any children. He lives in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

His community bank is called VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE and is located in Recinto Sibimbe in Ventanas canton. There are 20 members who work in agriculture growing corn and rice.

Angel Marcial also grows corn and rice. He buys his supplies in Ventanas each month and sells his produce in the local market. He is seeking a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and manure. The loan will provide him with the financial support to obtain what he needs. He sometimes faces problems such as insects that attack his crops.

Angel’s dream is to have more money and to keep on working. He loves dancing.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and manure

loans.name: Tulipan Group

texts.es:
El grupo Tulipán lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Luz Marina de 50 años quien inicio hace 13 años con un pequeño crédito en la empresa Avon, conocida por sus ventas vía catálogo. Ella con los préstamos ha podido comprar mayor cantidad de mercancía y crecer, además que su filosofía de trabajo es atender bien al cliente. 
Ella tiene tres hijos menores de 17, 15 y 14 años los cuales estudian y su sueño es aumentar su negocio y vender ropa. 
Las otras dos integrantes son Sandra Margarita quien inicio hace 8 años con pequeño termo a vender café con leche y pan, ahora vende más y María Salvadora tiene una pequeña venta en su casa.
texts.en:
The Tulipán ("Tulip") group is made up of three hard working and enterprising women.  One of them is Señora Luz Marina, aged 50.  Thirteen years ago, with a small loan, she started working with the Avon company, which is well known for its catalog sales.  With loans she has been able to buy more goods and grow further; not only that, but her business philosophy is to serve her clients well.

She has three young children aged 17, 15 and 14, who are students, and her dream is to grow her business and sell clothing.

The other two members are Sandra Margarita who started 8 years ago with a small thermos selling milky coffee and bread, now she sells more than that; and María Salvadora who has a small shop in her home.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Kyaitamba Tweimukye Group

texts.en:
Paul is a 33-year-old married man with one child, living in his own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.

His dream is to open at least five butcher shops around the area of operation. He has been in this business for five years and the major challenge faced is high prices for buying cows for slaughter which makes him fail to purchase enough cows to supply the existing market.

Paul needs the loan to buy a cow for slaughter.

loans.use: To buy a cow for the butcher shop.

loans.name: Konul

texts.en: Konul is 38 and a devoted mother of 3 beloved children. She sells women's seasonal clothes in the central market of Agcebedo district in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Konul is married and her husband actively helps her to run her business. Konul has about four years of experience in this field. She buys merchandise two times per month from another city. She is very polite and friendly and this is the main key to her successful business. She applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase more seasonal clothes and increase her monthly profit.

loans.use: to purchase more seasonal women's clothes

loans.name: Hodalo

texts.fr:
Hodalo est une femme âgée de 31ans. Elle est mariée å un caissier. Elle a 02 enfants.
Hodalo travaille comme revendeuse des produits d’alimentation générale et des articles scolaires depuis 2007. Elle vend à la maison à ses clients. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. 
Hodalo a requis son troisième cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de riz, des cartons de tomates, spaghetti, des bidons d’huile et autres.
texts.en: Hodalo is a 31-year old woman. She is married to a cashier and has 2 children. She has been selling groceries and school supplies from her home-based store since 2007. She gets her supplies in Lomé. Hodalo is asking for a third loan from WAGES so that she can restock her store with groceries including bags of rice, boxes of tomatoes, spaghetti and cans of oil.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, boxes of tomatoes, cans of oil, etc.

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty is 38 years old and married to a farmer. She is blessed with four children whom she is sending to school. Liberty manages a business raising hogs and her husband also works as a mechanic and repairs damaged cars. Liberty and her husband help each other to attain their goal of providing a good quality of life for their children. She and her husband believe that one way of doing this is to provide for their needs and send them to school. Liberty believes that education is the key to success. 

Liberty is requesting a 10,000 PHP a loan to buy feed for her pigs. She looks forward to the growth of her business.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Peace

texts.en: Peace is 31 years old and has five children. The oldest is 14 and the youngest is two. They are all in school.  She sells clothes such as shirts, skirts, pants, etc. She has run this store for the last seven years.  This business has allowed her to send her children to school. She would like a loan to buy more clothes in order to grow her business. She will use the profits to build a bigger home.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell in her clothing store

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 35 years old and married with three children.

Cherry works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Cherry has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from food vending.

Cherry aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for rice farming.

loans.name: Sol Naciente Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SOL NACIENTE II” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Alto Lima, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Ilsa. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: sastrería, venta de frescos y jugos, venta de comida, venta de fideo, trenzado de mantas, carnicería.

La señora Ilsa,  indica que es el primer año que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de unos vecinos. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida que viene trabajando hace seis años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de mani, aceite, fideo, etc.) que adquirirá de la Ceja y posterior a la elaboración lo comercializará en las ferias los jueves y domingos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo. 
 
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito.
texts.en:
The “Sol Naciente II” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Alto Lima focal center.  It has 6 members led by a governing board headed by Ilsa.  The members carry out a variety of commercial activities.  Among them we have: tailor shop, fruit smoothies and juice sales, food sales, pasta sales, blanket weaving and butcher shop.

Ilsa indicates that this is the first year she’s worked in Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution thanks to a neighbor’s invitation.  At present she has business selling food that she’s had for the last six years.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy peanuts, oil, noodles, etc. in La Ceja and after she prepares the food will sell in at the Thursday and Sunday markets.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family since she’s married and has a son.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answers that it’s the credit.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, noodles and oil.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a Kenyan widowed lady who is 37 years old with three children. Her business is selling second-hand clothes and it's located in a densely populated area. Her customers are passers-by and walk-ins. She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to buy more clothes to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She has been doing this business for six years and says her major challenge is financial constraints. Her future dreams are to open another stall and educate her children to university level. Susan describes herself as humble and honest.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Nenita has a shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy fish to sell.

Nenita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nenita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 42-years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children.
 
Helen has a food shop, or carenderia, that sells viands like fried fish, adobo and pancit bihon. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

Helen has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Helen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

loans.name: Eryab

texts.en:
Eryab, a 41-year-old resident of the town of Kinubi, located in the Luweero region of Uganda, has four children, three of whom currently attend school. For the past four years, he has been working hard to manage his small bar, which sells beers, wines, spirits and soft drinks.

To help expand his business, Eryab has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more soda and beers for resale, and will help him to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Eryab hopes that in the future he will be able to further expand his business.

Eryab is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Eryab who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more crates of soda and beer for resale.

loans.name: Karomatullo

texts.ru: Кароматулло проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ему 22 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Кароматулло занимается торговлей тканей у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности он занимается четыре года. Кредит берет для покупки сезонного товара.
texts.en: Karomatullo lives in Tursun-zoda. He is 22 years old. He is married. He has two children. Karomatullo sells fabric from home. He has been doing this work for four years. He is taking a loan to buy seasonal goods.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 36 years old and lives in Northern Poblacion, Calamba. She is married with four children. 

Rowena has a food stall business and earns approximately 4600 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 27000 PHP to purchase ingredients for her viand (food) business. 

Rowena has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her viand business.

loans.name: Pricilla

texts.en:
Pricilla is from Bacolod, Ozamiz city. She is 51 years old. Pricilla is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Pricilla plants, harvests and sells rice on land which she owns. Pricilla has been involved in this business for 15 years, and makes PHP 3,000 a month from her work. 

In 2007, Pricilla joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Pricilla is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 which she will use to purchase fertilizer such as manure. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to sustain the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a mother of two children aged two and one years old. She has been in farming for the past four years. Her farm produces milk, maize, beans and vegetables for the local market in Kitale, Western Kenya. Gladys runs her farm with the help of one farmhand. Her farm is her sole source of income.

Glady has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy poultry to expand into poultry farming. She hopes to make better returns from the business and use the profits to expand her dairy farming in the future. She believes she will be able to cope with the challenge of diseases which is rampant in poultry farming.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Estoy Confiando Group

texts.es: Socios formados por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Kenia su negocio es fabricar sillas de mimbres actividad que viene desarrollando desde hace 10 años, inicio vendiendo cosméticos, sus hijos que son cuatro trabajan con ella en la fabricación de las sillas de mimbres. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como el mimbre para fábrica de sillas, Zelania vende nacatamales y Silvia vende ropa usada.
texts.en:
This group has three entrepreneurial members, one of whom is Kenia.  Kenia's business is making wicker chairs.  She has been in this business for 10 years, having originally started out selling cosmetics.  Kenia has four children who work with her making chairs.  She will invest this loan in buying raw materials such as wicker for making chairs.

Zelania sells tamales and Silvia sells used clothing.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as wicker for making chairs

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María, de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la albañilería, juntos tienen dos hijas que están estudiando.

María, además de realizar los oficios domésticos, también le ayuda a su esposo a cultivar maíz, porque desde pequeña su padre le enseño este oficio.- María, todas las mañanas le ayuda a su pareja a sacar la cosecha y los cultivos están a una distancia de 15 minutos de donde ella vive y su horario es de 7:00 a 10:00 a.m.  

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar una ternera, porque tiene un terreno que su padre le ha heredado.

Los sueños de María,  son seguir cultivando y ayudarle a sus hijos para que estudien.

loans.use: para comprar una ternera, porque tiene un terreno que su padre le ha heredado.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. Esther I. sells foodstuffs, a business she started 3 years ago. She is 40 years old. She emphasizes the impact of a LAPO loan for her business and is hoping to expand her business with the above amount.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is 52 years old, married and has four children.  Ana is passionate about providing for the education of her children. She joined SPBD two years ago and has used several previous loans to upgrade her small village store.  Through these upgrades to the building structure and an expansion in product line, Ana has been able to earn enough income to fund the college expenses of two of her children.  She is very proud that she is able to send her children to the National University of Samoa.  The expansion of Ana’s store is not yet complete, however, and she is seeking additional funds to make further upgrades.  She is confident that there is enough demand in her village for a further enhanced product line.

loans.use: Purchase additional goods for her grocery shop

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married. She owns a business selling clothing, sunglasses and other items in one of the local markets in Kharkov, Ukraine. Svetlana has been in this business for 3 years, and it is the only source of income for her family. She owns three vending facilities and earns about $20-50 of daily net profit. 

Svetlana is fortunate to have a convenient vending kiosk in the local market. She has many customers who keep coming back to her kiosk , because she has very reasonable prices. Three loans from “Nadiya Ukraine” have helped her stimulate consistent growth in her trade. Generated profits enabled Svetlana to buy an apartment. In the past her family had to rent one and they didn’t have their own place to live.  

Svetlana requests a loan of $900 for to stock her kiosks with more t-shirts, jean clothing and trendy sunglasses which are very popular this sunny summer season. She will use some of the money to open a new vending facility. Her hard work, natural friendliness, good customer service and self-discipline will help Svetlana use the funding she receives wisely and repay her loan in time, just as she has done in the past.

loans.use: Increase available products

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Mrs. Sary Davert is 23 years old and lives in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. Her husband makes a living by selling recyclables at $5 USD a day.

Mrs. Sary, herself, stays at home to look after their young child. She would now like to earn some extra money by raising pigs from her home. She will use this $500 loan to purchase pigs and pig feed. In the future, she would like to expand this business.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Margarita Estrella

texts.es:
Sisters IRIS IZAMAL and MARGARITA are single. Their parents are merchants and work hard to sell fruit and vegetables in various communities. They are in charge of housekeeping. They've decided that with the loan, they will sell fruits and vegetables in their home and buy products at the most competitive prices in their locale. They will also buy a stand for the fruits and vegetables, bags and a scale. They are part of an association called Crisantema 1.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

IRIS IZAMAL y MARGARITA son solteras y son hermanas. Sus padres son comerciantes, se dedican a vender frutas y verduras llevando a distintas comunidades. Ellas se quedan a cargo del hogar y por lo tanto decidieron con su préstamo establecer en su casa la venta de frutas y verduras comprando los productos mas cotizados por su localidad, un exhibidor para la mercancía, bolsas y una bascula. Forman parte del grupo llamado Crisantema 1.

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables to sell them

loans.name: Khom

texts.en:
Mrs. K. Khom and her husband Mr. Ches Toeun got married in 1999. They have two children, one daughter and one son.  In 1997, Mrs K. Khom learned from her neighbor how to weave silk and started her own silk production that year. She has finished primary school but her husband, who is a construction worker, never attended school.

This $300 loan will be Mrs K. Khom's second loan from MAXIMA. She will use the loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread as well as fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos has owned his business for 10 years. Previously he was an employee but he decided to launch his own microbusiness. He started out with very little but with every passing day he went on developing his business. Currently he needs financing to be able to buy more vitamins and feed for his chickens and to expand the site where he raises his chickens. This business is his sole source of income; it sustains his family and pays for the education of his 3 small children.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Su negocio lo tiene desde hace diez años, comenta el señor M. que antes era empleado pero con el tiempo decidió poner su microempresa ; y inicio con poco pero con el paso de los días la a ido desarrollando actualmente necesita el financiamiento para poder comprar mas concentrado vitaminas y ampliar el local en el cual tiene la granja, ya que esto es su fuente de ingreso y es lo que le da el sustento a su familia y educación a sus hijos que son 3 pequeños en la actualidad.

loans.use: Juan Carlos needs the loan in order to be able to buy chickens to fatten, as well as vitamins and food concentrate for the chickens. This will allow him to increase his production and slaughter of chickens.

location.town: Col. Hermosa Provincia Calle Principal  Numero 1 L

loans.name: Jose Guadalupe

texts.es:
I have worked in a factory for years so that I could obtain public housing with ease. Approximately one year ago, I acquired a house, and now I have to make some improvements on it to provide more comfort for my family. Above all, however, I urgently need to install some window safety bars to give my family more security at night. I am requesting this loan in order to install window safety bars on my home.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

“He trabajado durante años en una maquiladora para lograr tener la facilidad de obtener una casa de interés social, hace aproximadamente 1 año que me la entregaron, y ahora necesito hacerle algunas mejoras para que mi familia este más cómoda, pero sobre todo me urge poner las protecciones en las ventanas para darles más seguridad en las noches” Solicito este préstamo para instalar protecciones en las ventanas de mi vivienda.

loans.use: Installation of home window safety bars

loans.name: Thi Hue

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hue, 20 years old, has 1 child. Her husband is a builder. Her family current income is 3.2-4.4 USD/ day. Besides doing agricultural activities like many other families, her family also sells rice in the market. Because the Binh Minh CDC Microeconomic Program has weekly repaying policy, which is very advantageous for her family, she decided to borrow 150 USD to buy one more rice-husking machine to increase productivity.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Huế, 20 tuổi, có một con nhỏ. Chồng chị là thợ xây ở làng. Thu nhập của gia đình chị chỉ từ 50000-70000đồng/ngày. Ngoài công việc nhà nông như bao gia đình khác, gia đình chị còn đi chợ bán hàng gạo. Chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc có hình thức trả góp theo tuần rất hay và thuận tiện cho công việc làm ăn của gia đình chị, vì vậy, chị đã vay 2006000đồng để mua thêm một máy xay xát gạo, tăng năng suất lao động.

loans.use: buy rice-husking machine

loans.name: Toribia

texts.en:
Toribia is fifty years old and the proud mother of six children, all of whom are in their twenties. Toribia sells curtains, tablecloths, bedspreads, and the like in the Buenos Aires community of Santo Domingo. The entrepreneur operates her business predominantly within her house, but from time to time she also visits friends and other people in the close-by neighborhood to sell off her goods.

Toribia explains that being a well-established provider of these goods in the community is very challenging, but she expects that her new styles of curtains and bedspreads will help her increase her revenue as well as repay her loan. She wants to keep working hard for the sake of her family.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of new styles of tablecloths, curtains, bedspreads and the like.

location.town: Buenos Aires community of Santo Domingo

loans.name: Amina's Tunda Group

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with 2 children. She and her husband also take care of 1 other child, age 3 years old. Amina is a maize seller, and she started in 2004. Every day, she works from 8 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $210 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more maize for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Halima and Aeshi, who have businesses dealing in tailoring and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more maize for her business.

loans.name: Bibiana Raquel

texts.es:
Bibiana is a hard working woman. Since she was a young girl she helped her family business which was selling food. Now that she is older, she realized that there wasn’t an economical place to eat in her neighborhood so she decided to open up her own kitchen in order to help her family with the household expenses and provide herself with the items she needs. Thanks to the good service and delicious food that they serve she has been successful with her business.

Now she needs a loan for US$250, which will be repaid in 3 months, to buy supplies, and therefore offer her clients greater variety in the menu and dishes that she prepares. With your help Bibi will succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Bibiana es una mujer emprendedora, desde muy pequeña ayudaba en el negocio familiar el cual es la venta de comida, ahora que ya es mayor, al darse cuenta que por su colonia no había ninguna cocina económica decidió poner su propia cocina, para así poder ayudar a su familia con los gastos de la cas, y costear ella misma sus necesidades. Gracias al buen servicio y la deliciosa comida que sirven ha tenido éxito con su negocio.

Ahora necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar insumos, y así ofrecerle a sus clientes más variedad en el menú de platillos que prepara. Con tu apoyo Bibi saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Comprar insumos

loans.name: Amanecer Senkata Group

texts.es:
The Amanecer group is made up of12 people, 25% men and 75% women. The group name comes from the name of the area where the members live, Senkata. The group is entering its third cycle; the previous two were completed with integrity and honesty without fail, except for one person who has now left the group for that reason. The hope is that everyone is able to continue to capitalize for the future and not depend on loans in order to work with their own capital in order to create their small businesses for the benefit of their families. The types of businesses of the group’s members include the sale of underwear, groceries, fish, shoes, gasoline and others.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva Volunteer.

El grupo amanecer sensata está conformado por 12 personas 25 % varones y 75% mujeres. El nombre del grupo sale de la misma zona por que residen por la zona de Senkata. El grupo actualmente ingresó a su tercer ciclo, en los dos primeros trabajaron con honestidad y honradez sin fallar ninguna de sus cuotas, exceptuando una persona que en este ciclo no ingreso por la misma razón. La esperanza de cada persona es poder seguir capitalizándose para mas adelante ya no depender de prestamos y poder trabajar con capital propio, de esa manera crear sus microempresas para el provecho de sus familias. Nombre del socio Actividad Años en el Rubro P. C. THELMA MERCEDES VENTA DE ROPA INTERIOR 9 Q. A. ADELA Q. T. BERNARDA C. J. JUAN M. Y. CRISTINA Q. SILFORIO HORACIO I. H. FILOMENA VENTA DE BATIDOS 3 R. T. JUANA ELABORACION DE ZAPATOS 5 M. Q. AGUSTINA VENTA DE PESCADO 4 T. B. JOAQUIN VENTA DE ABARROTES 2 P. P. FLORENCIA VENTA DE ABARROTES 2 C. C. PANFILA VENTA DE GASOLINA 3

loans.use: Capital for Operational Costs

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! Bertha M., 44 is married, and has seven children aged between 12 and 27.  In 1999, Bertha established her crops business. Working six days a week, and five to eight hours a day, she earns about US $50 every month from this business. Bertha has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more crops in bulk. She thanks you for your support.  


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilities as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed uncreditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from the client, extending a loan to then, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy more crops in bulk.

loans.name: Ndeshifose's Mercy Group

texts.en:
Ndeshifose is married with 2 children aged 19 and 15 years old. She has been a banana seller since 1998. Every day, she works from 7am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Ndeshifose now hopes for a loan to buy more bananas for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Lightness, who has a business dealing with vegetables sales.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for her business

loans.name: Tatu's Mungu Muweza Group

texts.en:
Tatu is 34 years and is married with 2 children ages 6 and 2. She also takes care of a 72 year old person. She has been selling clothes since 2005. She works everyday from 8am to 9pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Tatu is now requesting a loan to add to her current stock for the improvement of her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Fatma and Ashruna, who own businesses selling charcoal, oil and clothes.

loans.use: To add to her current inventory for the improvement of her business.

loans.name: Agung Ayu Sumarni

texts.id: Sumarni memiliki 2 orang anak yang masih kecil. Suami Sumarni seorang petani. Sumarni tergabung dalam program ternak babi dari Yayasan Dinari yang masa pinjamannya selama 6 bulan dan pembayaran pada akhir periode. Modal yang di dapat dari Dinari dipakai untuk memelihara 2 ekor babi penggemukan. Sumarni memperoleh pinjaman sebesar Rp. 5.000.000,- Modal yang dikeluarkan untuk membeli bibit babi sebesar Rp.600.000,- Untuk membuat kandang menghabiskan Rp. 2.000.000,- dan sisanya untuk biaya pakan selama 5 bulan. Setiap hari setelah selesai mengerjakan pekerjaan rumah, Sumarni segera merawat babinya. Pertama yang dilakukan membersihkan kandangnya setelah itu memandikan baru terakhir memberi makan. Sumarni memberi makan 2 kali setiap pagi dan sore hari. Adapun campuran pakannya : dedak padi, dedak gandum dan konsentrat. Sumarni optimis, dengan bimbingan dokter hewan dari Dinari usahanya akan sukses.
texts.en:
Sumarni has 2 kids, her husband is a farmer. Her husband joined the pig farming program. The capital provided will be use to farm two pigs. From Rp. 5.000.000, Rp.600.000 will be use to buy 2 piglets, Rp. 2.000.000 will be use to make the pig sty, and the remainder will be use to buy pig feedings for the next 5 months. Everyday she will feed her piglets twice a day. She is optimistic that with a guidance of a vet from Dinari Foundation, her effort will bring success.

Translated from Indonesian by Bernard Lim, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Membeli anak babi, membuat kandang dan membeli pakan

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi: Chị Hoàng Thị Ngọc tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị vay vốn để sử dụng vào chăn nuôi và cho thu nhập 150.000đ/tháng. Đến nay ngoài chăn nuôi chị Ngọc còn đầu tư vốn để buôn bán hàng tạp hoá. Hàng tháng ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá gia đình chị Ngọc còn có thêm nguồn thu từ lương làm thuê của chồng nên kinh tế gia đình chị khá ổn định. Với mức thu nhập 3.500.000đ/ tháng cuộc sống gia đình chị Ngọc đã ngày càng được cải thiện hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn mua thêm 5 con lợn về nuôi. Số vốn còn lại chị sẽ sử dụng mua thêm một số mặt hàng phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hoang Thi N. joined TYM Fund in 2003. She invested the loans from the first round in poultries and earned about 150.000 VND per month. Now besides breeding poultries, she also has a small shop selling necessities, which helps the family earn more money. Her husband is a worker with a stable income. Her family’s monthly income is about 3.500.000 VND. In the next round of loan, Mrs. N. would like to borrow 10.000.000 VND ($600) to buy more pigs to raise and more goods for her shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary E. sells goods and is requesting a loan to purchase more stock. Mary is 32 years old and married. Her husband is a businessman. She has six children and they all go to school. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to continue to send the children to school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Khoja Mirwais

texts.en:
K. Mirwais lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. His house is near Lese Maryam. He is single and he has a general store. He has been involved in this business for more than five years and has a good number of customers.

Mirwais wants to make his business larger. He has requested an individual loan of 50,000 afghani (USD$1,050) for a term of 18 months. With it, he wants to expand his business, buy necessities and complete his stock.

Mirwais is very happy about this program of loans in Afghanistan and wants to thank AFSG and Kiva lenders around the world.

loans.use: To expand his general store.

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is 43 years old and lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Walid has been working as a salesman for eleven years. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise to sell.

Walid has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time. His previous loans have influenced his work as well as his life in a good way. Thanks to his loans, he was able to expand his business and improve his family's situation. Walid is speciA. in his work because he has a good relationship with his clients. In the future, he plans to purchase a van in order to facilitate his work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
For the last two years, Salama has made a living selling clothes and fish in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar. She is a member of the Tusongembele loan group, and makes about $185 a month working for 16 hours a day. She is applying for her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes and fish to sell. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business.

Salama is 45 years old, married and has seven children, ages 7 to 30.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: La Exaltacion Group

texts.es: Este grupo esta representado por el señor Carlos y se encuentra cursando su primer ciclo y no presenta ningún parentesco dentro de mismo. Todos los socios del el banco comunal " la exaltación" se dedican a actividades comerciales vendiendo productos como ropa, cosméticos, comida, y algunos se dedican a actividades como la carpintería, soldadura de arco y oxigeno y a la confección de pantalones. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia en especial en la venta de productos es ahí donde prima la calidad del producto y la experiencia que tiene el socio para bajar los precios y hacer una mejor oferta al cliente. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de mercadería y  la compra de insumos para mejorar la calidad de sus productos incrementando así sus ingresos y de esa forma brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Dentro del grupo existe  gente que se encuentra trabajando por primera vez bajo la modalidad de grupos solidarios pero aquellos que tienen experiencia garantizan el cumplimiento del resto del grupo ya que confían en sus integrantes
texts.en:
This group is represented by Mr. Carlos L. and is in its first loan cycle. None of the group members are related to each other. All of the members of the “La Exaltación” Microfinance Institute partake in different business activities, such as selling clothing, cosmetics, or food. Others are in carpentry, metal arc welding, or make pants. As in all businesses, competition always exists, especially when selling goods. That is where the quality of the product is top priority, along with the entrepreneur’s experience in lowering prices and making deals with the customer. This loan will be used to purchase merchandise and supplies needed to improve the quality of their products, thus boosting profits and providing the group members’ families with a better quality of life. Within the group we can find people who are working in a solidarity group for the first time, but the other members who already have experience in this field promise that the loan obligation will be met because they trust the rest of the members.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Asunta

texts.en:
Asunta Basent is in the business of selling maize flour and is requesting a loan to build a store from which she can sell the flour.  Asunta is thirty-six years old. Her husband is a peasant. She has three children and they all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build lodges and a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a store for selling maize flour

loans.name: Abduvoid

texts.ru: Абдувоид - 47 лет. У него есть жена и 5-ро детей. Три сына и две дочки. Старшие сыновья уехали в Россию для работы. Работая там, они высылают деньги родителям. Родители копят высланные деньги, чтобы потом потратить их на женитьбу сыновей.  Дочки помогают по хозяйству. Жена занимается переработкой пряжи. Она сама ездит на рынок, чтобы продать их. Абдувоид пасет скот в горах и возвращается очень поздно. Недавно он узнал у соседей, что можно взять кредит в нашей организации, для увеличения количества скота. Теперь он тоже наш клиент.
texts.en:
Abduvoid is 47 years old. He has a wife and 5 children, three sons and two daughters. His older sons have gone to Russia to work. Working there they send money to their parents. The parents save the sent money so that they can later spend it on the marriages of their sons. The daughters help around the house. His wife processes yarn. She travels by herself to the market in order to sell it. Abduvoid tends livestock in the mountains and returns home very late. Not long ago he found out from his neighbors that he could take out a loan from our organization to increase his livestock count. Now he is also our client.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Abdukahhor

texts.en:
Abdukahhor B. is 32 years old, married, and has two children that he lives with. He has been a farmer for 10 years, an activity he undertook after having his first child. However, Abdukahhor has always taken pleasure in working the land and now particularly enjoys cultivating tomatoes and millet. Although his crops are annual, they are very profitable, and during the season they are very much in demand in large quantities. For this reason, Abdukahhor diligently cares for his crops so he can benefit from a good harvest. He also mentions that it is difficult sowing the plants and protecting them from insect infestation. This is his first loan application with IMON International. Abdukahhor will invest the funds he requests to purchase seeds and fertilizer for his farmland.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Bavi Dani El Group

texts.en:
Rani baji wants a loan to buy wheat to sell.

Veenus baji wants a loan to buy goats for her animal-selling business.

Rasoolan baji and Sugran baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops.

Bavi baji is the group leader of the above mentioned four ladies. They all belong to a city named Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. Bavi baji is a very hardworking lady. She operates a business sewing clothes to pay off the utilities of her house. She and her husband share the financial burden so they live happy and fight with the circumstances.

Her husband sells construction supplies and has three years of experience in this business. Bavi baji is applying for a loan to buy construction supplies to complete the orders of her husband’s customers because nowadays he is out of stock.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for her husband's business

loans.name: Lovely

texts.en:
Lovely has aimed to raise her family from poverty in order to give their children a better future. “However, life really was like a wheel,” said Lovely. “Sometimes we are on top and sometimes we’re at the bottom.”

Lovely is married to Leonermar who helps her with his utmost power to secure their children’s future. Lovely manages a vegetable vending business while her husband patiently tills their farm lot. Sometimes, her husband also serves as a tricycle-transport operator in their village to earn some extra income.

Lovely is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000 as additional working capital. She is glad that she is able to earn an income of around PHP 800 weekly from her vegetable vending business. She hopes that her business grows bigger through the assistance of the Kiva lenders and with continued hard work and patience.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Tely

texts.en: Tely B. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 35 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. Tely owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Tely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Tely is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Genedina

texts.en: Genedina E. is from the town of Tacangon, Mahinog, Camiguin. She is 57 years old, is widowed, and has school-aged children. Genedina owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling generally manufactured products to local businesses and community members. Genedina has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Genedina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Genedina is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela produces and sells disinfectant, liquid soap and air freshener. She has been in this business since 1994. She is requesting a loan of N80,000 to purchase more disinfectant materials to enable her produce more to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more disinfectant materials to sell

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary N. is a determined and hard-working lady. She has run a retail shop and a waragi (Ugandan beer) business for 7 years in Luwayo. She is a single mother of 7 children aged 32-12 years. She also cares for 4 dependents. She is happy to say that her previous loans have enabled her children attend school. Two have graduated from university, one is now taking a course of study, and the rest are in secondary schools. 

In her shop, Mary sells food and refreshments. As a result, she makes 200,000/= ("/=" is the symbol for Ugandan shillings) in profit each month. She has a strong plan too expand her shop to earn more income for her children’s continued education and general upkeep. 

She needs a loan to help purchase more stock for her grocery shop. She is 48 years old and divorced. Her hard work has benefited her and her family a lot.

loans.use: Restocking her shop with more products and buying more raw materials for making waragi.

loans.name: Josephina

texts.en:
Josephina is a member of the Majengo borrower group in Kiboriloni, Kilimanjaro. She is 46 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 4 children. Her children are 24,16,13 and 9 years old.

Josephina has owned a food business for  7  years,  she works 10 hours a day and earns a monthly profit approximately 300,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Josephina`s  second loan from BRAC_Tanzania. She requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Josephina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities to her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria manages a general store in her village. She also sells rice, which has been a great help in making her business profitable. Maria would like to ask for financial assistance from Kiva lenders to help her expand her business. She has lots of dreams and one is to make progress in her business. Maria is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to be used as additional working capital.
 
Maria is 62 years old and lives in Malamag West Tumauini, Isabela. She have two children, Jemma and Donna. Jemma is a 27-year-old college graduate who works as a teacher in Tumauini. Donna is 23 years old. She also graduated from college and is currently looking for a job. Now that her children are done with their education, Maria is aiming to elevate their standard of living with the help of her business income. She hopes that the loan request will be granted because it will help her attain her dreams for her family.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: louer un tracteur, effectuer du labour, et acheter des engrais

loans.name: Hadijatu

texts.en: Hadijatu is 50 years old and married with 2 children. Her husband is a mechanic. She sells sarongs and foodstuffs in her stall in Lagos State, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan amount of N 140,000, with which she will purchase more sarongs and foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing more sarongs and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea T., age 29, lives in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She earns a living by selling groceries from her house, including cooked foods, soft drinks, plastic goods, and sweets for children. She has been in this business for a long time and has much experience. 

Chea T. is married and cares for four children, all of whom are single and attend school. Her husband is a local motorcycle taxi driver. Chea T. works hard every day and is a very responsible for her family. Recently, she sold all her groceries from her store, because of grocery selling is Chea T.'s main way to earn an income to support her family. She would like to ask for a loan to purchase a range of groceries to sell. With the remaining amount, she will build a grocery store. 

Chea T. and her husband appear in the photograph.

loans.use: To purchase groceries to sell and to build a grocery store

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas N. is a 45-year-old married father of three children. He lives with his family in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. He has a yard in Mshomoroni where he sells timber and firewood. He has been in this business for 10 years and considers his business a success. Thomas was introduced to KADET by a friend and he is currently accessing his first loan. With the money, he intends to buy more timber and some rollers for machines he uses in his work.

He hopes to now open another timber yard and even expand to other areas of Mombasa. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase timber and rollers for his machine.

loans.name: Noelia Bernarda

texts.es: Noelia Bernarda tiene la edad de 37 años, es una mujer casada. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que inicio con esfuerzo propio anteriormente no tenia lo suficientes recursos para tener su proprio negocio, era uno de los trabajos que más le gusto ya que lograba conversar con sus clientes y conocía las necesidades de cada uno de ellos, por lo que fue una manera de mejorar los pocos ingresos necesarios para su familia. Manteniendo ese entusiasmo para sus clientes. Es así que decide realizar este financiamiento con el fin de invertir en su negocio para capital de trabajo para pantalones, camisas, shorts, faldas vestidos y algunos trajes por lo que se acerca la temporada navideña y tiene muchos pedidos. El deseo de ella es que su negocio aumente para beneficio de su familia.
texts.en:
Noelia Bernarda is 37 years old and married. She takes care of one son. Her economic activity is the sale of general merchandise. She has been working in this business for the past four years, which she started with her own effort. Previously she didn't have enough resources to start her own business. This was one of the jobs she has enjoyed the most because she is able to converse with her customers and knows each of their needs. This was a way to increase the little income necessary for her family. She’s enthusiastic for her customers. She is requesting this financing to invest in working capital for her business such as pants, shirts, shorts, skirts, dresses, and some suits since the holiday season is approaching and she has many orders. Her wish is to improve her business for the benefit of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Kazim

texts.en: Kazim J. is 54-years-old with a demanding job, having been a farmer for the last 7 years. Today, as a head of household, he works tirelessly to generate stable income. He cares for his animals, getting up very early to gather grass so that he can keep his livestock well-fed. Kazim sells the milk they produce, as well as the meat. He is seeking his current loan for the purchase of additional cows to expand his business. Please help support Kazim’s efforts so he can continue to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: purchase three cattle and fodder

loans.name: Suorng

texts.en: Suorng R. is a farmer who has raised many types of crops on her land since early 2000. She also buys rice in bulk when prices are low and sells it when prices are high. She was married, but divorced her husband when their three children were veR. young. One of her children now helps support the family by working in construction, while other two attend school. Recently Suorng R. has lacked sufficient funds to buy rice for resale, and has applied for this loan to make these rice purchases possible.

loans.use: To buy rice for resale when prices are high.

loans.name: Davaa

texts.en:
Davaa is a math teacher who lives with her husband and their 3- and 7-year-old daughters. She has lived in the city for the past eight years. She took out a clean-fuel loan to help her save money and to reduce air pollution in the city. Davaa said that the fuel “has many advantages, including the need to use less of it than regular fuel and that keeps us warmer. It is an especially nice opportunity for people who have a low income to purchase the fuel through a loan. By using this cleaner fuel, we use less fuel. For example, we previously had to burn extra fuel at night, but now we don’t need to do that because the new fuel burns longer.” 

About XacBank Eco Products Program

Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital in the world. Winter temperatures can average -20 Celsius. Sixty percent of the city's population live in tents called gers, with wooden frames covered by layers of wool felt. On average, households located in the Ger Districts use 5 tons of coal and 1.5 tons of wood per year. Sixty percent of the pollution in the city during the heating season is attributed to coal burned in the Ger Districts. The bottom fifth quintile spend as much as 40% of their monthly winter income on heating fuels.

XacBank has worked with MicroEnergy Credits to launch a line of eco-products consisting of energy-efficient stoves and ger blankets, which will reduce energy consumption.

loans.use: Clean and energy efficient heating fuel

loans.name: El Hadji

texts.fr: Monsieur El Hadj N.   est un célibataire âgé de 39 ans. Il s’active dans la restauration  et pratique également le métier de chauffeur. Il assistait son cousin dans sa pâtisserie et lorsque ce dernier s’émigra en Europe, Monsieur  N. hérita ce commerce de restauration. Ainsi comme il est membre  de U-IMCEC Bambey une ville située à 120 Kms de Dakar, Monsieur El Hadji N. souhaitait un financement de 400 000  FCFA  pour le business. Il compte ravitailler sa boutique d’alimentation en boissons, jus et des conserveries, acheter un mouton pour sa dibiterie et des poulets .
texts.en:
Mr. El Hadj N. is a single 39 year old man. His business is food service and also as a taxi driver. He assisted his cousin in his cousin's bakery and when his cousin emigrated to Europe, Mr. N. inherited this restaurant. As a member of U-IMCEC Bambey, in a city located 120 kilometers from Dakar, Mr. El Hadji N. is requesting a 400 000 FCFA loan for his business. He intends to use this loan to stock his store with drinks, juices and jams; additionally, he intend to purchase a sheep and chickens for grilled meats.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To restock his business

loans.name: Huyagbat

texts.en: Huyagbat B. is a 37-year-old man whose family lives in Arhangay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Since 2000, he has been running a raw materials sales business. He buys animal skins, cashmere and wool from local herders and sells them at the local market or transports them to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia to sell for a better price. Besides this business, together with his spouse Saihantuya, he runs a retail stall at the local market. He purchases many of the household items at wholesale prices while traveling to the capital city, and sells them to local residents. Huyagbat and Saihantuya have three children. All their children go to the local elementary school. Huyagbat requests a loan to purchase more animal related raw material to increase his business inventory.

loans.use: To purchase more animal skins

loans.name: Koemly

texts.en: Mrs. Koemly Y. is a 30-year-old woman who lives in Ampil Rieng village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Ros Tuy, are farmers who own a small field to cultivate rice to support their family of two children — a four-year old and one in school. She is requesting 2,000,000 Riels from AMK to buy timber to fix up her house.

loans.use: To buy timbers

loans.name: Serikbol

texts.en:
Serikbol is 37 years old and resides with his wife and three children in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a “ger” in Bayan-Ulgii Province, Mongolia. Serikbol and his wife are both disabled and receive assistance from the government. They have three children, the oldest of whom attends a local secondary school. Serikbol, who owns a few cows, currently operates a milk-trading business, selling an average of four liters of milk per day locally at a price of 2000 tugrugs (~ 1 USD ) per litre.

Having found some success since he went into business in 2000, in 2003 Serikbol used his earnings to purchase a motorcycle which he utilizes to operate a taxi service that supplements his income by up to 5000 tugrugs (~ 4 USD) per day. A very hardworking person who is focused on the future, he says, “My dream is to one day have my own cow farm.” He is requesting a 500,000 tugrug loan to purchase fodder for his cows.

loans.use: To purchase fodder for his cows

loans.name: Bassirou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Bassirou D.  âgé de 68 ans est père de 10 enfants dont les âges varient entre 39 et 7 ans.  Il nous a accordé cet entretien lors  du montage de son dossier de crédit à  IMCEC Diourbel.
-Quel est votre domaine d’activité ?
Monsieur D. : je suis Tailleur et je confectionne des habits que je vende
-	Dites moi Monsieur D., comment vous avez choisi votre métier ?
Monsieur D. : c’est un métier que j’ai appris il y’a longtemps et  en commençant petit à petit j’ai réussi à agrandir mon métier pour gagner plus
-	Quel est l’aspect le plus important de votre travail ?
Monsieur D. : la confection d’habits,  s’il n’y’a pas production je ne parviens pas à régler mes besoins personnels et ceux de ma famille 
-	Dites-moi, l’objet de ce crédit que vous sollicitez ?
Monsieur D. : je veux acheter des tissus, fils….. etc  pour coudre des habits afin de  les revendre à bon prix
-	Quel est l’impact de ce crédit sur votre situation sociale ?
Monsieur D. : régler des besoins familiaux tout en espérant sur une bonne marche des affaires
-	Quel montant demandez-vous ?
Monsieur D. : 150 000 FCFA et je te rappelle que j’avais pris 2 crédits que j’ai réglé sans problèmes.
texts.en:
Mr. Bassirou D., 68 years old, is the father of 10 children whose ages range between 39 and 7 years old. He granted us this interview as we were putting together his loan application at IMCEC Diourbel. - What is your field of activity? Mr. D.: I am a tailor and I make clothing that I sell. - Tell me Mr. D., how did you choose your profession? Mr. D.: It is a profession I learned a long time ago and I started, and bit-by-bit I succeeded in expanding my business to earn more. - What is the most important part of your work? Mr. D.: The making of clothing, if there is no production I cannot provide for my personal needs and those of my family. - Tell me what use you will make of this loan? Mr. D.: I would like to buy fabric, sewing thread etc… to sew clothing in order to sell them at a good price. - What is the impact of this loan on your social status? Mr. D.: To provide for the family’s needs while hoping that business will be good. - What is the amount you are asking? Mr. D.: 150,000 Francs CFA and I am reminding you that I took two loans that I repaid without problem.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make new pieces of clothing and sell them.

loans.name: Modibo

texts.fr:
Monsieur Modibo Traoré est âgée de 33 ans, père de 3enfants et vit dans une famille traditionnelle avec son époux et ses enfants  dans le quartier Fana coura, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro République du Mali.
Pour des raisons purement économiques, Modibo s’adonna au commerce il y’à environ cinq ans de cela.
Après avoir correctement remboursé les prêts précédents, il vient de renouveler sa demande pour un nouveau prêt. 
Il compte acheter deux sacs de 50kg de sucre, trois cartons de thé, cinq paquets de savon, un bidon de 20litres d’huile alimentaire, des paquets de bonbon et des boîtes de conserves alimentaires.
Il s’approvisionne le plus généralement à Bamako presque chaque deux semaines en gros avec les grossistes du grand marché. Il vient revendre dans sa boutique en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Il espère réaliser un bénéfice d’environ 30 000FCFA par mois avec lequel il va faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Mr. Modibo Traoré, age 33, is the father of three children and lives in a traditional family with his wife and children in the Fana Coura district, sub-prefecture of Fana, Region of Koulikoro, Republic of Mali.  For purely economic reasons, he has been devoting all his time to commerce for the past five years.  After having correctly repaid the preceding loans, he just renewed his request for a new one.  He intends to buy two 50-kg sacks of sugar, three boxes of tea, five packets of soap, a 20-liter container of vegetable oil, packages of candy, and some canned foods.  He stocks up on bulk goods from wholesalers at the big market, for the most part in Bamako, almost every two weeks.  He then sells the goods retail in his store, accepting cash and credit from a customer base composed of women and men.  He hopes to make profit of about 30,000 francs CFA per month that will be used for addressing day-to-day expenses. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying store merchandise

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es: Eusebia, de 30 años, vive con su esposo  y sus 3 hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde su niñez se dedica a la  agricultura. En la actualidad trabaja en sus campos, junto a su esposo, todos los días labora desde muy temprano con mucha dedicación para tener una cosecha exitosa y de esta manera mejorar sus ganancias. Siembra  maca (raíz con propiedades curativas) que es  muy comercial, pues  los cultivos necesitan de poco abono  y se produce en cantidad. Para el futuro tiene planeado adquirir más terrenos de cultivo y mejorar su producción.Es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete ser  muy responsable en el pago de sus cuotas, además agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Eusebia tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de un toro que le ayudará  como arado en su siembra, además pagará la mano  de obra de ayudantes para recoger su cosecha.
texts.en:
Eusebia, 30 years old, lives with her husband and their 3 children in their own house. Since her childhood she has worked in agriculture. These days she works in her fields along with her husband. Every day, starting early in the morning, they work with great dedication in order to have a successful harvest and in this way improve their income. She plants maca (a root plant with curative properties) which is a very good commercial product since the crop needs little fertilizer and produces in quantity. In the future she plans to acquire more cultivable fields and increase her production. This is the second time she will have a loan with MFP and she promises to be very responsible with the repayments. Also, she thanks everyone who made the loan possible since it will be very helpful to her in the progress of her business. Eusebia plans to invest the requested money in the purchase of a bull that will help her with plowing during planting and also to pay for the labor of workers who harvest the crop.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will pay workers for the harvest

loans.name: María Evangelina

texts.es:
