La Sra. María T. es socia del banco comunal Corazón de Jesús, vive en el valle en una comunidad llamada Paloma, en su mayor parte su población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería pero los jóvenes han migrado a la ciudad en busca de mejores oportunidades de trabajo.

Nuestra socia tiene 48 años de edad, es de estado civil divorciada y ha procreado 5 hijos que se encuentran de 25, 24, 19, 15, 14 años de edad. De los cuales los tres primeros hijos ya tiene sus propios hogares y todos viven de manera independiente; los dos últimos hijos de 15 y 14 años están trabajando en una carpintería ayudando a su madre con el dinero que ellos ganan aun que no mucho pero por lo menos para las necesidades  de la casa y de su familia, la Señora María tiene  casa propia en  donde viven felizmente ella y el resto de su espléndida familia.

La señora vive de las ganancias obtenidas por la venta de las carnes de  chancho, pollo, y cuyes  que ella misma se encarga de criarlos, también se dedica a la venta de leche de ganado vacuno, todas las ventas lo realiza dentro de su de propia comunidad donde vive. Nuestra socia ha recibido de la institución 3 créditos; los cuales  los ha solicitado para poder adquirir más animales para su negocio. Con su nuevo crédito que recibe de la fundación ESPOIR lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca lechera.

Su mayor sueño es comprar un terreno para construir las casas para sus hijos ya que este sueño lo ha venido deseando desde mucho tiempo atrás y espera lograrlo algún día.
texts.en:
Ms. María T. is a member of the communal bank "Corazón de Jesús" ("Heart of Jesus"). She lives in a valley community called Paloma, where most of the residents work in agriculture or raise livestock. Younger residents, however, have migrated to the city in search of better work opportunities. María is 48 years old, divorced, and has 5 children who are 25, 24, 19, 15, and 14 years old. The three oldest children already have their own homes and live independently. The two younger children, who are 15 and 14 years old, are working in a carpentry shop and helping their mother with the money they earn. Although it is not a lot, at least it is enough for the basic needs of their home and family. Ms. María has her own house where she lives happily with the rest of her wonderful family. She lives off the earnings from selling the meat of pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs that she raises herself. She also sells milk from cattle. She makes all of her sales in the community where she lives. She has received 3 loans from this organization. She requested them in order to acquire more animals for her business. She is going to invest in the purchase of a dairy cow with her newest loan from Fundación ESPOIR. Her greatest dream is to buy land to build houses for her children. She has been dreaming of this for a long time already and hopes to achieve it some day.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: 02.03.05-Hoang Dong-Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Nga C. T. (28) is a 40-year-old female living in the town of Hoang Hoa-Thanh Hoa.  Nga is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 02.03.05 Hoang Hoa (02.03.05-Hoang hoa).


Nga is married and has three school-aged children.  To make a living, Nga operates a family member's business venture raising cattle for sale.  Nga has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 900,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2006, Nga joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Nga has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Nga plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. T. Lay (30) is a 56-year-old female who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  N. T. Hoa (32) is a 36-year-old female who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


3.  N. T. Ly (31) is a 40-year-old female who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


4.  N. T. Hanh (65) is a 32-year-old female who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


5.  N. T. Ha (29) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Nga C. T. (28) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa- Thanh Hoa.  Nga là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.03.05 Hoang Hoa (02.03.05-Hoang hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Nga thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 15 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Nga kiếm được khoảng 900,000 VND.  Vào 2006, Nga đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Nga đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. T. Lay (30) là 56 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  N. T. Hoa (32) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  N. T. Ly (31) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  N. T. Hanh (65) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  N. T. Ha (29) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Martiza tiene 23 años, vive con su pareja y sus 2 pequeños hijos en una casa que le heredaron sus suegros. Hace más de 6 años trabaja cultivando papa, maíz, así también verduras, como: cebolla y lechuga, sobre terrenos que posee. Desde entones cada mañana, en compañía de sus esposo van al campo a cuidar sus plantaciones, de plagas o de alguna variación climática que perjudican la producción. Paralelamente cría cuyes y pollos, en la granja que tiene y cada semana los vende, así logra tener otro ingreso extra. Disfruta mucho el trabajo que realiza,  porque le permite estar en el campo y apreciar del bello paisaje que rodea su comunidad, además la recompensa lo obtiene cuando vende lo que ha cosechado. Su meta es tener mas extensiones de terreno, y un establo más grande para vacas y cuyes. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Maritza is 23 years old and lives with her husband and their two small children in a house that they inherited from her in-laws. For more than six years she has been growing potatoes, corn, as well as vegetables such as onions and lettuce on her own land. Each morning, she and her husband go to the fields to care for their crops and protect them from pests and occasional weather changes that can hurt production. In addition, Maritza raises guinea pigs and chickens on her farm and sells them each week to earn extra income. She enjoys her work tremendously because it allows her to be in the country and appreciate the beautiful landscape that surrounds her community. In addition, she is rewarded when her crops are sold. Her goal is to acquire more tracts of land and build a larger stable for housing cows and guinea pigs.

This is her second loan with MFP. Maritza has always demonstrated that she is responsible with her payments. She also enjoys being part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase of sacks of compost for her next planting.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Edelma Elena

texts.es: Edelma Elena L. R. es una señora trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora que se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras como papa, cebolla, piña, ayote, yuca, quequis etc. en los cuales invertirá el crédito con el propicito de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Edelma Elena L. R. is a hard working, dedicated and enterprising woman who sells fruits and vegetables, such as potatoes, onions, pineapple, squash, yucca, etc. This is where she will invest the money from this loan so that she can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle P. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 27 years old and is married.

Annabelle owns and operates a business providing repair services and general makeover or repainting of multicabs (small passenger vans) and other vehicles to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Annabelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be her first from HSPFI.

Annabelle plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Rosamar

texts.en:
Rosamar G. is from the town of Banga. She is 26 years old. Rosamar is married and has 2 young children. She is a farmer and has been planting and harvesting rice for more than a few years now. She and her husband work hard to keep their farm productive. When not busy at the farm, her husband drives a tricycle (three-whelled mototaxi) to earn extra money while she takes care of their little kids. Rosamar wants to have a happy and healthy family.

Rosamar joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosamar has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rosamar is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang N. is 30 years of age and is a resident of Siem Reap Province. Hang N. is a good homemaker who spends her time either taking care of her kids or cooking delicious meals for her family. The family's daily expenses are covered by Hang N.’s husband, who owns a car that he uses to pick up tourists who want to visit the temples in Siem Reap Province. Hang N. has a younger sister who lives with them and works as a staff member in a hotel. 

Hang N. will be using her fist loan to buy a used motorcycle to make her family's transportation easier.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buying peppers and potato greens for resale

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila G., 46, lives in Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Hernando G. and has two young hard-working adult children and three still in school. By the grace of God, Mila has managed to support her older children's schooling up to college level. She works hard to provide income for her family's every-day expenses. Mila operates a granite business designing, crafting and producing granite furniture. Most often, orders are for granite tables. 

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a Php10, 000 loan to buy raw materials. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 
 
Mila dreams of being able to renovate her house. She faithfully meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: buy raw materials

loans.name: Nuestra Señora Del Valle - Sapallanga Group

texts.es:
Violeta, D. 32 años, es madre soltera con 2 hijos, es integrante D. la Alcancia comunal "Nuestra Señora del Valle - Sapallanga", Ella empezo a trabajar como mesera en un restaurante D. marisqueria, con los años fue adquiriendo experiencia ene le negocio D. venta D. comida. asi mismo trabajo como cocinera por un tiempo D. 5 años. Para luego tomar la decision que era momento D. abrir su porpio negocio D. venta comida, y así lo hizo y junto a una socia. lograron abrir un negocio D. venta D. comida el cuela va funcionando bien desD. hace ya 1 año. 

Con el crédito adquirido podra comprar insumos para aumentar la venta D. comida y poder incrementar sus ingresos, para D. este modo dar a mis hijos la comodidad que se merecen.
texts.en:
Violeta is 32 years of age, and is a single mother with 2 children. She is a member of the Nuestra Señora del Valle - Sapallanga Communal Bank. She started working as a waitress in a seafood restaurant, and then over a period of 5 years, gained experience working as a cook. After this, she decided it was time to open her own food business, and was able to do so together with a partner. It's been a year now, and business is good.  

With this loan, she plans to increase her supply of products, which will help her increase sales and bring in more income.  This will help her give her children all the comforts they deserve.

loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MERCAMUEBLE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Srta. Honorata; ella tiene 31 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, ella atiende desde las 7:00 a.m hasta 10:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio ella está ahorrando y así mas adelante poder estudiar, la socia quiere implementar el restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz, carne y verduras para cocinar.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Honorata is a member of the Communal Bank “Mercamueble”, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 31 years old and single. Honorata divides her time between her daily activities and managing her restaurant business. She prepares breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Honorata works from 7am until 10pm. Through her business, she is able to save and move forward with her studies. Honorata wants to keep her restaurant in operation, so she is requesting a loan to buy products such as rice, meat, and vegetables for cooking.

She is grateful to those who have helped fulfill her dream and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase rice, meat, and vegetables

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en: Joseline M.  is in the business of selling clothes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more clothes to sell. She is 27 years old and married to a peasant. She has three children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anorbegim

texts.en:
Anorbegim is married with two children. She runs a pharmaceutical business. Anorbegim owns one small pharmaceutical kiosk and sells medications to retail clients. She launched this business 14 years ago. Olga is seeking a loan of 5000 Somoni to purchase assorted pharmaceuticals for the cold season when viruses, cold, and flu lead to increased spending on medications. 

Anorbegim’s business is the main source of income for the family and her husband is also actively involved in the business.  Anorbegim hopes to continue to develop her business by opening several more pharmaceutical kiosks.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase medications for pharmacy sale

loans.name: Florencio

texts.es:
Florencio tiene 48 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos menores, reside junto a su familia en el distrito de La Victoria, una zona bastante comercial que se encuentra situada cerca a la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace siete años a la venta de frutas y verduras de estación en un puesto ambulante del mercado modelo, el adquiere su mercadería a los productores de la zona en el mercado mayorista de la región. Actualmente ofrece en venta maíz morado, su clientela se encuentra fidelizada y siempre acude a su establecimiento a adquirir sus productos ya que siempre los vende frescos. Esta actividad le permite solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a su familia a salir adelante.

Florencio desea adquirir más frutas de estación para surtir su negocio y satisfacer su demanda. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles con los cuales planea lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Florencio is 48 years old.  He is married and has two dependent children.  He lives with his family in La Victoria district which is quite a commercial area located near the city of Chiclayo.

For seven years, Florencio has been selling seasonal fruit and vegetables on a stall in the 'mercado modelo' market.  He acquires his merchandise from local farmers in the regional wholesale market.  He currently sells 'maíz morado' (purple corn).  He has loyal customers who always come to his establishment to buy since he always sells fresh produce.  This business allows Florencio to cover his personal expenses and support his family in getting ahead.

Florencio would like to acquire more seasonal fruit to stock his business and satisfy demand.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa with which he plans to achieve his goal.

loans.use: To acquire more seasonal fruit to stock his business and satisfy demand

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El señor Daniel, es casado  con la señora Adela, en donde procreo cuatro hijos de los cuales una  sigue a su responsabilidad y es Iris Guadalupe de diecisiete años en quinto semestre de bachillerato.
        Se dedica a su taller mecánico  desde hace ocho años  en donde le va bien ya que a obtenido buen resultado en agrandar su negocio y obtener más clientela ya que le gratifican  y  le  pagan bien por darle, buen servicio  a sus automóviles.
       Practica esta actividad desde muy pequeño ya que gracias su padre quien lo corrió de su casa tuvo que comenzar atrabajar y por unos tíos entro atrabaja en un taller del cual le gusto y se preparo para mejorar su aprendizaje.
     De lo que trabaja durante todos los días lo invierte en lo mismo para comprar más herramientas que utiliza para la compostura de los automóviles  que repara  y para eso solicito el préstamo para apoyarse con los gastos.
     Lo que el  desea es  ahorrar par mejorar su taller mecánico, como tambien  poder apoyar asu hija que esta estudiando y quiere que logre sacar una carrera del cual aproveche  cuando ya este grande.
texts.en:
Mr. Daniel is married to Mrs. Adela with whom he has four children.  One daughter, Iris Guadalupe, 17, still depends on him.  She is in the 5th semester of high school.

He has had a vehicle repair shop for the last 8 years.  He does well there in that he has been able to enlarge his business and acquire more customers who pay well for his car repair services.

He has been in this line of work since a very young age because his father threw him out of his house and he had to start working.  Some uncles helped him get a job in a shop and he liked the work and prepared himself to improve during his apprenticeship.

He works every day and invests in his job to buy the tools and supplies he uses to repair automobiles.  This is why he has asked for a loan to help out with these expenses.

What he wants is to save up to improve his shop as well as to support his daughter who is studying and wants to finish a career that will be of use to her when she grows up.

loans.use: To buy vehicle repair supplies like: brake pads, spark plugs and filters, among others.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a 27 years old married  woman with 2 children, aged 9 and 2 years, living in her own house in Hioma Uganda . She has no other dependents and her family goal is to educate her children . She runs a retail shop and has been doing this for 2 years. She started it from her savings and she hopes in the future to improve her business into a whole sale shop. Caroline needs this loan to buy rice, flour and sugar to sell.

loans.use: Purchase rice,flour and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl, de 22 años de edad, natural del distrito de San Miguel, convive con Hortensia de 18 años y  fruto de ese gran amor tienen un hijo, Jefferson de 03 años.  Juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Palmapampa distrito de Samugari. Raúl, es un joven con muchas proyecciones y aspiraciones, es por eso que desde que se comprometió con Hortensia, los padres de Raúl le cedieron 02 hectáreas de terreno, desde entonces cultiva café y hojas de coca, para que pueda así brindarle una mejor estabilidad económica a su propia familia. Raúl es campesino y ha trabajado en esta actividad durante 03 años, y menciona que la temporada de cosecha es la que más satisfacción le da, puesto que produce en cantidad y eso le da mayor rentabilidad, ya que es vendida a las empresas acopiadoras. Considera que lo más difícil es trasladar los productos desde la cosecha hasta el punto de secado, ahora su principal prioridad es juntar más capital para comprar nuevas tierras y sembrar nuevas plantas. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. Agradece a su banco  comunal por consignar la confianza y permitirle trabajar conjuntamente con el resto de los socios. Con los  mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará sacos de abono para mejorar su parcela y así obtener mejores cosechas en adelante.
texts.en: Raúl, who is 22 years old, is a native of the San Miguel district. He lives with Hortensia who is 18 years old and the fruit of their great love, their son, Jefferson who is 3 years old.  They live together in their own house located in the community of Palmapampa in the district of Samugari. Raúl is a young man with many hopes and goals. It is for this reason that when he got engaged to Hortensia, Raúl's parents gave him 2 hectares of land. Since then he has been growing coffee and coca leaves so he can offer better economic stability to his family. Raúl is a countryman and has worked in this activity for 3 years. He mentioned that harvest time is when he is happiest since he produces in quantity and this gives him greater profitability when it is sold to the businesses. The thing he considers most difficult is transferring the products from where they are harvested to where they are dried. Now his biggest priority is to put together more capital to buy new land and plant new plants. This is his first loan with MFP and he feels that this investment will help him greatly progressing his work. He is grateful to the communal bank for having confidence in him and allowing him to work together with the rest of the members. With the thousand nuevos soles he is requesting, he will buy bags of fertilizer to improve his plot of land and therefore get a better harvest in the future.

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila D. is from the village of Dist.1, San Manuel. She is 42 years old. Nila is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Nila owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Nila has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Nila joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Nila is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offerings. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Nila from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase the important things to make his garden more productive

loans.name: Delfin

texts.en:
Delfin P. is from the town of Pob. Lopez Jaena, Mis. Occ. He is 34 years old. Delfin is married. To make a living, Delfin works in someone else's business venture making & selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Delfin has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Delfin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delfin is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase raw materials like wood, nails, varnish and paints to make additional furniture. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Delfin from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials like wood, nails, varnish and paints to make additional furniture

loans.name: Wennie

texts.en:
Wennie is 54 years old and married with five children.

Wennie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Wennie has borrowed and paid back 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from Generic Medicines and networking business like AVON products.

Wennie aspires to expand her business and buy farming equipment.

loans.use: To pay for the purchase of stock to sell

loans.name: Annalie

texts.en:
This is Annalie M., 25, who desires stability for her personal and family life. She is happily married to Joemarie M. and they are blessed with two children who are currently studying in public elementary and high school. Together they live on Rodriguez Street, Pasay City, Philippines. 

Annalie has managed a computer shop for almost two years now. She rents her computers by the hour to her community for surfing, social networking, and even doing research for students. She earns an estimated net income of around 1000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month. 

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan. She is planning to use this loan to purchase two additional computer units. She expects a boost in her business income through the proper use of this loan. 

Annalie prays that her children will become God fearing individuals and will be able to finish their studies up to college through her hard work on doing her business. She also desires a good and happy life for her entire family. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship  meeting* where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community members are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners that meet on a weekly basis. The fellowship groups gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy two additional computers

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVA ESPERANZA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a L. provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

L. socia es L. Sra. Sayda; elL. es conviviente y tiene 30 años y tiene 2 hijos; L. socia trabaja con su negocio D. venta D. tienda D. abarrotes y también hace servicio D. llamadas en forma ambulatoria, L. socia trabaja en L. tienda D. abarrotes desD. las 8:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m y en las tardes realiza el en servicio D. llamadas, por medio D. este negocio L. socia saca adelante a sus hijos, L. socia quiere ampliar el negocio D. tienda D. abarrotes y servicio D. llamadas. L. socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite y fideos para L. tienda D. abarrotes y también para pagar las líneas D. teléfono.


Los otros socios  se dedican al transporte, servicio D. taxi, venta D. teléfonos, negocio D. tienda D. abarrotes y venta D. carros.


L. socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "Nueva Esperanza".  The bank is located in the district, province and department of Cusco. 

Señora Sayda is 30 years old, has 2 children and lives with her partner.  She runs a grocery store and also has a calling service that she runs in an itinerant manner.  She works in her grocery store from 8:00 am until 2:00 pm and in the afternoon she runs her calling service.  Through these businesses she is able to proviD. for her children.  She wants to expand her grocery business and her calling service.  She is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, oil and noodles for her grocery store and also to pay for the phone lines.  

The other members jobs incluD. transport, taxi service, telephone sales, grocery store and car sales. 

Señora Sayda is grateful to those who will make this dream a reality.  She is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil and noodles for her grocery store and to also pay for her phone lines

loans.name: Benny

texts.en:
Benny is 44, married, and has one child. 

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Benny is borrowing 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. 

Benny has been farming sugarcane for nine years and also earns additional income from a sari-sari store. (A sari-sari store is a small general store, typically operated out of a home.)

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Leonilo

texts.en:
Leonilo is from the village of Sagrada Familia, Tambulig Zamnboanga del sur. He is 43 years old. Leonilo is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Leonilo owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Leonilo has been engaged in his business for over 21 years and earns approximately 12745 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Leonilo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonilo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used  to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Leonilo is requesting a new loan of 40000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. It will also help him to finance for farm maintenance. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Leonilo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure and to finance for farm maintenance

location.town: Sagrada Familia, Tambulig, Zamboanga del sur

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a widow with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Corazon is 42 years old. Two of her children are in school.

Corazon has a general store business in the Philippines. Corazon requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like biscuits, candies, etc. to sell in her store.

Corazon has been in this business for five years. In the future, Corazon would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like biscuits, candies, etc. to sell in her store

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Uganda.  She is married and has twelve children, seven of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (two orphans from her late brothers).    

Florence has a pub.  She has been in this business for many years, and she works seven days out of every week. Florence sells her products in a shop,  retail.     Florence has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy  more crates of beer and soda and jerrycans of local gin.   She also generates additional income through rental rooms and poultry farming. 

The main business challenges for Florence include seasonality and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked bar.   Florence lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda and jerrycans of local gin.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with ten children, seven of whom attend school while threehave  graduated from school. She lives in a house that she owns with electricity but no piped water.

For the past four years, Mwanamisi has operated a fish selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming a wholesale supplier of fish in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 loan Mwanamisi wants to renovate her selling stall and purchase sacks of fish for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To renovate her selling stall and purchase sacks of fish for sale.

loans.name: Charity Group

texts.en:
Bonhiwe is 28 years old and single with two children who both attend school. She also cares for many relatives that live with her. For the last five years, she has been operating a food stall from her home in Empangeni, South Africa. She sells cakes, chips, and sausages to her neighbors. She also receives money from the South African government to support her children.

Bonhiwe requested a loan through WDB and Kiva to buy ingredients that she will use to make food. Eventually, she would like to open a shelter away from her home to sell her food. Her business has been growing, which has helped her send her children to school. She says that WDB and Kiva have helped her by lending money, and she sees her life improving greatly. In the photo, she is pictured raising her hand.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making food to sell

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion  is 67 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Asuncion  has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 16 years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks. 

Asuncion  has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Asuncion  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

loans.name: Diame

texts.fr: -Monsieur Diame  vit au Sénégal, il est âgé de 52 ans, il est marié sans enfant. Il évolue dans la maçonnerie et  la location des chambres et magasins. Monsieur Diame a choisit ces activités par nécessité afin de pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins ; Ce qui lui plait le plus dans la maçonnerie, c’est sa capacité de faire face à la demande de plus en plus croissante de ses services. Il est sociétaire d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis avril 2010. Il sollicite un crédit de 400000 prévu pour effectuer les travaux de réfection d’une de ses maisons qu’il va mettre en location. Ce projet  lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus mensuels et de mieux satisfaire ses besoins d’ordre familial et personnel.
texts.en:
Mr. Diame lives in Senegal. He is 52 years old, married, and without children. He works in masonry and rents out rooms and stores. Mr. Diame chose these businesses by necessity in order to support himself. What he likes the most about masonry is the ability to meet the burgeoning demand for his services. 

He has been an associate of one of the U-IMCEC branches since April 2010. He is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs for carrying out his renovation work for his houses that he will put up for rent. This project will enable him to increase his monthly revenues and to do better in meeting his own need and those of his family.

loans.use: to renovate a bedroom to rent out

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
SEGUNDO tiene 58 años de edad es casado, vive con la esposa y los dos hijos de veintinueve y veintitrés años de edad en el  Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

Los Miembros de la VRC Voluntad de Dios, se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad la cría, Parroquia Guanujo a una distancia de 20 minutos perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la Agricultura y ganadería.

Segundo se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, tiene casa propia, 3 cuadras de terreno, siembra papas, maíz, trigo, habas, alverja además cría otras especies de animales como cerdos, ovejas pollos y cuyes. Compra y vende sus productos en la ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para compra de abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, líquidos para plagas, insumos y  para sembrar papas e incrementar su negocio. El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos el incremento y caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los bruscos cambios climáticos por los que estamos atravesando. 

Su sueño es tener salud para poder seguir adelante, ampliar su producción, tener una vida tranquila y sacar a sus hijos adelante. 

Le gusta las festividades del carnaval y las del sector.
texts.en:
Segundo is 58 years old, married and lives with his wife and two sons, 29 and 23, in Guaranda canton, in Bolivar province.

The members of Voluntad de Dios communal bank are located in La Cria community, about 20 minutes from Guanujo parish in Guaranda canton. The members of this communal bank work in agriculture and livestock.

Segundo is an agriculturalist and stock breeder. He has his own home and 3 cuadras of land [approximately 4.5 acres]. He plants potatoes, corn, wheat, fava beans and peas and also raises different kinds of animals such as pigs, sheep, chickens and guinea pigs. He buys and sells his products in the city of Guaranda.

He is requesting the loan to buy compost, seeds, fertilizer, liquid pesticides for pest infestations, supplies for planting potatoes and to increase his business. The loan will help to provide for his economic needs and to improve his agricultural activities. He faces challenges such as the rise and fall of prices for the products he markets, as well as the sudden changes in the weather that we are now experiencing.

His dream is to be healthy in order to get ahead, to expand his production, to have a peaceful life and to help his sons get ahead.

He enjoys the celebrations at Carnival and especially those held in his area.

loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, fertilizer, liquid pesticides for pest infestations and supplies to plant potatoes and to increase his business.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela nació en la ciudad Cusco y tiene 33 años de edad, ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos. 

Actualmente, Gabriela vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella es cocinera y trabaja en el comedor nacional de la ciudad del Cusco, ella trabaja de lunes a viernes desde hace 3 años en el comedor nacional y le va muy bien, ella los días sábados y domingos se dedica  a la venta de pasamanería. En esta oportunidad Gabriela requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo betunes, jaboncillos, pasadores y otras cosas más. 

El Banco Comunal “Salud” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Gabriela was born in the city of Cusco.  She is 33 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children.

Gabriela currently lives in the city in which she was born and this is where she carries out her business activities.  She is a cook and works in the national restaurant, in the city of Cusco.  She has been working there from Monday to Friday for the past three years and is doing very well.  On Saturdays and Sundays she sells miscellaneous goods.  On this occasion, Gabriela needs a loan to buy more merchandise such as shoe polish, soap, shoelaces, etc.

The 'Salud' community bank meets once a month in the city of Cusco (Peru).  Cusco is well known as being a very touristy, commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi fiesta and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world (Machu Picchu).

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as shoe polish, soap, shoelaces, etc.

loans.name: Jacqueline Lisette

texts.es: Jacqueline Lisette de veinticuatro años de edad vive con su madre al norte del país en uno de los municipios populosos y consecuentemente muy buenos para comercializar, ella posee una panadería desde hace cuatro años, la que es muy conocida en la localidad donde reside pues prepara el mejor pan del lugar y en variedad  dulce y salado: alfajores, cachitos, salpores, semita, torta de fruta, entre  otros. Se situa en una de las calles donde transitan muchas personas que se convierten en clientes potenciales, quienes la prefieren porque sus productos finales son de excelente calidad y a precios bajos; La mañana de Jacqueline inicia a las 4 de la mañana y lográr hornear el pan frances que día a día envía a través de un repartidor a tiendas y clientes fijos cercanos a su residencia, es una mujer emprendedora en definitiva, piensa mucho en su madre que por su avanzada edad ya no puede trabajar y es lo que a ella le inspira día a día; realmente ella dice disfrutar mucho de esta actividad, además espera poder algún día poder pagarse un curso o capacitación en panificación con el que pueda mejorar su actividad productiva, además comprar insumos como harina, huevos, levadura, azúcar, leche y mantequilla, para poder cubrir el incremento de demanda que últimamente han hecho sus clientes; el no contar con recurso propio es lo que ha hecho que se acerque a la mano amiga de INTEGRAL para adquirir un crédito que le permita comprar los insumos dichos. Jacqueline Lisette tiene fe que su trabajo le dará la oportunidad de darle a su mamá una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
24-year old Jacqueline Lisette lives with her mother in the north of the country in a densely population area which is consequently very good for business. She has run a bakery for four years. It is well known as Jacqueline makes the best bread in the area as well as a variety of sweet and savoury items: alfajores, croissants, scones, semitas (tart of bread dough filled with jam), fruit tarts etc. The bakery is located in a busy street where many passers by are regular customers because of her excellent baking and low prices. 

Jacqueline starts work at 4am daily when she bakes French loaves ready for a delivery person to take them to stores and regular clients near her home. In short, she is an enterprising person, inspired by her elderly mother who can no longer work because of her age. She truly enjoys her work.

She hopes one day to be able to afford to take a course or some training in bread-making so that she can improve her products. She now wants to buy supplies such as flour, eggs, yeast, sugar, milk and butter so she can fulfill her customers' orders. As she doesn't have any money of her own, she is seeking a helping hand from INTEGRAL and asking for a loan to buy the above items. Jacqueline Lisette is certain that her business will give her the opportunity to provide her mother with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as flour, eggs, yeast, sugar, milk and butter

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 26 years old and married to Peter who does a livestock business in order to add more income to the family. She has two children. She sells airtime credit cards for the Zain, Safaricom and YU lines. She has been in this business for four years and right now her monthly income is KES 15,000.

She has applied for a loan of KES 10,000, which she plans to use to purchase more airtime credit cards. She hopes to plow back the anticipated profit into the business.

This is her first loan and her hopes and dreams are to continue with her business and to educate her kids.

loans.use: To buy Airtel, Safaricom and Yu airtime cards.

loans.name: Maria Yasmin

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Mujeres con Decisión, vive por el sector del Cebollar en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos dándole el nombre de Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, cuenta con una gran riqueza natural y cultural, su gente es amable, de un corazón cálido, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. María tiene 26 años, es casada y su esposo labora como empleado privado, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.
 
Ella es profesional en la belleza ya que ha estudiado y hace dos meses se encuentra ejerciendo su profesión.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para iniciarse en esta actividad. 

Su meta es tener un gabinete de belleza.
texts.en:
Señora María is a member of the communal bank Mujeres con Decisión.  She lives in the Cebollar sector in the city of Cuenca, a city that is bathed by 4 rivers, giving it the name Santa Ana de los 4 ríos [Santa Ana of the Four Rivers].  It has great natural and cultural wealth.  Its people are warm-hearted and friendly and they have maintained their culture and traditions.  

Señora María is 26 years old, married, and her husband works as a private employee.  They own their own home.  
 
She is a beauty professional as she has studied and has been working in her profession for two months.  
 
Her communal bank is in its second loan cycle and she is going to use her loan as start-up money to purchase chickens.  

He goal is to have her own beauty salon.

loans.use: purchase chickens.

loans.name: Damaris Del Socorro

texts.es: Damaris Del Socorro de 24 años, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, desde hace mas de 5 años que tiene este negocio, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes lugares, ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de mangos, bananos, naranjas, entre otros. Con las ganancias que obtenga realizara los ingresos necesarios para su familia, es una persona que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido sacar adelante a su familia a pesar de las dificultades de la vida.
texts.en: Damaris Del Socorro, 24, sells fruit and vegetables.  She’s had this business for over five years.  She has two minor children in her care.  To be able to sell them in different places, she’s asked for a loan to buy mangoes, plantains and oranges, among others.  With profits obtained she will earn income needed for her family.  She is a person who with much effort and dedication has moved her family forward despite life’s difficulties.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en:
Huyen is 37 years old. She is married and she has two children who are going to school. She wants them to have a better education and standard of living, so she has to work hard. 

Her main job is farming. She has had this job for many years. She has a monthly income of about 5,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). 

In 2009 she participated in SEDA to borrow money. This is her third loan. In this loan cycle she would like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to buy food for pigs.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Emma is 46 years old and has two children who are in school.

Emma has a shells craft business in the Philippines. Emma requested a 50,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy more shells for her shells craft business.

Emma has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Emma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more shells for her shells craft business.

loans.name: Las Cruces Group

texts.es:
Baudelia cuenta con 48 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene dos hijos los cuales está estudiando la mayor está estudiando su carrera de licenciada en matemáticas, el manor está estudiando la secundaria.

Ella se dedica al comercio cuenta con un pequeño negocio de abarrotes lo cual invertirá su préstamo en la compra de los productos que vende como son: aceite, leche, refrescos, jugos, huevos, etc. Baudelia le gustaría que su negocio creciera su negocio y para eso ella está trabajando en eso para sacar adelante su negocio y su familia.

Baudelia pertenece al grupo las cruces dicho está integrado por 10 personas hay un hombre y 9 mujeres las cuales a continuación serán presentadas: Juan, Juana, Honoria, Marisela, Luz María, Ma Guadalupe, Elba Neli, Alfreda, rubí, todos cuentan con una actividad comercial como son: venta de carne, productos de abarrotes, ollas de barro, papelería, venta de animales, comida, etc.
texts.en:
Baudelia is 48 years old and is a single mother with two children.  Her children are in school and the eldest is pursuing a degree in math while the youngest is studying in secondary school.  

She is dedicated to business and owns a small grocery store.  She will use her loan to purchase products that she sells: oil, milk, soft drinks, juices, eggs, etc.  Baudelia would like her business to grow and for that reason she is working so that she can help her business and her family move forward. 

Baudelia belongs to the group "Las cruces" or "The crosses" which is made up of 10 people.  There is one man and 9 women (including Baudelia) as follows: Juan, Juana, Honoria, Marisela, Luz María, Ma Guadalupe, Elba Neli, Alfreda, and Rubí.  They all have their own commercial activity such as the selling of meat, grocery products, clay pots, paper, animals, food, etc.

loans.use: To buy grocery products such as oil, milk, soft drinks, juices, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 40 years old.  She is married to Makio and they have three children. Elizabeth has been in the tailoring and clothes-selling business for the last six years, and she earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES from this. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and she is applying for her first loan of 30,000 KES. She plans to buy nets for selling and fabric for making clothes to sell.

She hopes to use the profits to buy more clothing materials for sale and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy nets and clothing materials for sale.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monicah is aged 44 and the mother of three school-aged children. She lives in Nkubu in Central Kenya. 

She has been involved in farming for 20 years. She sells her produce: maize, beans, cabbages and potatoes on the local market. In addition to farming, Monicah operates a retail shop. Her farm employs three farmhands. 

Monicah has made a third loan request of 60,000 KES with Juhudi Kilimo to enable her construct a zero grazing unit (an indoor facility for cattle) for her dairy cows. She duly paid her previous loans which were of 20,000 KES and 40,000 KES. She says the loan will help her add more dairy cows and improve their production and also to educate her children. Her focus is to own rental houses in the future.

She is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for the loan services but laments the high costs of farm inputs and the damage caused by pests.

loans.use: To construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Sophan

texts.en:
Sophan, age 25, is a garment worker. Her husband is a taxi driver who transports garment workers to work via a tricycle vehicle to the factory where they work. Since her husband's vehicle is broken down, Sophan is requesting a loan of USD 500 to pay for vehicle repairs. with the repairs completed, her husband's transportation service will run smoothly and attract more customers. 

In the future, she would like to purchase a truck, which would allow her husband more effectively to carry garment workers to the factory and to  generate more income for the family. In addition, she plans to make repairs to the family house and to support her children's education.

Sophan resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle repairs for her husband's tricycle transportation vehicle

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 21 years old and a single man; he lives in Bani Kenanah, Irbid, Jordan. 

Ahmad wants to take out a loan of 400 JOD so he can buy more mobile phone charge cards so his social and financal status will improve.

Ahmad is under 30 years old so his loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy rechargeable cards for mobile phones

loans.name: Saanih

texts.en:
Saanih is a young student who is 19 years old. She lives in Sukatani village of Bekasi city with her family. She is a student of Senior Vocational High School Dewantara Cikarang. She took technology information specialty department.

Her mother is client of Komida,  Saanih borrowed a loan for building fees, monthly fees, and for Saanih's exam graduation fee. Every day her family earns income from a small business in her house, She is very grateful for the loan because in this way she can continue to focus on her studies without concern over financial problems, and she hopes she can achieve her dream to become a computer teacher.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees, building fees, and monthly fees

loans.name: Maria Germania

texts.es:
Germania es una mujer de 46 años, es soltera no tiene hijos vive en casa arrendada en la ciudad de Antonio Ante desde hace años atrás, por el sector que ella vive hay fábricas de prensas de vestir que la mayoría de personas se dedican a esa actividad, hay turismo como la antigua fábrica de Imbabura y por los alrededores lugares que se pueden visitar, además platos tipos, gastronomía que ofrece la ciudad de Atuntaqui  que son las fritadas con tostado.
Germania viene dedicando todo su tiempo en ejercer la actividad de comercio de papas en el mercado de Atuntaqui, esta actividad lo viene realizando desde años atrás hasta la actualidad. En el local ofrece productos que son las papas por quintales a todo el público y así mismo quiere seguir incrementando más mercadería por esta temporada por eso con el crédito va invertir en la compra de más productos por quintales y así seguir incrementando más clientes, brindas una buena atención.
Agradece a KIVA por el apoyo que le brindan con el crédito para así seguir fortaleciendo el negocio que es el sustento de ella en su hogar, en el futuro quiere apoyar a gente que tal vez necesiten un empleo y brindarlo en su negocio y así poder brindar su experiencia para ejercer un negocio.

loans.use: Para la compra de más productos en quintales de esta forma incrementar la clientela y brindar una buena atención.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Mrs. Stella N., a 38 years old woman sells food items to people in her community in Nigeria. She is proud of her business and promises to effectively use the above amount to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for sale

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: Sek L. is 41 years old and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia with her husband and five children.  Her husband is a construction worker and typically earns $5.00 per day.  One of her children works at a garment factory and earns about $90 per month.  Another is a blacksmith in the village.  L. hopes to use this loan to expand her business, growing morning glory vegetables.  In the future, she would like to build a house to rent as another source of income.  She hopes that her business will generate enough money so that she can send her children to university.

loans.use: To buy equipment to grow morning glory vegetables and to a buy boat to harvest vegetables

loans.name: Aziz

texts.ru:
Aziz M. has been in business for 14 years. Started with selling mens shoes. From 2002 is a client of Microinvest. After 5 years of cooperation with Microinvest he had been able to expand his assortment and started selling womens shoes as well. Aziz is married, has 3 children. Requests $1,000 for further expansion of his assortment of shoes.

Translated from Rusiian by Alex Oganezov, Kiva volunteer

Махмудов Азиз занимается предпринимательской деятельностью 14 лет. Начал свой бизнес с продажи мужской обуви. В 2002г. стал клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест». За 5 лет работы в Микроинвест, он увеличил вдвое свой ассортимент, т.е. начал продавать и женскую обувь. Махмудов Азиз женат, имеет 3 детей. Азиз запрашивает 1000$ для увеличения ассортимента товара.

loans.use:
Increase variety of goods

увеличения ассортимента товара

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en: When Elnur received his first loan from Normicro he operated a fruit and vegetable stand at the local bazaar in the town of Khachmaz. He has since moved up the supply chain to become a supplier of fruits and vegetables to the Bazaars in the northeastern region. Elnur is now looking for funding so that the can increase the amount of produce he purchases from the local farmers to distribute to the bazaars.

loans.use: To increase produce purchased for distribution.

loans.name: Vaoesea

texts.en: Vaoesea, from the village of Saanapu, never has a moment to spare. The 36 year old mother of four children runs a small business to support her family.  Her grocery shop helps to support her husband’s taro plantation so they’re able to put their children through school and improve their living standards.  Her weekly earnings, after all expenses, is $120, and the three sacks of taro her husband sells at Fugalei market every weekend provides the family with extra profits of $120.

loans.use: Home improvement and the expansion of her shop

loans.name: Basilia Guerrero

texts.en:
Basilia is 57 years old, married, with two daughters and one son. The elder daughter has married and lives with her own family. The other daughter and the son are respectively 15 and years old. Basilia dedicates herself to the sales of silver-plated jewels. Her husband works in a construction company. She sells her goods from home and sometimes by visiting women in the community door-to-door. Basilia hopes in the future she’ll be able to open her own jewelery shop so as to allow customers to make the purchase handily.

With her loan, she will buy a large amount of jewels to sell at low prices during the Christmas period. That way, the entrepreneur will increase her income and attract new clients.

loans.use: Purchase of silver-plated jewels to supply her business

loans.name: Noriko

texts.en: Noriko is a 32-year-old mother of six. Her business is running a flea market stall of handicrafts at the Savalalo market. She also sells in front of her house. She makes $100.00-150.00 WST ($40-60 USD) a day from selling handicrafts and she uses her earnings to help support her family.

loans.use: To restock her flea market stall

loans.name: Jamil Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ms. R. is a single mother who is experiencing a difficult situation because she has 5 young children under her care. For this reason, she works diligently selling apparel in the “la Estación” market in León.

Before starting this business, she used to work as a seamstress, but her low wages were insufficient to cover her household expenses. In light of this problem, she firmly decided to sell clothing. She carries out price comparisons in order to choose the best supplier that will offer her the lowest price.

To date, she has requested 11 loans from CEPRODEL, loans which have been of great benefit to her because they have allowed her to not only purchase clothing from her suppliers, but also to partly improve her town's condition.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora R. es una madre soltera que atraviesa una difícil situación por el hecho de que posee 5 pequeños hijos a los que debe mantener y para ello muy esforzadamente se dedica a la venta de ropa en lo interno del mercado la Estación en el Departamento de León.

Antes de iniciar este negocio la señora R. se dedicaba a realizar trabajos de costurera pero sus bajos ingresos eran insuficientes para cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Partiendo de este problema, decide muy firmemente comenzar a adquirir ropa para comercializarla por lo que realiza cotizaciones en varios lugares para seleccionar al proveedor que mas barato le venda la ropa.

Hoy en dia ha realizado un total de 11 créditos en CEPRODEL que le han sido de sumo apoyo ya que ha adquirido la ropa de sus proveedores y además ha mejorado en parte las condiciones de su localidad.

loans.use: Purchase of apparel

loans.name: Jalal

texts.en: Jalal S. is a 50-year-old farmer who breeds cattle in a small village in the Saatli region. He has seven years of experience in this field. He runs this business because meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan. Generally Jalal purchases baby calves, raises them and then sells them to the local bazaar traders. Jalal has applied for a loan of $1200 to purchase four calves at an estimated cost of $300 each.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.en:
Flor De Maria F. T. has a general store in a rural suburb of Pucallpa, Ucayali. From the store she built onto her house, she sells fruit, vegetables, candies, sodas, oil, sugar, eggs, and much more. Flor has a good location in a safe neighborhood with little competition.

Flor is 49 years old with 6 children and is happily married. Flor manages her shop and takes care of her family while her husband has a business raising chickens. She is happy to have an income and help provide for her family. Because of the business, she has a better relationship with her neighbors, is better known in the community, and is more independent.

A member of the community bank Las Lumbreras, Flor is requesting a loan of s/1200 (US$ 450) to repay over 6 months. She would like to use the loan to restock her shop and buy cloth to start a business making clothes, bed covers, and pillow covers. She is an excellent seamstress.

loans.use: To restock a general store and start a sewing business

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Hidaya is 32 years old and is a married woman with 4 children, ages 8 to 15 years old. She and her husband also take care of 1 other person, age 55 years old. Hidaya is a clothes seller, and she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 8 am to 4.30 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma has sold beer and soft drinks for 9 years. She supplies them to neighbors for parties and birthdays. Norma doesn't stop working at a set time and her beer is available for sale 24 hours a day. Her husband encouraged her to set up the business and she has no regrets. She remembers that her first order was for 40 cases of beer. That still motivates her. Now, she gets her supplies from a distributor who leaves the drinks at her house. In the future, Norma might want to set up a business selling gas cylinders because she's realized that there's no similar business in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Norma desde hace 9 años vende cerveza y gaseosas. Ella abastece de estas bebidas a sus vecinos cuando hay fiestas y cumpleaños. Norma no repara en la hora, la venta de cerveza está disponible las 24 horas del día. Fue su esposo quien le motivó a montar este negocio y no se arrepiente. Norma recuerda que la primera vez vendió 40 cajas de cerveza. Eso la motivó aún más. Ahora, una distribuidora la abastece y le deja en su casa las bebidas. Norma quisiera para el futuro poner un negocio de balones de gas, ya que se ha dado cuenta que este rubro de venta no existe por su zona.

loans.use: Buy beer for resale.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario S. is a woman who stands out for being an excellent cook who sells prepared meals in the Central market in the city of Chinandega.

She has worked for 30 years in the business of making and selling various types of meals and this has been her only income in order to feed her family. She is seeking a loan from Ceprodel in order to purchase raw materials to make these meals and thereby continue maintaining her humble home.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosario S. es una dama que se ha destacado por ser una excelente cocinera ya que vende alimentos preparados por ella misma en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Es una dama que desde hace 30 largos años se ha dedicado al negocio de la elaboración de distintos tipos de platillos siendo este su único ingreso con el cual alimenta a su familia. La razón por la cual solicita el crédito en Ceprodel es para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos y así continuar con el mantenimiento de su humilde hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to make meals

loans.name: Sean

texts.en:
Mr. Sean S., 38, and his wife, Mrs. Sophal Chi, 29, who live in a small village off of National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, married in 1999 and have four children: one son and three daughters. Two of them are in local school.

Mr. Sean has been growing vegetables (see photo) for twenty years. His wife has been selling vegetables for seventeen years. She buys them from Ta Khmao market and some from her own farm and carries them on her motorcycle for re-sale in Phnom Penh.

Mr. Sean is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a new motorcycle to replace their old one and to expand his wife's business.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike and expand their business selling vegetables

loans.name: Nessy

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Nessy N. is thirty-two years old. She is married with a two-year-old child. She also takes care of two other dependents who live with her because they attend school in the area. Earlier this year, Nessy opened a small shop from which she sells African traditional cloth. Local Tanzanian women purchase cloth from Nessy’s shop and use it to make vitenge, the traditional dress worn by Tanzanian women. Nessy runs the store with one employee and earns about 100 USD in profit each month. Nessy is requesting a loan of 275 USD in order to purchase additional stock of African traditional cloth in bulk. Nessy expects to earn about 200 USD from increased sales after getting this loan. In the future she hopes to increase the quantity and range of the business.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; because of this, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan, a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of traditional African cloth in bulk.

loans.name: Zuhuru

texts.en:
Zuhuru M., age 45, is married with 4 children. She has run a stationery shop since 2002, which is open daily from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about $217.

Zuhuru has taken 1 loan before from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the loan to start a second business of selling handbags, sandals, and suits door to door. She paid the loan back successfully and is earning around $174 to $260 a month from this business. With the loan she hopes to receive now, she plans to expand her stationery business.

loans.use: To expand her stationery supply

loans.name: Khin

texts.en:
Khin S., 21, is a professional who decorates handicrafts while living at home in the Phnom Penh. Since 2003, she has been using beads and other materials to make flowers on women's clothes to earn a living and typically makes US$5 each day. Decorated dresses are a kind of Khmer traditional dress and people wear them during the Water Festival, P'chum Ben or Khmer New Year. It takes around 7–10 days to complete each dress and its price is expensive. Most of the people prefer handmade than machine made. She said she learned how to decorate from her mother and she started doing this business because she was not married yet.

Khin's husband is a pig breeder making around US$6 each day. The high prices of rice, fertilizers, meat and feed for animals had made his family work very hard to support the family. He said the purchase price of rice dust, soybean and other stuff for pigs are double what he used to pay, so when he sells the pigs it is not balanced with the cost of raising them. This couple hopes the government will soon take action on inflation. Khin S. would like to take out a loan of US$1200 to expand the livestock and grow rice. She believes the investment would bring her more profit.

loans.use: Khin and her husband would like to expand their livestock and grow rice.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị L. năm nay 33 tuổi,. Gia đình chị hiện có 3 con trong đó 2 con đang tuổi đến trường. Năm 2002 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương để vay vốn đầu tư thêm vào cửa hàng kinh doanh xe máy của gia đình. Đến nay qua hơn 5 năm sử dụng vốn hiệu quả kinh tế gia đìnhchị đã có sự phát triển rõ rệt. Hiện tại cả hai vợ chồng chị đều kinh daonh buôn bán xe máy và đây cũng là công việc đem lại thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị. Với mức thu nhập 3.500.000đ chị L. tin tưởng rằng công việc kinh doanh xe máy sẽ giúp kinh tế gia đình chị ngày càng phát triển hơn.
Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm phụ tùng thay thế khi khách hàng có nhu cầu
texts.en:
Mrs L. is 33 years old. She has 3 children, 2 of them are still in school. In 2002 she joined TYM fund to get capital to invest in a motorcycle shop that her family owns. After 5 years with TYM it is apparent that her family finance has improved a lot. Today she and her husband both work in the shop selling/trading motorcycle. This is the main revenue for her family, about 3.500.000 VND a month. Mrs L. is confident that her business will continue to grow. This time she is requesting a loan of 20.000.000 VND to buy spare parts to better serve her customers.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy spare parts

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Since 2006, Comfort M. has sold dried fish in Abakrampa near Abura. Comfort received a primary education. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a trader.
