Comfort is responsible for assisting her husband in meeting the family's financial needs. Her loan will be used to buy more dried fish for sale. She hopes to reinvest her new profits into the business to improve her capital base.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish for sale.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y refrescos y es la única que genera ingresos en su familia ya que es viuda y tiene tres hijos.
Vive en la zona de obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz en casa propia.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de mercadería ( abarrotes, refrescos, dulces, y galletas)
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Julia sells groceries and sodas. She alone generates income for her family as she is a widow with three children. She lives in her own house in the zone of production of the town of La Paz.

The loan will be spent on buying merchandise (groceries, sodas, candy and cookies). This is the second time she requests a loan from Impro, and she is qualified as a number 1 client, meaning she repays punctually her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for a grocery store.

loans.name: Nut

texts.en:
Nut V., 46, is pictured here with her husband. The couple lives in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. Mrs. Nut V. grows rice, earning a profit of less than one dollar each day. Her husband owns a big grinding machine that he uses to serve the local farmers, earning US$2.30 per day. The couple has four children: three are students and one is married and no longer lives at home.

Mrs. Nut V. would like to use this loan to purchase a motorbike and a trailer for her husband so he can transport goods to earn additional income.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Sangin

texts.ru: Назаров Сангин житель Вахдата. Возраст 51 год, женат и имеет четверых детей. Образование среднее. Уже 10 лет занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Имеет свой магазин  ,где торгует продуктами питания ,поставляемыми из города Душанбе. Сангин имеет много клиентов , так как его товар имеет большой спрос и кроме этого у него доступные цены и свежие продукты. В данный момент он решил открыть отдел одежды и парфюмерии , поэтому обратился к нам за кредитом.Это поможет ему привлечь новых клиентов и увеличить доходы своего бизнеса. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sangin N. lives in Vahdat. He is 51 years old, married and has four children. He has a secondary education. He has been in the business of selling food products for 10 years and owns a store. The products are delivered from Dushanbe. Sangin has many clients because his products are fresh and in high demand, and his prices are affordable. Currently, he decided to open a clothing and perfume department and needs a loan for this purpose. The expansion would help Sangin to attract new clients and increase his business profit. He will be able to repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase assortment

loans.name: Timoteo Antonio

texts.es: El señor Timoteo Antonio C. Álvarez tiene 55 años de edad, su estado civil es casado. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general como: pantalones, camisas, shorts entre otras cosas. Hace mas de 18 años que se dedica a este negocio esta actividad la realiza todos los días de la semana y el control de los pagos de sus clientes es mediante el método de tarjetas ya que es aquí en donde apunta los abonos hechos por sus clientes, los ingresos que el obtiene son de su negocio y algunas veces los ingresos de su esposa que labora en la elaboración de tortillas. Los propósitos de Don Timoteo son de conseguir un lugar estable ya que actualmente tiene que recorrer las calles en busca de clientes. El financiamiento es solicitado para capital de trabajo ya que con esto podrá comprar mercadería como es ropa, perfumes y ropa interior. Sus sueños son de proporcionarle a su esposa un buen establecimiento para la venta de sus toritillas. La cantidad solicitada es de C$ 9.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Mr. Timoteo Antonio C. Álvarez is 55 years old and married. He sells pants, shirts, and shorts, amongst other things. He has been doing this for 18 years, every day of the week. Control of payments is done by card, this way he keeps track of the payments made by customers. The loans that he receives are for his business, and, sometimes, for the business of his wife, a tortilla-maker. He wants to get a stable, permanent place-- now he walks around the streets looking for customers. This financing is for buying clothes, perfume and underwear. His dream is to provide his wife with a good establishement for selling tortillas. He is asking for C$9,000 cordobas.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for his business

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin I. is currently in the business of selling cakes and is requesting a loan to open up a bakery. Benjamin is 32 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a bakery.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria B., 44, is married with three children and lives at Purok 9, Kiwalan Iligan City, Southern Philippines. She balances her time efficiently for both family and business. She strives to perform her daily chores to the best of her ability. She manages a variety store that sells basic household products. She also has firewood available for sale at her store. Her customers include her neighbors and people from nearby villages. She requests a loan of PHP 7,000 from HSPFI, a KIVA partner, to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: to purchase firewood for sale and items for her variety store

location.town: Purok 9, Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Ziyadkhan

texts.en: Ziyadkhan was born in 1953. Seven years ago this man started taxi business. With this business, he supports his family. He is married and has 5 children. He lives in Khachmaz town. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN ($2500 US) to buy the spare parts to improve his taxi business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to improve taxi business.

loans.name: Vinancia

texts.en:
Vinancia P. and her husband's primary source of income is fishing. Their fish is sold at a public market and neighboring village.

It’s a daily challenge for her to pay her loan on time but this is now become a habit for Vinancia, 60, who is married with three children.

She is able to nurture her children well. Vinancia’s happy that she is able to send her children to school. She applied for a loan of Php5,000. This loan will be use to purchase fishing nets to catch more fish. She also hopes to have their own stall in the public market, to increase customers.

loans.use: Buy fishing net.

loans.name: Melynda

texts.en:
Mylenda S. is popularly known by her nickname, which is “Indang”. She is married to Edward S. and they live in the rural community of Barangay San Leonardo of Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. They were blessed with three children: Princess Jane, Justine Prince and Jasmine May. Two of them are now attending elementary school. She wants all her children become successful someday, so she works hard to prepare for the future.

Her husband Edward drives a tricycle transport to earn an income, while Melynda manages a general store in their village. She has to wake up very early in the morning and closes at 8:00 in the evening. She wants her business to grow so she is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 Philippine Pesos to use as additional working capital. She strongly believes that expanding her store will secure the future of her children especially in providing for their need to acquire an education.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Abiodun

texts.en: Abiodun is 29 years old and is married with a child. She sells drinks and sachet (plastic-bagged) water. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more drinks and sachet water to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and sachet water to sell

loans.name: Bisi

texts.en: Bisi is 44 years old and married with four children. She sells provisions such as milk, detergent, toothpaste, etc. Bisi is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more provisions to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
Ernesto M. S. se dedica desde hace varios años a su trabajo de vigilancia llevada a cabo por las noches en una empresa en el municipio de Somotillo en el departamento de Chinandega. El señor Ernesto ha atravesado la necesidad de reconstruir su casa de habitación por lo que decidió brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a sus pequeños hijos iniciando la mejora a su vivienda.

Ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción para dar lugar al mejoramiento de su hogar y de esta forma contribuir al bienestar habitacional de su familia y en especial de sus pequeños hijos a los que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Ernesto M. S. has been dedicated for several years to his security work, carried out at night in a business in the municipality of Somotillo in the region of Chinandega. Señor Ernesto needs to reconstruct his house in order to offer better living conditions to his small children. He is beginning the improvements to his dwelling. He has approached Ceprodel to request a credit for the purchase of the building materials in order to begin the improvement of his home and in this way to contribute to the housing welfare of his family and especially of his small children that he loves so much.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials for his house.

loans.name: Koeun

texts.en: Mrs. Koeun V. lives in Thorm Nei village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Phan Phorn, is a fisherman. Although they try to work hard to earn money, they still do not have a better house for their family living. Thus, Mrs. Koeun V. decided to ask for a loan to add her saving to buy some timbers and the others equipments to build the house. She is a 27-year-old mother of four children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is presented on the left of photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to add her saving to buy some timbers and the others equipments to build the house.

loans.name: John

texts.en: L. John is thirty years old, married with only two children. He stays in Bukulula Kasasa west that is Masaka district and running his business of brick lying from Mukoko village Along Lukaya to Masaka road four kilo meter. He started this business in the year 2000 that is nine (9 years). He is using the loan purposely to boost his business that is adding capital to purchase firewood since it is the major factor for the business to proper and paying labor wage to those who help him out. His future hopes are prospering and be a successful man in future.

loans.use: Purposely to boost his business that is adding capital to purchase firewood since it is the major factor for the business to proper and paying labor wage to those who help him out.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph M. is a 33-year-old married businessman. He supplies different commodities, such as milk, bread and cakes, to his customers using his bicycle. He has been running this business for about six years now with a monthly profit of Ksh 20,000. 

Joseph has not previously borrowed from any another MFI. He was introduced to KADET by a friend. He has applied for a loan which he plans to use to buy three more bicycles and also employ some staff who will help in supplying goods to other markets. Joseph hopes to own a bakery by acquiring more loans from KADET.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke/.

loans.use: To buy three more bicycles

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice I. is married and is the mother of two children who are still school-going.

Alice started her farming business in 2007. This was after she realized, as she says it, life was not just about being a housewife. She then ventured into a farm produce business which she says is a good income-generating activity.

Alice needs a loan of Kshs 10,000 which she says will be used to buy more seeds besides preparing a larger farm than she used the previous season. She says this will enable her to produce a larger harvest which will mean good business. Her future plan is to open a farm produce store in the future.

loans.use: To buy more seeds and to prepare a larger farmland

loans.name: Floridah Museo

texts.en:
Floridah is married to Harrison and they have two children, Pauline and Idaya, ages 16 and 10 years old respectively.

Floridah was introduced to KADET through existing clients and she is servicing her second loan in KADET. Her credit history is perfect. Floridah has been in the clinic business for eight years.She will use this loan to purchase additional stock of drugs to supply her customers. 

Floridah's area of business is in a slum in the industrial area. With the extra profits she hopes to earn, she plans to build rental houses and diversify her income. In the future, Floridah aspires to own a hospital as she believes she is hardworking.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy additional supplies of drugs for the clinic

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en: Elvie N. is from the village of Colupan Settlement, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Elvie owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over eleven years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month. In 2009, Elvie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Elvie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a hardworking man. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. He is a happy man.

He sells firewood at retail prices to his customers. He has been in this business for a long time. He works for long hours to ensure that there is food on their table to feed his family. He is married with four children and he is 48 years old. His eldest child is 23 years old.

He is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more firewood to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: God Is Sufficient Group

texts.en:
Mary C. is a leader of a group of 5 borrowers called God is sufficient. She is 33 years old, single with 4 children aged 1-12 years old, who are in 1st-4th grade. Mary is a 4th grade drop-out due to the lack of financial support. She lives and works in the Gbartala community, about 20 kilometers  from, Gbarnga city, the capital of Bong county, Liberia.

Her business is the sales of general goods. She buys general goods wholesale and sells retail to residents of her community near Gbarnga. Mary has been running this business for 3 years, and hopes to improve the business to be a store. Mary faces high transportation costs, and getting the goods from wholesalers to her business site is a problem, because the more expense she has, the less her profit becomes. She always sells new designs of goods in order to encourage customers to continue buying from her. Mary needs this loan to purchase more new goods to improve her business. She dreams of giving her children the best education.

loans.use: To purchase more new goods to improve business.

loans.name: Julia Mercedes

texts.es:
Muy alegremente, en el departamento de León, la señora Julia F. se dedica a trabajar en la venta de ropa y chinelas en su propio establecimiento donde a diario ofrece sus productos y debido a las ventas bajas, su cónyuge  le ayuda a vender los productos saliendo él ambulantemente por los diferentes lugares del departamento de León. Anteriormente ella se dedicaba a lavar y planchar ropa pero al ver la necesidad de mejorar su situación económica decidió iniciar estas ventas.

Ella no tiene hijos pero tiene a su cargo una nieta a la que le brinda todas las condiciones necesarias para vivir y desarrollarse. Muy inteligentemente ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de la mercadería como lo es la ropa y las chinelas para continuar ofertándolas y así generar ingresos para su humilde hogar.
texts.en:
Very happily, in the department of León, Señora Julia F. works in the sale of clothing and slippers in her own business, offering her products daily. Because of low sales, her husband assists her as a traveling salesperson, selling her products in different places in the department of León. Previously, she worked in washing and ironing clothing but because she needed to improve her economic situation she decided to start in sales. She does not have children but she takes care of a grandchild for whom she provides all that she needs to live and develop. Very intelligently, she has gone to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy merchandise like clothing and slippers to continue selling them and, in this way, make more income for her humble home.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Clothing

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en: Vanessa J.'s main source of income comes from buying and selling accessories, like watches and bracelets, and cosmetics in her community. She is 29 years old, single and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin. Vanessa is just starting this business. In 2009, Vanessa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Vanessa is requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann M. was born in 1972. She is a single mother to Alice Karim (17 years old,  just finished high school), Judy Jepchumba (15 years old, in Form Three in high school) and Edwin Kipyegomen (20 years old, finished high school awhile back). Ann lives in Kaptimbor village.

Ann is a second hand clothes trader and has been in this business for six years. The business gives her a monthly profit of about 50,000 KES but she also gets an additional 16,000 KES from other sources, including farming. Her business is situated within town.

Ann was introduced to KADET Limited by company staff and she had no previous credit history. She has borrowed a loan of 60,000 KES, of which she plans to use 20,000 KES to purchase mitumba (second hand clothes) for resale, 20,000 KES to purchase a piece of land and 20,000 KES to open a retail shop. With the extra profit she earns, she plans to get into the matatu (van transport services) business.

Ann has a great dream of opening a wholesale mitumba business. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing stock for her business

loans.name: Nicolas Migdonio

texts.es: Don Nicolas de 44  años de edad, vive en union libre con la Sra. Maribel Lumbi, habitan junto a sus padres y hermanos en la Comarca Boca Azul del municipio de Muelle de los Bueyes, quienes le ayudan con el cuido de la finca y el ganado. Don Nicolas esta solicitando su 6to credito a AFODENIC con el objetivo de comprar terneros para engordarlos y desarrollarlos y posteriormente comerciarlizarlos a un mejor precio que le permita obtener mejores ganancias que le permita el sustento familiar. Cuenta con la experiencia necesaria para esta actividad, pues tiene mas de 31 años de trabajar con ganado.  Espera contar con el apoyo de kiva para lograr establecer esta compra.  Su mayor sueño es lograr incrementar su hato ganadero para obtener mejores ganancias, pues es el patrimonio de su familia.
texts.en:
Don Nicolas is 44 years old and in a common law marriage with Sra. Maribel Lumbi. They live with his parents and siblings in the area called Boca Azul in the town of Muelle de los Bueyes. Nicolas and his family help each other with looking after the farm and raising cattle.

He is requesting his sixth loan from AFODENIC in order to buy calves to fatten and raise so that he can sell them later at a higher price. This helps him to improve his income for supporting his family. Nicolas has the necessary experience because he has been working with cattle for more than 31 years. He hopes to have the support of Kiva in successfully completing this acquisition. His greatest wish is to increase his cattle herd so that he can improve his earnings and provide an inheritance for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional goods

loans.name: Challote

texts.en:
Challote E. is a single parent and has two children. She has received senior high education.

Challote sells Fante kenkey with fried fish at Elmina. Fante kenkey is normally eaten by the Fante’s in the central and western regions of the country and is served with hot pepper sauce and fried fish.

Challote’s main responsibility is to pay her children’s school fees and maintain the home. Her loan, which will serve as an increased capital, will be used to buy bags of maize for the making of the kenkey and cartons of fish to fry and sell alongside the Fante kenkey.

Challote aims to use the new profits that are likely to come, to save to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize for the making of kenkey and cartons of fish to fry and sell alongside it

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva S. is currently in the business of selling maize and millet at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock rice and pulses (groundnuts, peas or cowpeas) to sell.  Eva is 30 years old and married to a peasant. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock rice and pulses (groundnuts, peas, cowpeas) to sell

loans.name: Mingué

texts.fr: Mingué S. est une femme de 68 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 7 ans et demi et a eu 15 bonnes expériences avec le crédit. Elle pratique deux activités; la vente de beignets en faisant du porte à porte et l'embouche ovine avec les petits ruminants. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Mingué S. is a 68 year-old woman, she is married and the mother of six children. She has been a member of the “Banc Villageois” for seven and half years. She has had 15 good borrowing experiences. She has two activities: the door-to-door sales of doughnuts and the fattening of small ruminating animals [sheep, goats]. Her goal is to help her husband in covering the family’s expenses.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her ability to autofinance.

loans.name: C2718 Dutsindubukene Group

texts.en:
Jean Damscene is 32 years old and is married with three children who are 2, 3 and 6 years old. He is the president of a group called “Dutsindubukene” and this group is commonly known in the business of selling bananas. This is their third successful year in this business, which they operate from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Jean Damscene and his team are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for a purpose of increasing the quantity of bananas they sell to the market. With this expansion, this group really hopes that the earned profits will increase, as they will be able to satisfy the demand of their customers. In addition, each member of the group will start saving and be able to satisfy the basic needs of his/her family.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of bananas

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de  40 años, vive  con su esposo  y sus 3 hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 10 años trabaja en la atención de su tienda de comestibles  ubicada en su casa. Cada día empieza a trabajar desde muy temprano,  con la ayuda de sus hijos. Siempre esta pendiente de la cantidad de mercadería que tiene, para que su tienda este siempre surtida de los mas variados comestibles, y de esta manera ofrecer a su clientela lo mejor en comestibles. Sus ventas son mayores  por las mañanas, es por eso que para Elizabeth  es vital tener la mercadería en el momento oportuno. Las ganancias  que recibe le permiten seguir adelante por lo que ha decidido ampliar su tienda con mayor cantidad de mercadería en frutas y útiles de escritorio.Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y  fue invitada a formar parte de este banco comunal porque  los integrantes la conocen cono una persona responsable en sus  pagos. Además esta agradecida  con todas las personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de más mercadería como arroz, azúcar, menestras y productos envasados para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 40, lives with her husband and three children in her own house. She has had a grocery store in her house for the last 10 years. Her work day starts very early with help from her children. She is always conscious of her stock supplies so that the store is always well stocked with a good assortment of foodstuffs in order to offer her customers the best in food items. Her best sales happen in the morning which is why it’s important for Elizabeth to have her stock available at the opportune moment. The profits she earns make it possible for her to continue forward so she has decided to expand her inventory by including fruits and office supplies. This is her first loan with MFP; she was invited to join this communal bank because the members know her as being a responsible person with respect to repayments. She is grateful to all the people who made the loan possible because it will be very useful for her store’s progress. She will use the requested funds to buy more stock items like: rice, sugar, vegetables and canned goods.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona S. is a 33-year old married woman who lives in Bagumbayan, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by engaging in a buy and sell, ready to wear business.

Rona’s husband, Cydric, is a sugarcane labourer. They have 2 children who are between 5 and 12 years of age. Their eldest is currently going to school and also helps in the business as part of the daily chores.

Rona joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in the buy and sell ready to wear clothes business. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP4,000 from her business activities.

Rona is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of PHP16,000 was used to fund the operations of her buy and sell ready to wear clothes business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 10th cycle loan, the amount of PHP17,500, which she intends to use on her buy and sell ready to wear clothes. Rona is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros L. is from the village of Benhaan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 59 years old. Milagros is married. To make a living, Milagros owns & operates a business providing video karaoke services or sing-along business to local community members. She caters to singing for a fee of 5 pesos per song. Milagros has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Milagros joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Milagros is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional tables and chairs for her sing-along business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Milagros from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tables and chairs for her karaoke business

loans.name: Pasos Firme Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of her group Pasos Firme 1, 2 & 3 (Firm steps). She makes her home here in a simple structure with a child. She says that her most difficult challenge has been the difficulties of living in poverty and in the past, she didn't have hope. Now all those things are changing.
 
Ana is excited to be taking her ninth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business to buy rice, flour and other foods. Her business is a Colmado, a place where you can find all the ingredients to make your daily food. Normally those colmados are in the same neighborhood, a short walking distance from any home. She will use the profits to buy school supplies. In the future, she needs to buy a stove and building site. Her dream is that the Lord gives her strength to work and help her family. 

This Esperanza associate’s story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in located in the rural area surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, coffee, eggs, sugar, vegetables, etc

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en:
Employing one farm hand, Priscah has been operating her dairy farm in Kitale, Western Kenya for over 10 years. She sells her milk to the local market. Rampant bovine diseases, which are costly to treat, have been the biggest challenge in this business.

Priscah is requesting this loan of 30,000KES from Juhudi Kilimo to start a poultry project. She says that the proceeds from this loan will help her educate her children to university level. In five years' time, Priscah expects to purchase a piece of land to expand her farming activities. She appreciates the fact that Juhudi has helped finance her to expand her farming activities.

Priscah is 45 years old, married and blessed with four children between 6 and 18 years of age, all attending school.

loans.use: To start a poultry project.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz M. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. Luz is 30 years old and married with an eight-year-old child. To make a living Luz plants and harvests rice for sale. She also grows hogs for fattening and sells them in her community. She hopes for her hog-raising business to grow, too.

Luz joined CEVI to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Luz is requesting her second loan, for 6000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs. She also plans to buy feed for the pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About CEVI

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, pig feed and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan P. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 43 years old. Allan is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Allan owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Allan has been engaged in his business for over 6 years.

Allan joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Allan has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Allan is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support his family and save as a reserve for emergencies. He wishes CEVI will be able to expand and help more farmers like him.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel R. is from the village of Poblacion III. She is 23 years old and is married with one school-aged child. Maricel owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling mobile phone electronic loads in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Maricel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: kossi est une jeune homme marié qui est très dynamique, l'activité qu'il exerce pour subvenir aux charges de sa famille est le commerce de détail de CD audios. il  a commencé ce commerce depuis 2008 et s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. actuellement son stock de marchandises est en baisse, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour se réapprovisionner avec plus de 500 CD audios. ainsi il se prépare à servir ses clients pour la période des fêtes de fin d'année qui approche.
texts.en:
Kossi is a young married man who is very dynamic and sells audio CDs in order to meet his family's needs. He began in this line of work in 2008 and sources his goods from the large market in Lomé. His customer base is wide and varied. His stock of goods is depleting and so he is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to purchase 500 CDs; in this way he will be able to serve his customers' needs for the end-of-year festivities.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: achat de CD audios

loans.name: Solat

texts.en:
Mrs. Solat S. and her husband, Mr. Sam-At Kong, are farmers. They have been married since 1979 and have three sons and three daughters. They live about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

The couple grows bananas and flowers on their farmland in the village. Besides farming, Solat also sells Chinese noodles and coffee in front of her house. She has obtained a Kiva loan through MAXIMA several times already. She now is requesting another loan of 1,000 USD not only to expand her business selling Chinese noodles and coffee but to continue her farming business as well.

loans.use: To expand her business selling Chinese noodles and coffee as well as for her farm

loans.name: Adzovi

texts.fr: adzovi est une femme  célibataire avec une personne à charge. l'activité qu'elle exerce pour subvenir tous ses besoins est le commerce de détail de cartes de recharges,biscuits et de produits génériques. elle a une expérience de 4 ans dans son commerce et elle s'approvisionne au marché local d'akodessewa. actuellement elle a remarqué que la demande de ses clients augmentent de plus en plus parce que la fin d'année approchent. Pour remédier à cela elle sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour acheter 2 cartons de cartes de recharges, 5 cartons de biscuits et divers produits génériques. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes.
texts.en: Adzove is a single woman with no children. The activity she carries out to support herself is the retail sale of recharge cards, biscuits and generic products. She has 4 years experience in this field and she gets her supplies from the local market of Akodessewa. Recently she has noticed that the client demand is increasing as the end of the year approaches. To meet this demand, she requested her first loan from WAGES to buy 2 boxes of recharge cards, 5 boxes of biscuits and various generic products. She has a broad clientele.

loans.use: achat de cartes de recharges, biscuits et produits génériques

loans.name: Ginna Zunilda

texts.es: Ginna B.  es una mujer de 49 años  que tiene tres hijos en las edades de 23 a 29,  a los que sueña ver prosperos y exitosos; es precisamente por eso  que diariamente se esfuerza en su proposito de apoyarlos en todos los aspectos. Ella es propietaria de un negocio donde vende calzado y ropa que distribuye entre sus clientes , de acuerdo con el pedido que estos han realizado previamente; sus ventas las realiza a crèdito y sus compras  al pormayor y una parte acredito y otra parte de contado;  como  gran parte de su capital de trabajo està representado en las cuentas por cobra, esta buscando financiamiento para lograr responderle a cada nuevo cliente que le refieren sus mas rentables compradores , y tambien para ganarse un descuento en las promociones   por compras de contado y mayor volumen, porque asì aumentarà sus utilidades, teniendo en cuenta que en la actualidad  su rentabilidad es del 15,5 % y comprando de contado se ahorrarà dinero para lograr oportunidades representadas en mejores ofertas, mas clientes y mayor utilidad. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo y con  este su credikiva,  comprarà  calzado para responder a la temporada de fin de año, que sabe muy bien el gran movimiento comercial de este producto,  por lo que sus ventas repuntan.  Ella en esta època obtiene mas clientes referidos,  que se quedan sin efectivo para comprar de contado, por ocasiòn de los gastos familiares de fin de año y con ello empieza a desarrollar su sueño de tener un gran almacen, aprovechando la ubicaciòn de su vivienda en el barrio Ciudadela 20 de Julio, que conjuga los escenarios comerciales mas importantes de la zona sur, los epicentros recreativos como el estadio Metropolitano de Barranquilla, cuna del futbol colombiano y el importante numero de viviendas  y conjuntos residenciales y casas multifamiliares, lo cual indica una abundante  y permanete clientela potencial para el negocio de Ginna.
texts.en: Ginna B. is a 49 year old woman that has three children between 23 and 29 years old. She hopes to see them be prosperous and successful. That is precisely why she makes an effort every day to support them in every way. She is the owner of a business that sells footwear and clothing that she distributes to her customers in accordance with the order that they previously made. Her sales are made on credit and her purchases are made partially on credit and partially in cash. Since a big part of her working capital is represented in the cover charges, she is looking for financing so that she can respond to each new customer that her most profitable customers refer to her. And also to earn a discount on promotions for large volume and cash purchases. In this way, she will improve her usefulness, keeping in mind that currently her profitability is 15.5%, and buying with cash will save her money to attain opportunities on better offers, more customers, and better usefulness. This is her first loan with "la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo", and with this Kiva loan she will buy seasonal footwear for the end of the year. She knows the great commercial movement of this product very well, which will increase her sales. These days, she gets more referred customers that don't have cash to make a purchase, because of the family costs of the end of the year. With the loan, she is beginning to develop her dream of having a big department store, making the most of the location of her home in the neighborhood Ciudadela 20 de Julio. It combines the most important commercial scenes of the southern zone, the recreational epicenters like the stadium "Metropolitano de Barranquilla", the birthplace of Columbian soccer, and the important number of residential homes and multifamily houses, which indicates a potential abundance of permanent clientele for Ginna's business.

loans.use: To buy seasonal footwear for the end of the year.

loans.name: Fredrick Moses Simpiri

texts.en:
Fredrick Moses Simpiri M. is 23 years old. He is married to Leitato Sopia and he is a father of two school-going children. Fredrick is a businessman involved in the selling of livestock.

He learned about KADET from other members in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his first loan, which he is planning to use to buy more animals for fattening to later sell them at a profit. He hopes to use the profits from the proceeds of this loan to expand his business and become a commercial animal seller.

Fredrick's dream is to do well in the business and start dairy farming. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To buy more animals for fattening to later sell at a profit

loans.name: Muzafar

texts.en:
S. Muzafar has been baking traditional bread since a young age. He inherited this skill from his father and grandfather. His working day starts at 4 a.m. when he and his assistants begin to knead dough, form the bread, and heat the stove. At the beginning, Muzafar kneads dough from two sacks of flour of 50 kg. each. The winter is an important period for his business, as there are many holidays this season. He needs to have a stock of flours and coal. For this reason Muzafar applied to IMON International for a loan of 8,200 Somoni. Muzafar and his family appreciate your support in helping him improve his business.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing flour wholesale for baking the national bread “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin A. is from the village of Maluno Norte, Benito Soliven, Isabela. He is 54 years old. Martin is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Martin owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Martin has been engaged in his business for over 25 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Martin joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Martin is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Martin from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “INTI QUILLA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac en la provincia y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Eufemia; La socia tiene 60 años D. edad, es casada, y tiene 5 hijos, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta D. artesanía, la socia elabora a mano y a máquina chompas D. alpaca, mantas, medias, gorras, chalinas, guantes y mucho más, también compra artesanía popular, llaveros al por mayor, aretes y otros. La socia requiere el crédito para poder tener capital D. trabajo y esto reinvertirlo en la compra D. mercadería para implementar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para la elaboración D. chompas y otros.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Inti Quilla communal bank. The bank is located in the Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco.

Eufemia is 60 years old, married, and has five children. She works buying and selling handicrafts and makes alpaca sweaters, blankets, socks, hats, scarves, gloves and many other items by hand and using a machine. She also purchases traditional handicrafts such as wholesale key chains, earrings, and other items. Eufemia needs the loan to be able to have working capital to reinvest in the purchase of merchandise for her business. She is requesting the loan to purchase materials to make sweaters and other items.

Eufemia is happy for the loan granted and she promises to make her loan payments in the established time frame.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making sweaters and other items

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine is a 42-year-old married woman with 3 children who lives in her own house in Hioma, Uganda. She has a business of buying and selling beans which she has been running for 8 years . She started as a farmer and later saved to start the produce business. In future, she hopes to move to her own bigger store. Justine wants the loan to buy beans for sale.

loans.use: To purchase beans

loans.name: Mujeres Forjadoras Group

texts.es:
“MUJERES FORJADORAS “es  un grupo que recién se inicia esta conformado por 8 socias  una D. ellas es la Sra. Dula quien ha sido nombrada  Presidenta del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta D. comida rápida  “BURGER DULA”  así se llama  su negocio, el que es frecuentado por muchas personas D. la zona donD. vive, ahí ofrece hamburguesas, salchipapas, alitas etc. ella agradece a  su madre que fue quien le enseño  a preparar estos alimentos  durante un buen tiempo ella fue su ayudante así fue aprendiendo ahora que lo hace por su propia cuenta se siente feliz por que ayuda a sus hijos con sus estudios, su préstamo lo utilizara en la compra D. su propia salchipapera, la que tiene es prestada y para ella es incomodo trabajar así  ahora estará mas tranquila y  podrá preparar mas cantidades D. la acostumbrada D. esta manera  su negocio seguirá creciendo, su mira es poner un restaurante D. comida criolla  esta segura D. poder lograrlo muy pronto.

* La Sra. Dula aparece sentada D. cuclillas.
texts.en:
The group named "Mujeres Forjadoras" is a newly formed group that is maD. up of 8 women, one of whom is Dula. She has been named the leader of the group. She has a fast food business called “Burger Dula". Her business is visited by many people in the region where she lives. She sells hamburgers, salchipapas (a combination of fried chicken, sausages, and fried potatoes), chicken wings, etc. She is very thankful to her mother who taught her who to prepare these recipes when she was her helper during some time. She learned with time and today she has a business of her own. She is happy with the business because she is able to send her children to school. Her loan will be used to purchase her own stove. The stove she uses now are on loan to her and it is uncomfortable to work this way. She will be more confident with this change and she will be able to prepare larger quantities of food that she is used to. Her business will continue to grow and her goal is to have a restaurant serving Creole cuisine.  This loan will help her reach her goal more quickly. 

* Dula can be seen in the photo, in the front row.

loans.use: To purchase a stove.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a thirty-six-year-old married woman with four children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling second-hand clothes for the last ten years. She started with capital of 100,000 shillings and the business has been steadily growing such that she has been able to buy land and build a house out of the business profit. Her hardship is poor quality clothes and her vision is business expansion plus educating her children. Mary needs the loan to buy second-hand clothes for sale.

loans.use: Buying  clothes for sale

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Danaya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 25 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Belekonobougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de tubercules, de savon, d’articles divers et de céréales.                                                                                                                                    
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. FATOUMATA C. compte acheter des tubercules avec les grossistes du village et environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement sur place au village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les trousseaux de mariage, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya group, all married women, are on the average  25 years old, with three children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Belekonobougou, Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali). They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They sell yams, soap, cereals and miscellaneous articles. The members of the Danaya group are on their first solidarity group with Soro Yiriwaso. 

Fatoumata C. plans to buy yams from wholesalers in her village and nearby areas. She sells daily out of her home, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed of both men and women. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 10,000 West African francs, which will be used to pay for wedding trousseaux and cover her contribution to major social events, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Purchasing yams

loans.name: Bunrin

texts.en:
Mrs. Bunrin B., 42, is a widow with 4 sons and 1 daughter; one has full-time employment and the others are in school. The family lives in a village off National Road Number Two, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Bunrin has been operating a grocery store in front of her home for 17 years. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike for her children to get school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to get school

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong L., age 57, earns a living by selling dried fish at market. She lives in the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh city. She is a widow and has three children, all of whom are married and working in different occupations. They help their mother by providing small monthly sums of money for her to use toward the family's living expenses.

Hong L. is concerned about the conditions of her house, which is old and in need of frequent repair. She is requesting a loan in order to make necessary repairs to her house.

loans.use: to make necessary repairs to her old house

loans.name: Soliboy

texts.en:
S. Soliboy is 42 years old. He is married and the father of two children. He is a livestock breeder who buys and sells cattle from different market places. He has been in this business for the last 20 years. His main customers are butchers and livestock farmers. With this loan from Kiva, Soliboy plans to increase his herd of cattle for trade and, if possible, open up his own butchery. This, he says, will increase his turnover. He plans to see his children go through higher education and be able to get good jobs, unlike himself. 

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit:  www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Yrma

texts.es:
Yrma es una madre de familia de 37 años de edad, vive con sus hijos y esposo en su casa propia la cula cuenta con todos los servicios básicos construida de material rústico, ubicado en la zona rural del casería de Paccha,  pertenece al distrito de Chulucanas  en el departamento de Piura .  Estos distritos se caracterizan por su alta actividad comercial y  agricola  que desarrollan sus pobladores.

Yrma ha puesto  en su casa una bodega y también se dedica ha la crianza de pavos desde  haceunos5años.  En su bodega sus vecinos encuentran toda clase de productos comestibles y una vez que sus pavos alcanzan el tamaño como elpeso ideal los vende en el mercado del distrito de Chulucanas, mediante ambas actividades trata Yrma de tener un mejor nivel de vida.

Mediante una visita a Edpyme Alternativa Yrma trata de poder adquirir un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más productos para su tienda como para comprar mas pavos para criarlos y posteriormente venderlos y así poder cubrir elpagode su crédito.

Yrma es conocida por sus vecinos, por ser una mujer  alegre, dispuesta a ayudar a otros y una madre responsable con elobjetivo de que como familia salgan adelante apunta de esfuerzo y trabajo.
texts.en:
Yrma is the mother of a family. She is 37 years old and she lives with her children and her husband in her own home. She has all the basic services and it is constructed from rustic materials. It is located in the rural region of Caseria de Paccha, belonging to the district of Chyulucanas in the department of Piura. These districts are known for their heightened commercial and agricultural activities carried out by the population. 

Yrma has a grocery store installed in her home and she also been raising turkeys for the past few years. In her store her neighbors are able to find all kinds of food products. When the turkeys have achieved an ideal size and weight she sells them in the district market of Chulucanas. It is through these two businesses that Yrma tries to achieve a better quality of life.

At a visit to Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) Yrma requested a loan of 2000 nuevos soles to purchase more products for her store and to purchase turkeys to raise and later resell. This is how she expects to make her loan payments.

Yrma is known by her neighbors to be a very happy woman who is ready to help everyone. She is known as a responsible mother with an objective to support her family through effort and hard work.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is from the city of Guingona Ozamiz City. He is 59 years old and married with five adult children. To make a living, Ernesto owns a business offering transportation services. He has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Ernesto joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 15000 PHP to repair his existing vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Ernesto from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Halima has operated a poultry business for the past five years, selling to hotel operators and neighbors. She faces the major challenge of disease outbreak in her business.  She dreams of expanding her poultry business in the future.

With the KSHS 15,000 loan, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias is a hard working man with a restaurant/hotel business in Kitwe Trading centre.   He prepares food ready to be eaten by his clients, mostly residents within Katwe trading centre, and he is able to generate 150,000 shillings a week. He has owned the business for over 2 years and works hand in hand with his sister in the restaurant. He initiated the idea of a restaurant and dreams about growing his business and leading a better life. He needs a loan to buy a brand new refrigerator so he can serve his customers cold drinks.

loans.use: To buy a new fridge so he can serve his customers cold drinks.

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.es: Timoteo de 53 años de edad es una persona que le a gustado luchar por la vida el se dedica a la venta de leña por mayor el nos cuenta que es una actividad que le a gustado porque todos sus clientes son puntuales y han aumentado por eso el esta solicitando este credito para la compra de leña por tarima ya que tiene mucha demanda de sus clientes y no tiene el capital suficiente para negociar, el sueño mas grande de el es darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en: Timoteo is 53 years old.  He is a person has enjoyed working hard in life.  His business is selling firewood wholesale.  He tells us that it is a business he has enjoyed because all his customers are punctual and his number of customers has increased.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy firewood by the pallet as he has a lot of demand from his customers and doesn't have enough capital to negotiate.  His biggest dream is to provide his children with a better future.

loans.use: to buy firewood by the pallet

loans.name: Jelma Luz

texts.en: Jelma Luz, a 26-year-old married mother of one child, lives in the Philippines where, for the past three years, she has operated a retail shop that sells biscuits, beverages and breads. A new member of HSPFI, Jelma Luz is  requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods and beverages. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and beverages.

loans.name: Josepha

texts.en:
Josepha is a 28-year-old, married Rwandan entrepreneur. She has 3 children, who are between the ages of 4 and 8. All of her children are in school, while she and her husband run a business together. 

For the past 4 years, she has operated a general store, where she sells soaps, beans, salt, and other goods. The profits from the business have helped her meet the needs of her family. 

She is seeking this loan so that she can purchase a variety of goods that she will then sell in her store. She expects that the loan proceeds will allow her to generate additional profits, which she will use to support her family.  She also plans to save any future profits she earns to ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods (e.g., soaps, beans, and salt) for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary, an ambitious 33-year-old businesswoman, is single and blessed with two children. For the last five years she has been providing tailoring services, primarily making school bags, to meet the needs of her family.

Thanks to Faulu Kenya, Rosemary has been able to supply her business with the necessary materials, and she is now requesting a loan of 20000 Kenya shillings to buy more fabric. Within the next five years, she wants to become a major supplier of school bags in Kenya.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Mouhamadou Bobo

texts.fr: -Monsieur Mouhamadou  est un habitant du Sénégal, âgé de 49 ans. IL est marié et  évolue dans le secteur de commerce depuis plusieurs années. Il gère une boutique dans la localité ou il vit. Il à choisit son activité par nécessité  pour subvenir à ses besoins personnels. Il est membre de l’U-IMCEC depuis  trois mois. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000. Son objectif consiste à augmenter son fond de roulement en achetant les produits qui lui permettront de renforcer son stock des marchandises afin de mieux développer son commerce. Son souhait est de s’assurer des revenus stables afin de pouvoir réaliser ses projets futurs et soutenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Mouhamadou lives in Senegal and is 49 years old. He is married and has been working in commerce for several years. He runs a shop in the town where lives. He chose this business by necessity to support himself. 

Mr. Mouhamadou has been a member of the micro-finance institution U-IMCEC for three months. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs. His goal consists in increasing his working capital by buying goods enabling him to bolster his stock of merchandise. This is for developing his business further. His wish is to ensure stable revenues to accomplish future projects and to support his family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to be sold

loans.name: Francisca Javier

texts.es: Francisca Javier reside en casa propia junto con su pequeño nieto. Durante mucho tiempo ha trabajado duramente para sacar adelante a su familia. Francisca siempre ha sido de las mujeres que nos les gusta estar sin hacer nada,  para ella el trabajo es sagrado y lo realizan con mucha dedicación. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como: aceite, huevos, frijoles, pan dulce, arroz, detergente, etc. su negocio se encuentra ubicado en lugar muy estratégico ya que es muy concurrido y accesible. Gracias al carisma y dedicación de Francisca en el trabajo ha logrado establecer una gran cantidad de clientes los cuales cada día la prefieren mas. Es una persona con muchas aspiraciones en la vida y una de ellas es poder ampliar su negocio surtiéndolo con diferentes productos de tienda de tal modo que pueda cubrir una mayor demanda para lograr mejorar sus ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida.  Es por esto que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar  variedad de productos de tienda como: arroz, frijoles, maíz, aceite, pan dulce, golosinas, café, detergente, etc. con el objetivo de ver florecer su negocio y poder cumplir el sueño de su vida.
texts.en:
Francisca Javier lives in her own house with her small grandson.  She's worked hard for a long time to help her family get ahead in life.  Francisca has always been one of those women who don't like to be doing nothing. For her, work is sacred, and she does it with a lot of dedication. 

She sells basic households products, such as cooking oil, eggs, beans, sweet breads, rice, detergent, etc. Her business is in a very strategic location, since it is very busy and easy to access.  Thanks to her charisma and commitment to her work, Francisca has managed to attract a large number of customers, who each day prefer her more and more. 

She is a person with many goals in life, and one of them is to is to be able to expand her business, stocking it with different products. This will enable her to meet a greater demand, and thereby improve her income and quality of life. 

This is why she has decided to apply to INTEGRAL for this loan, in order to buy a variety of products for her store, such as: rice, beans, corn, cooking oil, sweet breads, candy, coffee, detergent, etc. Her objective is to see her business flourish, and in this way, fulfil her life's dream.

loans.use: To buy a variety of products for her store, such as: rice, beans, corn, cooking oil, sweet breads, candy, coffee, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Victoria Del Pilar

texts.es:
Victoria nació en el departamento del Ancash al norte del Perú. Actualmente, Victoria tiene 41 años de edad, ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. Victoria desde hace 17 años que radica en la ciudad del Cusco y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella es entrenadora de yudo y en sus horas libres trabaja en el IDP (Instituto de Deporte del Perú filial Cusco).  Ya son tres años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Victoria también se dedica a la venta de uniformes de Yudo. En esta oportunidad Victoria requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo uniformes de yudo. Su sueño de victoria es abrir un restaurante. 

El Banco Comunal “Virgen de las Nieves” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Victoria was born in Ancash department, in the north of Peru.  She is 41 years old, married, and has three children from her marriage.  Victoria has lived in the city of Cusco for the past 17 years and this is where she carries out her business activities.  Victoria is a judo trainer and in her free time she works at IDP (Sports Institute of Peru - Cusco branch).  She has been in this line of work for three years and is doing very well.  Victoria also sells judo uniforms.  On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy merchandise such as judo uniforms.  Victoria's dream is to open a restaurant.

The 'Virgen de las Nieves' community bank meets once a month in the city of Cusco (Peru).  Cusco is well known for being a very touristy, commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi fiesta and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world (Machu Picchu).

loans.use: to buy merchandise (judo uniforms)

loans.name: Manuchehr

texts.ru: Манучехр проживает в городе Худжанд. Ему 22 года. Он женат. Имеет одного ребенка. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Манучехр зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Он берет кредит для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Manuchehr lives in the town of Khujand. He is 22 years old. He is married and has one child. His wife is a homemaker. Manuchehr makes a living by breeding large horned cattle. He is taking out the loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit, who is 49 years old, lives in the village of Tsinsvla, located in the Adjara region, where he earns a living growing fruit on the 0.4 hectare plot of land that he owns, selling his harvest to local greengrocery retailers. He also grows flowers and makes wine, selling locally.

Having already purchased grapes in the Kakheti region, Davit is requesting a loan to purchase sugar for wine production. The wine will be ready for sale by December, and he plans to reinvest the profit in his farming activities in order to develop them and increase profitability.

loans.use: to purchase sugar for wine production.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Unidas actualmente se encuentra en el primer ciclo del programa D. mujeres emprendedoras D. la Fundación Paraguaya, con un total D. 10 integrantes. Han demostrado unión y solidaridad entre las compañeras; quienes poseen cada una, una actividad económica y son muy trabajadoras. Ellas desean un mejor porvenir para todas sus familias e hijos.
Fatima, una D. las miembros se dedica a la cría y posterior venta D. animales, oficio que ella describe como muy sacrificado, ya que requiere D. mucho esfuerzo no solo físico, sino también mental. Dice que los animales deben D. ser atendidos siempre, para que los mismos no tengan enfermedades u otro tipo D. problemas. Sueña con poder tener una granja con muchos animales.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. animales pequeños para la cría y también balanceado para ellos. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Mujeres Unidas" is currently in its 1st loan cycle of the program for enterprising women of the Fundación Paraguaya, witth a total of 10 members. They have demonstrated unity and solidarity amongst the members, each of which owns a business and is very hardworking. They want a better future for their families and children.

Fatima, one of the members, breeds and sells animals, a job she describes as being very self-sacrificing as it requires a lot of physical and mental effort. She says that the animals need constant attention so that they do not contract diseases or other problems. She dreams of having a farm with a lot of animals.

She is asking for the loan to buy young animals for breeding and also balanced feed for them. She is thankful to the Fundación and Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: o buy animals for breeding and the relevant feed.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a 34-year-old single woman. She describes herself to be ambitious and honest. She operates a grocery store where she sells kale, onions, tomatoes, cabbages and other green vegetables. She has been involved in this business for six years and employs one staff member. Her business is located in a busy market and her primary customers are restaurants. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to increase stock of vegetables. Her business goal is to grow it into a wholesale one within five years.
