She hopes that in the future, she will grow the business and construct a permanent premises where she will be able to run her business smoothly.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Eveline

texts.en: Engaging into a direct selling business is the main source of income for Eveline. She sells cosmetics, clothes and other personal products to her customers. She really wants to sustain her business and provide her customers demands but she has insufficient capital so she decided to ask for a financial assistance to ASKI through KIVA. She is requesting to avail a loan amounting to P10,000 to purchase dress, lotion and umbrella to sell to her customers. She hopes that lenders will approve her request to be able to achieve her goals in life. The income that she will generate will be used to sustain her business and to save some funds for the future needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy dress, lotion and umbrella to sell to her customers

loans.name: Marwa

texts.en:
Marwa is a 33-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of five children.

Marwa is requesting a loan of 800 JD to do home maintenance.

Marwa is looking to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to do home maintenance

loans.name: Cecilia Argentina

texts.es:
La joven Cecilia tiene 26 años de edad,  vive en la comunidad de Palo Herrado,  junto a ella vive su madre  y juntas trabajan duro para salir adelante, Cecilia es muy trabajadora y dedicada a su negocio, que es prestar el servicio de moler maiz, tiene un molino, actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años en su casa de habitacion, este tipo de negocio es bueno ya que aqui vienen a moler el maiz muchas personas para elaborar las deliciosas tortillas que son el alimento que acompaña los tres tiempos de comida de muchas familias.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de repuestos para su molino y hacerle mantenimiento. 
Cecilia trabaja muy fuerte para hacer crecer su negocio y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a young woman aged 26 who lives in the Palo Herrado community together with her mother, and they both work had together to provide for themselves. Cecilia is very hardworking and committed to her activity: she provides corn grinding services with the grinder she owns in her own house. She has been engaged in this activity for 4 years, and this is a good kind of activity since many people come to her house to grind the corn they need to prepare delicious tortillas, food that goes with all the three main meals of many families.
She will use the loan to buy spare parts for her grinder and to pay for its maintenance.
Cecilia works really hard to make her activity grow and to reach a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for her grinder.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
This is Editha, 46, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. Her husband is Rodrigo, her business partner, and a father to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Editha operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five peso's worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Editha hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Noudai-Kpon. Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NOUDAI-KPON est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Victorine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Victorine est âgée de 49 ans et est une veuve. Victorine a cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés, mais aucun des enfants n'est plus à sa charge. Victorine vit seule et assure seule ses différents besoins. Il y a près de quinze ans que Victorine mène comme activité la vente de mèches à son domicile. Victorine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête d'une meilleure satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Victorine sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NOUDAI-KPON.
texts.en:
NOUDAI-KPON Group is made up of three women who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, named Victorine, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. This is the first time that the members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

Victorine is 49 years old and a widow. She has five children, out of whom some attend school, but they are no longer under her care. Victorine lives alone and provides for herself on her own.

Almost fifteen years ago, she started selling hair extensions at her home. She gets her supplies in one of Benin's markets. Eager to better satisfy her clientele and in order to increase her income, she's seeking a first loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the group.

loans.use: to buy packs of hair extensions

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
This is Daisy, 32 years old, resident of Silang, Cavite Philippines. She is married to Napoleon, a driver. She is the mother of one child. By the grace of God, Daisy has managed to support her child's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Daisy oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one unit of tricycles that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 300 every day.  

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php17, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories, and also for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Daisy dreams to be able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit

loans.name: Timothy  Nyiro

texts.en:
Timothy  was born in Gongoni Village in Malindi Kenya . He is married with children and is engaged in retail small scale business. Timothy wants to make a difference in his community and town of Malindi by engaging community health outreach programme run by a Community Based Organization CBO in Malindi 

He has also committed to spend most of his free time with the CHW counseling the youth on avoiding anti social practices, drug abuse and AIDs/HIV prevention. Timothy is happy to own his own motorcycle and is ready to give back to the community as a trainee CHW volunteer.

Timothy will also use the income generated from his motorcycle business to support his family he plans to buy another motorcycle and support more CHWs in future

loans.use: To buy Motorcycle for Community Health Work and Livelihoods

loans.name: Grupo La Cuchilla Agricola Group

texts.es:
Gerardo es un hombre de 33 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 5 y 12 años, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Gerardo con el afán de mejorar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica al cultivo de maíz, con esta actividad lleva  10 años de dedicarse a esta actividad. Gerardo por ser el cultivo su mayor fuente de ingresos le preocupa mucho no contar con el capital suficiente para darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de maíz por esa razón acude a un préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra.
Su mayor anhelo es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra

loans.name: Alafat

texts.en:
Alafat is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin. She settled with his family in Sumgait city. She is 44. She vidow and has 1 child. Alafat has lost the husband in war. Not looking all difficulties in current of 14 years she has grown up the child one. 
She applies for the loan $500 to increase the good assortments.

loans.use: To increase the good assortments

loans.name: Mohtrama

texts.en: Mohtrama is 38 lives in district 6 Kabul in a household of four. He has a burger shop where he sells burgers, chips, eggs and soft drinks. He believes in the summer people want more soft drinks, so he took a loan to buy more. He would like another loan to buy a refrigerator for his shop and rebuild his shop with a new design.

loans.use: Mohtrama would like to buy a refrigerator for his burger shop and help rebuild it

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr:
Mrs. Edoh A. was born in 1960 in Tsévié. She is illiterate and has six (06) children. Her husband is a volunteer teacher with a meagre salary in a private school, which means that all of the household expenses fall on her. Dynamic and entrepreneurial, she meets the needs of her family thanks to the income she procures through the preparation and sale of rice. She managed well the two previous loans she obtained and repaid them on time.

Currently, she is asking for a loan of $700, which will serve to buy bags of rice and cans of oil to strengthen her business of selling cooked rice on the roadside. In this way, she will be able to contribute more to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Edoh est née en 1960 à Tsévié. Elle est analphabète et mère de six (06) enfants. Son mari est enseignant volontaire avec un maigre salaire dans une école privée, ce qui fait que toutes les charges du foyer sont assurées par elle. Dynamique et entreprenante, elle subvient aux besoins de sa famille grâce aux revenus que la procure la préparation et la vente du riz. Elle a su bien gérer les deux premiers crédits obtenus et les a remboursé convenablement.

A présent, elle sollicite un crédit de $700 qui servira à l’achat des sacs de riz et des bidons d’huile pour renforcer son activité de vente de riz cuit au bord de la route. Ainsi pourra-t-elle participer davantage à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and cans of oil for the preparation and sale of rice

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru:
Manzura is 40 years old, is married and has 3 children. She has a secondary school education and her husband has been working in Russia for several years. Her children go to school and after school help their mother in her trading.

Manzura sells women’s clothing. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2005. Back then her inventory was worth $150 and her product line included only ethnic dresses. After receiving a loan and using it fully she started not only selling European women’s clothing, but she also started traveling for products to neighboring countries on her own. Right now she has assets of $600. In the future she plans to add women’s shoes to her product offering.

P.S. Her son is in the photo.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хусейнова Манзура – 40лет. Замужем, трое детей. Образование среднее. Муж уже несколько лет в России на заработках. Дети учатся в школе, а после школы помогают своей матери в торговле. Она занимается реализацией женской одежды. Клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» является с 2003года. В то время её товарооборот составляли на сумму 150$, и в её ассортименте имелось только национальное платье. После получения займа и целевого использования она не только стала торговать европейской женской одеждой, но и стала ездить за товаром в соседние страны сама. Сейчас её активы возросли до 600$. В будущем планирует добавить в ассортимент и женскую обувь. P.S. На фото её сын.

loans.use: to increase assortment

loans.name: Irada

texts.en: Irada, 43 is a mother of three children. She is a widowand has been running her orchard farming business for 6 years. She is now requesting a loan of $950 to buy pesticides and seedlings.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides and seedlings for her farming business

loans.name: Sattar

texts.en: Sattar A. lives in Beylagan, a small city in south western Azerbaijan. He is 22 years old and is single. He rented a small store in the city center and is engaged in clothing sales there. He sells women's clothes. Sattar needs a loan in the amount of $300 to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Luaipou

texts.en: Luaipou is a 35 year old mother of  4 children from the Nuusiatia village. Her first loan was used to buy supplies for her taro plantation. She is now applying for another loan to fix the wall of her house and to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation and for home improvement

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Mrs. Gloria belongs to The New Eden Communal Bank, located in the district of Yarina Cocha in the neighborhood of Ucayali. She is 52 years old and the mother of four children. Three of her children are adults and one still depends on her. She is a single mother. With her first loan of 300 Peruvian Soles from Manuela Ramos she decided to invest in a small store and sell “Juanes” (pumpkin fritters) there.

Presently she has a little store in her home and she sells basic items including pumpkin fritters. She starts her day at 6 a.m. She goes to the market and buys the products she needs to stock her store. Every afternoon and evening she spends time making her pumpkin fritters. Then she rests so she can be ready for the next day.

With the loan of 2,200 Peruvian Soles, which she plans to pay back in 5 months, she will invest in products she needs to keep her business going, like 1 sack of rice, 1 box of oil, ½ sack of Flour, 1 sack of sugar, 1 package of noodles, 1 box of milk, 1 bag of detergent, etc.

Gloria is really happy because ever since she is working with Manuela Ramos her sales have gone up, her income is also going up. Her family is doing so well and that makes her extremely happy!

Translated from Spanish by Mariela of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Gloria pertenece al banco comunal Nuevo Edén, ubicado en Jr. 2 de Mayo Mz. G Lt. 7, distrito de Yarina Cocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 52 años, es madre de 4 hijos, 3 mayores de edad y uno que aún depende de ella y es separada. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 que recibió de Manuela Ramos decide invertir en una pequeña bodega y venta de picarones.

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega y también se dedica a la venta de picarones en su casa. Se levanta a las 6.00 a.m. para ir al mercado y comprar los productos que le faltan para la venta en la bodega, en las tardes se dedica a la preparación y venta de picarones y luego descansa para el día siguiente.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2,200, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará, 1 saco de arroz, 1 caja de aceite, ½ saco de harina , 1 saco de azúcar, 1 paquete de fideo, 1 caja de leche, 1 bolsa de detergente, etc.

Gloria se siente muy bien porque desde que empezó a trabajar con Manuela Ramos sus ventas aumentaron, sus ingresos económicos también, su familia está bien y eso la hace muy feliz.

loans.use: Purchase grocery goods (rice, oil, flour, etc.)

loans.name: Mirzoboev

texts.ru:
M. Mirzoboev is 48 years old, married and has 6 children. His main source of income comes from fattening and sale of livestock, mainly sheep. Currently he has 5 rams in his barn. After feeding the animals for one month he immediately sells them at the Chairuch market and buys cheaper ones. His wife spins yarn from the sheep's wool, providing additional income for the family. Currently the market price for livestock are low and Mr. Mirzoboev is planning to purchase a few young rams, which is why he has applied for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Махмудчон Мирзобоев 48 лет, отец 6 детей, основной доход имеет от откорма и продажи скота.Во сновном он покупает мелкорогатый скот.Сейчас имеет 5 баранов.Откормив один месяц он сразу продает на Чайрухском базаре и покупает подешевле.Его жена прядет прядь из бараньей шерсти.Счего она имеет семейный доход.Поэтому пока сезон дешевого скота он хочет закупить еще несколько маленьких барашек.Для чего и хочет получить займ

loans.use: Raising and sale of sheep

loans.name: Joyas 3 Group

texts.es:
Rosa is 26 years and she works in making regional typical clothes. She makes skirts and blouses and dedicates a lot of time to them. She doesn't makes them but she also embroiders them by hand. This merchandise is sold with and by other women of her own area. With the small amount of money that she obtains from her sales, she is able to sustain her 2 children. Her husband works out on the countryside and what they harvest is for their own consumption. With the loan that he is applying for, Rosa will like to get more fabrics and threads to manufacture more clothes. The other group members are: Juana R. Nuñez, Cornelia R. Nuñez and Micaela H. H. all of them artisans.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

ROSA TIENE 26 AÑOS, SE DEDICA A CONFECCIONAR ROPA TIPICA DE LA REGION, ELABORA FALDAS Y BLUSAS A LAS CUALES LES DEDICA MUCHO TIEMPO YA QUE TAMBIEN LAS BORDA, ESTA MERCANCIA ES VENDIDA CON MUJERES DE SU MISMA LOCALIDAD , CON EL POCO DINERO QUE OPTIENE DE ESTO MANTIENE A SUS 2 HIJOS, YA QUE SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA A TRABAJAR EL CAMPO Y LO QUE COSECHAN ES PARA COMER, CON EL CREDITO LE GUSTARIA ADQUIRIR MAS TELA E HILOS PARA CONFECCIONAR MAS ROPA. LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON: JUANA R. N., CORNELIA R. N. Y MICAELA H. H. SON ARTESANAS.

loans.use: Buying fabrics, threads, and dyes.

loans.name: Christina's Chapakazi Group

texts.en:
Christina is 43 years old and is a married woman with 4 children, ages 7 to 23 years old. Christina is a snack seller, and she started in 2008. Every day, she works from 7 am to 10 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $230 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more snack items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Jesca and Damari, who have businesses dealing in tailoring.

loans.use: To buy more snacks items for her business.

loans.name: Upuia

texts.en: Upuia F., 45, is married and has four children.  She has three years' experience in the business of cooking taro and bananas, and sells to villagers and the general public six days a week. She has had two previous loans from SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be about $208. SPBD loans are Upuia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used for home improvement.  Upuia is a hard working mother and has created her business to help care for her family.

loans.use: To buy machetes, pesticides, a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, flavorings and oil

loans.name: Jaiser

texts.es:
Jaiser is 32 years old and single. He lives with his beloved mother who he supports a lot because she is ill. He learned to cook empirically and he is now happy because he provides services to various restaurants who are familiar with his great work. At the same time he also sells articles clothing. His dream is to have his own restaurant in order to delight thousands of diners with his excellent dishes.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Jaiser, de 32 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive en compañía de su amada mamá, a quien apoya mucho ya que se encuentra mal de salud; él aprendió el arte culinario empíricamente y ahora se siente feliz por que brinda sus servicios a distintos restaurantes que saben de su buen trabajo, pero a la vez también se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir. Su deseo es implementar su propio restaurante para deleitar a miles de comensales con sus excelentes platillos.

loans.use: Increase capital to run his own restaurant.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.fr:
Born on September 25, 1972 in Wahala, in the Plateaux region in TOGO, Ms. Adjoa D. got married to Mr. Koffi GADJEZO, who is a mechanic. She has two children. Established for five years in the Agoè district, she sells charcoal near the marketplace of this district. She wishes to include commerce in corn and yams and is requesting this initial loan to do so. The loan would be used to buy 40 yam tubers and 5 sacks of corn in order to satisfy her customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Née le 25 septembre 1972 à Wahala dans la région des plateaux au TOGO, dame D. Adjoa s’est mariée à monsieur GADJEZO Koffi qui est un mécanicien et a deux enfants. Installée dans le quartier d’Agoè à proximité du marché dudit quartier depuis plus de cinq ans, elle vend du charbon. Elle désire ajouter le commerce du maïs et d’igname et sollicite à cet effet ce premier crédit pour acheter 40 tubercules d’ignames et 6 sacs de maïs afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients.

loans.use: To buy tubers and corn

loans.name: Anatolia

texts.es:
Anatolia is a member of the communal bank “Amor Divino”.

Anatolia is married, 43 years old and has six children. Anatolia sells natural medicines at the wholesale food market of the city of Ayacucho. Anatolia locates herself at the same spot each day from 5:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m. She learned this activity from her husband who is a native of the Peruvian jungle. Anatolia travels to the central jungle on a monthly basis to purchase medicinal plants, tree resin and bark.

Anatolia needs a loan of 2,000 soles, funds that will be invested into the purchase of dry herbs, resin and rubber plant.

Anatolia dreams of having a home, a well-stocked store, making more sales and providing an education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva volunteer.

Anatolia es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.

Anatolia es conviviente, tiene 43 años y 6 hijos, Anatolia vende medicinas naturales de manera ambulatoria en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Anatolia se ubica diariamente en el mismo lugar a las 5 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la mañana, actividad que aprendió de su esposo que es nativo de la selva peruana, Anatolia viaja mensualmente a la selva central a comprar plantas medicinales, resinas de árboles, cortezas.

Anatolia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de hierbas secas, resinas y palo de goma.

Anatolia sueña con tener una casa, una tienda surtida, vender por mayor y que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: Anatolia needs a loan of 2,000 soles, funds that will be invested into the purchase of dry herbs, resin and rubber plant.

loans.name: Anta

texts.fr: Anta S. est une femme mariée agée de 25 ans.elle habite au quartier Grand Thies et fait du commerce , greffages, mèches depuis trois ans. elle s'aprovisionne des grossistes du marché central de thies pour ensuite les revendre dans son quartier
texts.en:
Anta S., age 25, is married, and she lives in the neighborhood called Grand Thies. Anta has been selling cloth and various sorts of hair extensions for 3 years. She is requesting this loan so as to better prepare for the Muslim holiday locally known as Korité.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: vente de greffage

loans.name: Badeya (La Fraternité) Group

texts.fr:
Les six (6) femmes du groupe Badeya (toutes mariées) ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 3 enfants et vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Banconi de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Uni essentiellement par des liens professionnel et de voisinage ce groupe mène l’activité de vente de tissus, de poissons, de condiments alimentaires, de bois de chauffe, de sucre etc.
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, ce groupe décida d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel il est à son troisième prêt solidaire (prêt du groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce prêt, elles acheteront, 30  mètres de  tissus, 3 cartons de poissons fumés, 5 sacs de sucre, 5 chargements de charrette en  bois de chauffe et une grande  quantité de condiments (aubergines, gombos, oignons, etc). Leurs principales sources d’approvisionnement sont  en plus de la ville de Sikasso (au Mali), les villes de Bobo Dioulasso(Burkina Faso) et Bouaké respectivement (Côte d’Ivoire) en Afrique de l’Ouest.  Elles effectuent leurs ventes de façon ambulante dans les différentes entreprises, dans les quartiers de la ville et à domicile où les voisins viennent s’y ravitailler nuit et jour.
La clientèle est  composée généralement de femmes et de quelques hommes. Les membres du groupe Badeya espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 35.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utiliser pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The six women of the Badeya group (all married) have an average age of 32, three children and live in traditional large, extended families in the Banconi district of Sikasso (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Brought together mainly through professional and neighborhood connections, the group sells cloth, fish, condiments, firewood, sugar, etc. All previous loans were repaid successfully. The women will use this loan to purchase 30 meters of cloth, 3 boxes of smoked fish, 5 bags of sugar, 5 bundles of firewood and a large quantity of vegetables for condiments (e.g. eggplant, okra and onions). They obtain their supplies mainly from the West African towns of Sikasso in Mali, Bobo Dioulasso in Burkina Faso and Bouaké in Ivory Coast. Sales are conducted door-to-door at various businesses or around the town’s neighborhoods, or at their homes to neighbors who come to buy supplies day and night. Their customers are mainly women but some men. The members of the Badeya group each hope to make an average profit of CFA 35,000 per month, which will be used to pay the loan interest and provide for their families’ needs. The remainder will be invested in their business.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items to sell (cloth, smoked fish, sugar, firewood and condiments).

loans.name: Luís Fiosse

texts.pt:
Luís Fiosse José é natural de Tete uma das províncias do centro de Moçambique que faz fronteira com Zimbabwe,  tem 39 anos de idade, casado e pai de 5 filhos com idade entre 19, 14, 9, 5 e 2 anos respectivamente. Para alem da sua família sustenta um sobrinho que vive com ele na sua casa.

Luís estudou até 10ªclasse e parou quando teve que se incorporar se no serviço militar, mudou se da província de Tete para Maputo no distrito de Boane quando foi transferido para o quartel general de Boane. Onde é militar a 16 anos e trabalha das 7:00h as 15:30h com um salário mensal de 5200,00mt, possui casa própria.

Para luís este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no kiva e conheceu  a hluvuku através da sua tia que é cliente a bastante tempo, os valores emprestados sempre aplicou na compra de material de construção da sua própria casa e este também vai comprar material para construção do muro e fazer acabamentos da sua obra.
 
Luís pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro empréstimo para compra de mobília e tinta para pintar a casa.
texts.en:
Luís Fiosse José is a native of Tete, one of the provinces in the center of Mozambique that boarders with Zimbabwe. He is 39 years old, married, and the father of 5 children with ages 19, 14, 9, 5, and 2 respectively. Besides his family he supports a nephew who also lives with him in his house. Luís studied until the 10th grade and stopped when he had to join the military service. He moved from the province of Tete to Maputo in the district of Boane when he was transferred to headquarters. He has been in the military 16 years and works from 7:00am to 3:30pm with a monthly salary of 5,200MT. He has his own home. This is Luís' third loan through Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. He came to know Hluvuku through an aunt who has been a client for a long time. The loan proceeds have always applied to the purchase of construction materials for his own home as well as materials to construct a wall and finish his work. Luís intends to pay off the loan before maturity so he can solicit another loan to purchase furnishings and paint for his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Salomey

texts.en:
Salomey M. is 38 years old, married, and has one child who just completed senior high school. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies, and biscuits in the local market.

She wants to use the loan to buy these goods in bulk stock to expand her business. Salomey hopes to make a good income from the expanded business and hopes it will provide her child with a tertiary education. She belongs to the community group called ‘Mount Calvary’ Trust Group. The group members guarantee a loan through a repayment pledge and assist one another to repay loans.

loans.use: Buy bulk supplies of grocery goods

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania and from SELFINA!!  This is 35-year-old Selina A D., who is divorced with two children aged 8 and 14. Selina has been running  a beauty salon business since 2003, a place where her friends and fellow women can gather and literally let their hair down.  Most beauty salons in Tanzania are places where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, and made to look like your own.  It is quite a thing to be seen!

Selina works at her business ten hours a day, seven days a week, earning a monthly profit of approximately $200.  She is now requesting a loan of $775 in order to purchase an additional hair dryer, chairs, hair products such as wigs, and other cosmetics.  Due to the success of this business, she hopes to open another in the future, and she thanks you in advance for your support.

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase an additional hair dryer, chairs, hair products and other cosmetics

loans.name: Laide

texts.en: Laide E. lives in Ibadan, Nigeria. She is 42 years old and married with 4 children. She sells medicine. The demands for her medicine are high, and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She needs the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Teng

texts.en: Teng S. is 28 years old and stays at home doing housework and taking care of her young child. She and her husband have been married for about five years and live in Prey Veng province. To support the family, her husband has a business selling cows. On average, he makes about US$ 2 in profit per day. Mrs. Teng S. is asking for a loan to purchase cows for her husband for re-sell.

loans.use: To purchase cows for re-sale

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia P. is a 55-year-old married mother of one child. She asked for this loan to buy two piglets to raise. Besides raising pigs, Lucia also earns money by weaving items out of Nipa palm leaves and by running a sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.use: To buy two piglets

loans.name: Perpetual

texts.en: Perpetual D. has 1 child and received schooling through junior high school. Perpetual sells rice and cooking oil in Cape Coast, which she has done since 2008. Perpetual uses her income to pay for financial matters such as utilities and food. Perpetual will use the loan to expand the business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Perpetual plans to buy her own land.

loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie B. is a pig grower. She is 34 years old and has no children. Her husband, Gilbert B., is a farmer. They work together to save little amount for their future children. She started growing pigs since 2004 and has continued with this business as she enjoys doing the work. Aside from pigs, she also raises cows. She and her husband also manage a rice farm to earn extra living. She is asking a loan of PHP 15,000 from CEVI to buy feed for her pigs. The loan will help Rosie to increase the size of her piggery. She will also buy five more piglets from the loan. 

CEVI is reaching out to more people to start their own business. CEVI gives all its clients not only credit but also trainings and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase feed for the pigs

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 45-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their nine children. Mohammad has been working as a car painter since 2001. He requested a loan of 3000 US dollars from Al Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to purchase tools, paint, painting products and a new machine for his work. This is his fourth cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his work. Mohammad is special in his work because he does it well. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital, and his location was also poor. Mohammad decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by acquiring a painting oven.

loans.use: Mohammad will use the loan to purchase tools, paint, painting products and a new machine for his work.

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira is a firewood seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to the Ujamaa group (Code 2016). Every day she works at her business.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more firewood for resale, to expand her business. Subira is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Subira is 39 years old, married, and has three children: ages 20, three and one.

loans.use: Buy more firewood for resale.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda A. is from the town of Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 41 years old, married and has seven adult-aged children.

To make a living, Imelda prepared and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products such as viands in the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Imelda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI to purchase raw ingredients needed to make viands for sale.

Imelda is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP to repair her food stall used in the business. This loan will be the fourth taken out by Emelda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the needs of the family.

-------------------------------- About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Repair her food stall.

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila P. is a farmer and is 48 years old this year. She grows rice which she uses to feed her children and to buy the basic needs for their family. She owns the farm that she and her husband till. Farming is the only thing that sustains their family.

Now, Leonila is thinking of buying a quart of herbicides and insecticides as well as sacks of fertilizer. These will help facilitate a good harvest and income for her family. This is the very reason why she applied for a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI).

CEVI helps her achieve her long-term goal. She hopes that she will be able to grow her livelihood more in the future through CEVI’s help.

loans.use: To purchase a quart of herbicides and insecticdes as well as sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Sheriffatu

texts.en: Sheriffatu is 41 years old and married with four children. She sells provisions and hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: La señora Teresa de Jesús C., tiene la edad de 37 años, habita en el barrio San Ignacio, ubicado en la concepción, junto a su esposo, el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene cuatro hijos de 24, 18, 15,13, años, dos de ellos ya son casado y dos están a su cargo, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, desde hace 21 años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas que afectan al cultivo y la afectación del volcán , ella inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de sus padres , los planes futuros hacia su cultivo es diversificarlo .Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para mejorar el cultivo.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús C., age 37, lives in the San Ignacio neighborhood of La Concepción together with her husband, who assists her with household expenses. They have four children, ages 24, 18, 15, and 13, two of which are already married, and two are still at home. She plans to improve the quality of her family's life. She has been in the agriculture business for the last 21 years. Her major difficulties come from pests that affect plant growth and the behavior of the nearby volcano. Teresa de Jesús began farming through the support of her parents. Her future plans are to diversify her crops. With this loan she will buy fertilizer and supplies to improve her harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers for crops

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Mrs. Pov K. lives in Tuol Trea village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Ung Muny, is a motorbike taxi driver. He also uses the cart with his motor to transport the goods and passengers. Now he has a problem because of his cart can not transport. In order to deal this problem, Mrs. Pov K. decided to ask for a loan to fix the cart for her husband’s transporting. She is 23 years old and the mother of a child who is just one years old. Her husband is presented on the right of photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to fix the cart for her husband’s transporting.

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en: Kemi sells provisions and food. She is 41, married and has 2 children. She has been in the business for some time now. She is requesting a loan of N100, 000 to purchase more food to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food to sell

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en:
Shoira is an enterprising woman who is always happy to do good work. When she was young she had a big desire for self-improvement. She has been in the cattle breeding business for about 10 years. This allows her to support her three children, who are the motivation for all of her hard work. She wants to increase her investment capital to be able to keep supporting them. With your support Shoira will be able to buy new animals and expand her business. Thank you for supporting Shoira.    

About Tajikistan:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.  But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's history:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 43 year old man who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon with his wife. Mouhamad has owned a women's clothing shop since 1984. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for his shop especially since the winter season is coming soon. This is his third loan cycle and he has always repaid on time. 
His previous loans helped him diversify his merchandise and expand his stock. Mouhamad is special in his work because of his variety and quality of his sales. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work and use his experience in trading. In the future, he plans on growing his business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for his shop for the winter season

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta N. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old, is separated from her spouse, and has six school-aged children. Violeta owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling a variety of specialty foods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Violeta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Violeta is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: 07.1.4 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en: Nguyệt N. Thị (18) is a 51 year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Nguyệt is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 07.1.4 Nam Ngạn (02.07.1.4). Nguyệt is widowed and has 1 adult child. Nguyệt owns & operates a business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling rice products in the local community. Nguyệt has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,200,000 VND a month from these activities. In 2007, Nguyệt joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nguyệt has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nguyệt plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. T. Thị Hiếu (19) is a 61 year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business making & selling food. 2. Ngô Thị Nga (20) is a 45 year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business making & selling food. 3. Ngô Thị Lan (21) is a 38 year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 4. Lê Thị Nga (22) is a 54 year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business making & selling food. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Nguyệt N. Thị (18) là 51 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh hoá. Nguyệt là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 07.1.4 Nam Ngạn (02.07.1.4). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương. Nguyệt thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Nguyệt kiếm được khoảng 1.200.000 VND. Vào 2007, Nguyệt đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Nguyệt đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. T. Thị Hiếu (19) là 61 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 2. Ngô Thị Nga (20) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 3. Ngô Thị Lan (21) là 38 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. Lê Thị Nga (22) là 54 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela P. is 33 years old and has been married to Ever Cristaldo, who is 37 years old, for 14 years. They have two sons, 16 and 8 years old, both of whom are in school.

Estela started her business 4 years ago with a small amount of capital that her husband gave her, which he had saved up from his business in manufacturing furniture. Estela began to buy used clothes and re-sell them, and now has a clothing shop.

She wants her business to keep growing, and to increase her income. Her dream is to allow her children to go to university and grow up to be successful and well educated. She will use this loan to buy pants, shorts, shoes, blouses, children’s clothes, shirts, and shoes, in order to increase the variety in her store and satisfy her customers' demand.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Nolvia Damaris

texts.es:
la sra. Nolvia Damaris V. tiene 35 años de edad, vive en la colonia La Esperanza de la ciudad capital, tiene una tienda de ropa usada la cual esta ubicada en el mercado los Dolores, tiene 2 años de tener su tienda en dicho lugar. ahora la ropa la compra clasificada a $1.50 por pieza, pero le sale caro estar comprando a este precio y desea comprarla por fardos que sale mas barata. con las ganancias que tiene le ayuda a su esposo para el suento de su hogar. su esposo se dedica al mecanica.
desea comprar el fardo de ropa para tener bastante ropa para la epoca de navidad.
Nolvia tiene una hija pequeña.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nolvia Damaris V. is 35 years old and lives in the La Esperanza colony of the capital city. She has a used clothing store that is located in the Los Dolores market. She has had the store in this location for two years.

Right now she buys the clothes for $1.50 for each piece but it becomes expensive buy at this price and she wants to buy in bundles, which will come out much cheaper.

With the earnings she has, she helps her husband with their home maintenance. Her husband is a mechanic.

She wants to buy the bundle of clothing in order to have enough for the Christmas season.

Noliva has a small daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
El señor Jorge S. gran parte de su vida se ha dedicado a trabajar arduamente con el fin de brindarle excelentes condiciones de vida a su familia compuesta por su cónyuge y por sus tres hijos que están en edad escolar.

El señor Jorge se ha dedicado con mucho empeño a su trabajo porque anhela que sus hijos lleguen a triunfar en la vida y también porque requiere mejorar las instalaciones de su vivienda. Es por este motivo que el señor S. ha decidido invertir en la compra de los materiales de construcción para dar lugar de esta manera a la reconstrucción de dicha vivienda para la satisfacción propia y la de sus hijos.
texts.en:
For much of his life, Mr. Jorge S. has worked very hard to create an excellent quality of life for his family which includes his wife and their three school-aged children. Mr. Jorge has been so dedicated to his work because he longs for his children to succeed in life and also because he needs to improve the facilities in his home. It is for this reason that Mr. S. has decided to buy the construction materials in order to reconstruct his home for his own satisfaction and that of his children.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. P. Mom is twenty-nine years old and she lives in Trapeang Roka village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Pheng Non, are farmers who own a two-hectare field to cultivate rice. In this farming, they now face small problem because their field is infertile soil. Thus, Mrs. P. Mom is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to improve her field. With the remaining funds from the loan, she will buy pesticides and gasoline. Aside from farming, she is a Khmer noodle seller who can earn a small income to help her family. Mrs. P. Mom is a mother of two children who are too young to study or work. Mrs. P. Mom was busy with her work so her husband, Mr. Pheng Non, came to take out the loan on her behalf.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve her field and to buy pesticides and gasoline.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.fr: Née le 24 Mars 1977 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, B. Catherine vit depuis 11 ans environs à PK10 Vivotin dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Catherine est mariée à SINDEHOU Pinus et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble à PK 10. Catherine se joint à son mari pour assurer les charges de la famille. Catherine n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire. Il y a une dizaine d’année que Catherine mène comme activité, la vente de bouillie (faite à base de maïs et du sucre), accompagnée de pâtés (faits à base de farine de blé et d’huile). Catherine mène cette activité de façon ambulante et s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Catherine a déjà obtenu auprès de ALIDé, un crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Actuellement, Catherine ne dispose pas assez de fonds pouvant lui permettre de satisfaire le grand nombre de clients et de se faire plus de revenus à la hauteur de ses différentes charges. C’est donc pour renforcer son activité que Catherine sollicite un deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
Born on March 24, 1977 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Ms. B. Catherine has lived for about eleven year in PK10 Vivotin, in the community of Sèmè-Podji. She is married to Mr. SINDEHOU Pinus and is the mother of three children, who are all in school. The family lives together in PK 10. She joins her husband in ensuring that family expenses are covered. Catherine attended primary school only. For ten years, she has had a business selling porridge (made from corn and sugar) served with pâtés (made from wheat flour and oil). She operates this business from place to place. She stocks up at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She once obtained an ALIDé loan, which she repaid. Currently, she doesn't have enough funds allowing her to satisfy the large number of customers and to earn more revenues in line with her different responsibilities. And so, to bolster her business, Catherine is requesting a second loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying corn, wheat flour, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Melania Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Melania es una mujer trabajadora lleva muchos años trabajando como domestica para poder ayudar a los gastos básicos de su hogar. Tiene 45 años de edad y sus planes es poder terminar de hacer un cuarto que comenzó pero por falta de dinero no lo logro terminar el cual tiene cerrado con hojas de zinc, parte de la construcción ya que su objetivo con el préstamo que le dieron era terminar el cuarto pero no le alcanzo lo cual espera hacerlo con esta nueva solicitud. Su esposo es mecánico, pero su salario es bajo y tiene que apoyar a sus  dos hijos que tienen estudiando. Para comenzar la obra comprara: arena, cemento, cuartones, y zinc para terminar el cuarto y poder estar en mejores condiciones. Sus planes a futuro es poder poner un pequeño negocio en donde pueda estar en su casa ya que su trabajo es cansado y gana poco.
texts.en:
Sra. Melania has been working hard for many years as a housekeeper so that she can help with the basic household expenses. She is 45 years old and has plans of finishing a room that she started. However, she ran out of money and was not able to finish it and enclose it with sheets of zinc. Her previous loan was to cover part of the construction costs of this room, so she hopes to complete the job with this new request.

Melania’s husband is a mechanic, but his salary is low and is only enough to support their two children who are in school. In order to restart the construction work, she will buy materials such as sand, cement, joists, and zinc needed to finish the room and provide better living conditions. In the future, she hopes to start a small home business because her current job is tiring and pays very little.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction supplies needed to finish a room

loans.name: Rusallia

texts.en:
Rusallia is married and blessed with two children. One child usually attends school. She has been running a retail shop and a vegetable kiosk for eight years. Her business is located at Kambi Muru in Nairobi and she has one employee. She gets extra income from her husband’s salary. 

Since Rusallia joined Faulu Kenya, she has gained both financial and business management skills. She hopes to put her investment in a wholesale business in the future. She has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy maize flour, sugar, cereals, fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To add stock

loans.name: Thièyacine

texts.fr:
Monsieur Thiéyacine D. est un chauffeur transporteur depuis 20 ans. Il est très connu dans ce métier et il est l’un des responsables des chauffeurs de la ville de Thiès depuis 1996. Cet homme marié et père de 4 enfants compte dans son actif immobilier 2 voitures (cars de transort en commun) qui font le transport urbain dans la ville de Thiès.
Monsieur D., âgé de 53 ans, est à sa première demande de crédit depuis qu'il est membre de U-IMCEC en 2007. Il compte avec ce financement réfectionner une de ses voitures pour mieux tirer profits du business.
texts.en:
Mr. Thiéyacine D. has been a bus driver for the past 20 years. He is very well known in the business and has been one of the leading drivers of the city of Thies since 1996. He is married with four children, and owns two vehicles (transit buses) that are used for urban transport through Thies. Mr. D., who is 53 years old, is requesting a first loan from U-IMCEC, of which he is a member since 2007. This loan will allow him to overhaul one of his vehicles and profit more from his business.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: overhaul his transit bus

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en:
Sharofat H., 33 years old and married, is the loving mother of two children. She lives in Dushanbe and owns a small vending store in the local market. For about two years Sharofat has been selling the national coat “Chapan” for men and national dresses for women. Her store is well-known in the market for having a nice variety of assorted merchandise at affordable prices, and her profits have increased considerably since she started her business. Sharofat has a unique ability to analyze a merchandise market and find her niche, a skill that helped her start her business and make it successful. Today, in order to increase inventory and sales, she is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni. With your help this will be possible.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 39 years old and married with five children aged 5 to 13 years. All of them are attending school. He is a farmer in Chemororochi Town in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale. He has been in this business for 12 years selling his milk in the local market. Ali is also a carpenter offering his carpentry services in the local market. He has been in this business since 1998. 

He has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kshs 46,800 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. In the future he intends to diversify his personal farm and acquire four other dairy cows.

Ali is grateful to Juhudi because his family is now enjoying milk through the dairy cow he acquired with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Tièssiri, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne  36 ans,   5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Konobougou, sous préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et font le commerce d’articles divers tels les céréales, l’habillement, les articles de boutique, les condiments alimentaires, les  cosmétiques  etc.                                                                                     
Ces femmes du groupe Tièssiri sont à leur premier prêt de groupe et Koumba C. qui est dans le créneau des condiments alimentaires compte utiliser son prêt pour  se constituer un stock  de divers condiments alimentaires, le plus généralement à Bamako auprès des grossistes  et effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Konobougou et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.                                 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
All the women of the group Tièssiri average 36 years of age and five children each living in traditional extended families in Konobougou City, sub-prefecture of Barouéli, Region of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another though ties of community and kinship. And they do business in a variety of goods, such as grains, clothing, boutique items, condiments, etc. The women in the group are on their first group loan. Koumba C., whose niche is in condiments, intends to use her loan for building up a stock of various condiments, mostly in Bamako, from wholesalers. She sells locally, at the Konobougou market and at the surrounding fairs, and she accepts cash and credit from a customer base composed essentially of women and men. She plans on making an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover day-to-day family expenses, and the rest will be reinvested in business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying condiments

loans.name: Cosme

texts.es:
El señor Cosme A. M., tiene la edad 63 años con su señora esposa habita en la Comarca San José de los Ríos, ellos tiene 5 hijos, casados que se desempeñan en diferentes actividades, el señor Cosme se dedica a la agricultura y cuenta con más de 20 años de experiencia en este rubro.

El productor ha tenido la experiencia de cultivar diferente variedades de plantas y frutos, uno de los obstáculos que se le han presentado en el pasado, es el alza de los insumos agrícolas en los últimos años. Tomando en cuenta que sus tierras se encuentran en mal estado, es necesario hacer una fertilización foliar, con mejoras a las condiciones agrónomas y fitosanitarias, de tal manera que solicita un préstamo para la compra de matariles agrícolas, fertilizantes y pésticidas para brindarle un mantenimiento òptimo a los cultivos, y aporté a un aumento a las ventas, mejoras a su nivel de vida, y recursos economicos para proyecto a futuro que favorezca a toda la familia.
texts.en:
Cosme A. M., 63, lives with his wife in San José de los Ríos; they have 5 children who are married and in various occupations. Cosme is a farmer and has over 20 years experience in this line of work. He has grown a variety of fruits and plants. One of the obstacles he’s faced in the past is the rise in prices of farming supplies the last few years. Because his fields are in poor condition it’s necessary to apply fertilizers in order to improve soil and plant health. For this reason, he’s asking for funds to buy farming supplies, fertilizers and pesticides to provide optimum care to his crops in order to realize increased sales, improved living conditions and to have financial resources for future projects that will benefit the entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Savaet

texts.en:
Mrs. Savaet V. is a 28-year-old married woman and a villager who lives in Thmei village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Samnang Him, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they grow crops. Aside from farming, Mrs. Savaet V. is also raises pigs at home and is able to earn a small income to support her family.

For her pig business, Mrs. Savaet V. decided to ask for a loan to buy five piglets to raise. With the rest of the loan she wants to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support her farm crops.

This couple has three children: two are attending the local school while the youngest one is two years old. Her husband is shown with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy five piglets plus fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Moises Israel

texts.pt:
Moisés Israel M. nasceu no Distrito de Chongoene, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 6 filhos cuja as idades Ja não se lembra, mas os 2 mais novos vão a escola. Fez somente 1ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Gaza para Boane com seu pai ainda menor de idade. Actualmente trabalha como guarda segurança na empresa SOCEL ha mais de 24 anos, onde também possui um negócio próprio de compra e venda de cobertores. Neste negócio consegue um rendimento de cerca de 22.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua vizinha que Ja solicitou crédito nesta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 13.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar cobertores, duvetes e lençóis para aumentar a sua mercadoria.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para ampliar a sua residência e construir um estabelecimento comercial mais condigno.
texts.en:
Moisés Israel M. was born in Chongoene District, Gaza Province in southern Mozambique. He is married and has 6 children whose ages he does not remember right now, but the two youngest go to school. Moisés only finished first grade and did not continue with school because of financial difficulties. He lives in his own house with his family and does not support anyone else. He left Gaza to move to Boane with his father when he was still young. Moisés currently works as a security guard at SOCEL, where he has worked for more than 24 years. He also has a business buying and selling bedcovers. With this business he has an income of close to 22,000 meticais per month, which he uses for household expenses. He also saves some money through Xitique (a traditional system of rotating savings). Moisés has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku through his neighbor who had already requested a loan from this institution. This is his first loan. He is asking for 13,000 meticais to buy blankets, duvet covers and sheets to expand his inventory. He promises to pay off this loan on time so he can take out other loans. In the future he would like to ask for more loans to add on to his house and build a nicer shop.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase blankets, duvet covers and sheets

loans.name: Opal Amparo

texts.es:
la joven Opal Amparo Salazar tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres en la casa de un tio. 
Opal se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros, tambien vende zapatos, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 5 años, en los ratos que ella no esta en su negocio lo atiende su mama, ya que Opal tambien estudia en la universidad.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de dos fardos de ropa.
nos comento que se encuentra muy feliz ya que le estan saliendo bien ls cosas con su negocio y que desea ampliarlo en un futuro.
mas su sueño en lo personal es tener su titulo como doctora en medicina.
texts.en:
Opal Amparo Salazar is a 24 year old young woman. She is single, and she lives with her parents in her uncle’s house. Opal sells clothes for women and men. She also sells shoes. She has been doing this for five years. During the times she is not at her business her mother tends to it. Opal also attends the university. She will use the loan to buy bundles of clothes. She says that she is very happy because things are going well for her in her business. She wishes to expand it in the future. Her personal dream is to have her degree as a doctor of medicine.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bundles of used clothes

loans.name: Mrs. Sroeun Hang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
These fourteen members are villagers in Tuol Sang Ka village in Takeo province and they make up this village bank loan. Mrs. SrO. H. is the village bank president, selected by the other members. The members will use their portion of the loan in varied ways to support their businesses in the current year.

Mrs. SrO. H., 40 years old, is a farmer who owns a half-hectare (1.25-acre) plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice to sell to support her family living. Her husband, Mr. Heng Sor, is a fisherman.

Mrs. SrO. H. has a problem because it is time to plow her field but she does not have the money to do so. So, to improve production, she is asking for a loan to do farming.

Mrs. SrO. H. is the mother of four children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, another is a laborer, and the others are studying in the local public school.

loans.use: To grow a rice crop

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Mrs. Rachael C. is a 45-year-old mother. She is a wife to Mr. Luke Ifedha. Rachael resides in Bamburi, where her business for tailoring and lessos is located. She plans to purchase more lesso materials (traditional East African cotton print fabric) with the second loan she is requesting. She will use the anticipated profit to purchase an overlock machine to make her tailoring work to be of high quality. In the future, Rachael hopes to be a successful dressmaker and to be successful in life.

loans.use: To purchase more lesso materials with her second loan.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cotton material and ink at wholesale.

loans.name: Chu

texts.en:
H. Chu Thị is a 33-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To making a living, H. owns and operates a specialized retail store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling flowers in the local community.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4.500.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7.392.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business.  H. is now requesting a new loan of 9.632.000 VND that will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 5th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Chu Thị (20201030020) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, H. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các pH. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán hoa trong cộng đồng địa pH..  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 12 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 4.500.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thiết bị & dụng cụ mới để mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 9.632.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  H. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara V. S., tiene la edad de 53 años, es soltera y vive sola en su casa, no tiene hijos. Ella quiere  quiere comprar dos Cerdas de cría para que, cuando nazcan los cerditos de mes y medio de edad ,poderlos vender  y tener más ingresos económicos . Además tiene cerca de su casa una pequeña porqueriza  que desea darle utilidad en los ratos libres. En la actualidad trabaja en el comedor escolar de la comunidad,  El Socorro, pero  desea aumentar sus ingresos con la finalidad de ir haciendo un ahorro, pensando en su vejes y mejorar su calidad de vida.
